Introduction

fx-project is a 100% web-based project management and controlling system on internet/intranet basis. JavaScript elements are used to increase the user usability. This enables location-independent working for all project participants without prior installation of a program on a computer. A common browser is sufficient and the basis for a worldwide language-independent collaboration is created.




Why project management?


Recent studies (including Time Kontor) have shown that about 20% of projects fail, or are canceled (depending on the industry). If projects fail, this is mostly due to exceeded time and cost agreements. An important factor here are the resources in the form of qualified employees. Controlling is responsible for ensuring that deadlines can be met. fx-project supports project management in all necessary areas to ensure that a project reaches its planned goal in organisational terms.



Project management


When defining projects, all necessary information is recorded. In this process, a project can branch into any number of parts. Usually, a project consists of a mother project (= main project), which can be divided into any number of sub-projects (= collective projects or sub-projects). The subprojects can again be divided into tasks (= work packages), which represent the smallest project parts.





100% internet and intranet based


fx-project is 100% internet and intranet based. This means that users are independent of location and can check on the current status of their projects at any time.



Operating system independent


An enormous advantage of fx-project is that it is operating system independent.

(Server: Windows, LINUX or UNIX Sun Solaris, Client: any HTML 5.0 compatible browser)



Browser Independent


In addition to operating system independence, fx-project offers full browser independence. Whether Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Opera, Google Chrome or Apple Safari is used, fx-project is browser-independent and does not restrict the user's choice.



Database independent


fx-project comes standard for MS-SQL, PostgreSQL and Oracle.



Data security


Server-side SSL (Secure Socket Layer) encryption or VPN are, of course, available on request.



Multilingualism


Of course, a system that can be used worldwide must also have multilingualism, so fx-project. By default, fx-project is delivered in German and English. However, the entire system can be translated into other foreign languages in a short time.



Client capability


fx-project is multi-client capable. Each client is an independent self-contained system.



Data dictionary based information system


fx-project is built on a base system developed specifically for this purpose. All information is mapped centrally in a DataDictionary (DD) and is constantly in connection with the programs. Whether layout, report, help or documentation, the information always comes from the DD.

Software service

As a manufacturer, we offer an efficient software service, which is available to our customers for information and assistance regarding installation, operation and use of fx-project.

Thereby, the terms and conditions of the company FeRox (to be found on the Internet at www.ferox.de) or the provisions of the special software maintenance contract are to be observed.


The hotline of fx-project is available with the exception of holidays under the following times:

Monday to Thursday:

9:00 clock to 12:00 clock and 13:00 clock to 16:00 Uhr

Friday:

9:00 Uhr bis 12:00 Uhr


Hotline phone number Germany (+49) 851 / 96 671 - 0 or by e-mail to os@fx-project.org

System requirements

System requirements for fx-project are a supported operating system, the interpreter language PHP, a web server, a database system and a network card.

Here is the exact description of the requirements:


SERVER

Operating System:Windows Server 2012 or higher, Windows 7 or higher, Linux or Unix
Webserver:IIS Server: 7 or higher, Apache: 2.4 or higher (others on request)
DB System:PostgreSQL: 8 or higher, SQL Server: 2012 or higher (others on request)
Script Interpreter:PHP 7.2 or higher incl. IonCube PHP Loader for special programs
Network protocol:TCP/IP (SSL optional)
Network card:default

CLIENT

Webbrowser:at least Internet Edge, Firefox, Opera, Google Chrome (HTML 5.0 compatible browser, JavaScript required)

Program start and program end

fx-project is started via the link address in the browser that was provided to you by the administrator.

The user login mask is displayed on the start page. Enter the client no. assigned to you here, your username as well as your password.

If you have forgotten the password, contact your administrator to reset the password.

You can access the fx-project application (= login) by clicking on the [Login] button or by pressing the [Return] key .




To optionally exit the program (= logout), click the logout button in the top right navigation toolbar.

If you do not log out, fx-project remembers your login data for today, so you can continue working where you left off without logging in.

Working environment

After logging in, you will see the working environment in which you move around in fx-project.


The working environment of fx-project is divided into four main areas, which are described in more detail in the following pages:


Toolbar (at the top of the screen)

In addition to the fx-project logo and a search function, the toolbar contains the most important control options for fx-project, such as Control Center, Filters, Settings, Help, Logout, etc.


Menu bar (top, below the toolbar)

The individual program functions of fx-project are accessed via the functionally grouped menu items of the menu bar.


Workspace (centered, below the menu bar)

In the workspace of fx-project, the called program functions are processed incl. Selection of actions, input of data, display of reports or charts etc.


Footer (at the bottom of the screen)

The footer of fx-project contains user, date and time information as well as selection options of designs, languages and/or person units.

Toolbar

The toolbar of fx-project is located at the top of the screen and contains the most important control options for fx-project in addition to the fx-project logo and a search function.



Control Center

Calls the program function Control>General>Control Center. This shows an overview of all current actions, i.e. assigned tasks, appointments and other announcements or messages.


Back Button

The "Back Button" calls the program function which was last executed before the current program function.


Favorites

Using the popup for "Favorites", the last 20 (Last 20) or most frequent 20 (Top 20) program functions are listed and can be accessed with a click. This allows a quick change to the desired and frequently used program functions.


Filter / Portfolio Manager

The "Filter" can be used to reduce the amount of data for the individual program functions, e.g. for projects the status or project owner etc. can be restricted for all displayed project parts. In this way, reports on a large amount of data are restricted in a controlled manner and shortened accordingly. The filter combination can be saved under a filter name. This makes it easy to create and retrieve multiple project portfolios.


Settings

The popup for "Settings" allows additional and/or optional display options to be enabled for the current program function.


Help

The popup for "Help" displays detailed help documentation for the current program function.


Info

Calls the program function Administration>Help>Info. This displays information regarding this fx-project version such as version number, patch, database, browser and logged in users etc.


Logout

To optionally exit the program (= logout) click on the logout button in the upper right corner.


Search field

The "search field" at the top right allows a quick entry into the desired program function. It is sufficient to enter a part of the search term, e.g. "travel", to display all program functions in which travel plays a role. The prerequisite for calling up the desired program functions is, of course, the authorization for the respective programs, which can be activated and assigned with Administration>Profile/User>Profile Program Assignment.

Menu bar

The menu bar of fx-project is located at the top below the toolbar and is used to call up the individual program functions via corresponding menu items.


The menu only contains programs from the assigned profiles of the logged-in person, i.e. programs for which the user is authorized.

The program functions are functionally grouped and usually contain several selection levels.

Workspace

The fx-project workspace is located in the middle of the screen between the top menu bar and the bottom footer bar.


The work area naturally takes up the most space and usually consists of five parts:

Breadcrumb (top left)



Navigation path to the current program function, for example, to quickly find a higher-level path, or to be able to call up the current program function again.

Breadcrumb (top left)



Navigation path to the current program function.For example, quickly a parent path, or to be able to call the current program function again.


Action tab (top right)



Listing of possible and allowed actions for the program function. Here you can choose between [View], [New creation], [Modify] or [Delete].


Program name and mask buttons (frame header above)



After entering the data in the masks, the selected action is executed after clicking on the corresponding "mask button" at the top right of the frame header, for example "Save".

The whole workspace can be maximized or
subsequently normalized again by clicking on the icon.


Mask(s) (Main Area)


The "Mask Area" displays the masks for the called program functions. A program function can consist of one or more submasks.


Feedback slider (right)


The "Feedback slider" displays success and/or warning or error messages, which occurred after the performed action triggered by the click on a "mask button".

(for more info on the feedback slider see the following page)

Feedback slider

The "feedback slider" is located on the right side of the screen and can be opened



or closed.




The "feedback slider" gives information about the success of the last action or shows warnings and error messages that occurred, e.g. if a required field was not specified or similar. In case of a warning or error, the slider is automatically expanded after clicking on "Save" or similar - in case of success, however, it is collapsed.

The status of the confirmations is displayed with the usual traffic light colors, i.e.

Red =A fatal error occurred - the data was not saved.
Yellow =A warning has occurred and should be heeded. Depending on the severity of the warning, the data may or may not have been saved anyway. If the data was saved, an additional "green" ampelicon will also appear.
Green =All OK, the data was saved successfully.

Project menu (project slider)

The project menu, or project slider, is located on the left side of the screen and is used for quick project entry at any level.

The project slider is the bottom of the two slider elements on the left.

Approaching with the mouse cursor, the subtle "tab" becomes larger and labeled. By clicking on this "tab", the project menu can be expanded and collapsed.

Opened, the user gets an overview of the project structure of all authorized projects. The number of projects displayed can be controlled by the "Filter".



Within the project workflow menu, the user has the following control options:

Expand all projects.
Collapse all projects.
Refresh Project Menu
Sort by project name.
Sort by project number


Individual project levels can be expanded or collapsed by clicking on the respective nodes.

By clicking on the project number of the desired project, all project sublevels of this project can be expanded or collapsed at once.

By clicking on the project name of the desired project with either the left or right mouse button, a project menu specially adapted for this project opens with e.g. the following workflow actions, depending on the project type and authorization:



The following options may be available for the respective action:

Call program function in the mode: Display.
Call program function in mode: New creation
Call program function in mode: Change
Call program function in mode: Delete

Workflow menu (workflow slider)

The workflow menu, also called workflow slider, is located on the left side of the screen and is used to call up the program functions with visual support.

The workflow slider is the upper of the two slider elements on the left side.

Approaching with the mouse cursor, the subtle "tab" becomes larger and labeled. By clicking on this "tab", the workflow menu can be expanded and collapsed.

Opened, the user gets an overview of all main sections of authorized program functions.



Within the workflow menu, the user has the following control options:

Black and white display → Switch to color display.
color display → Switch to black and white display


By clicking on the respective menu items, you can navigate through to the desired program functions.



The following options may be available for the respective action:

Invoke program function in mode: show.
call program function in mode: new creation
Call program function in mode: Modify
Call program function in mode: delete

Footer

The footer at the bottom of the screen provides useful user information and setting options, which are described in detail below.





User information (bottom left)



Client number and logged in user are always visible. If you move the mouse cursor over the display, detailed user information is shown in a tooltip (e.g. role, email, etc.).


Language



The current language setting is displayed here by the respective country flag. By default, "German" is stored as the base language. In the special programs, "English" can be added as an additional option. By clicking on the respective country flag, the language setting can be changed at any time.


UID - (User Interface Design)



Clicking on the "UID icon" opens a design menu where you can choose from predefined and, if necessary, individually created design templates. This setting remains even after logout and is already preset for the next login.


Personal unit



In various program functions, it can be useful to be able to quickly adjust the person unit for calculating project effort. Depending on the client setting value (Administration>Client>Client Settings), the unit can be changed immediately with a click on the icon in the footer.

The following units are available for selection:

Hrs.
PD
PW
PM
PY		=
=
=
=		Hours
Person-days
Person-weeks
Person-months
Person-years


Time span format



The currently set time span format is displayed here. In various program functions it can be useful to be able to quickly adjust the time span format, i.e. clicking on the format in the footer will toggle between hour format "0:00" and decimal format "0.00".
A time span of 1 hour and 15 minutes is displayed in hour format as "1:15", and in decimal format as "1.25".


Page status



The page status indicates whether a page has just been reloaded, or whether a user action such as a click or similar has already occurred. This information can be important for test automation software to determine if a page has already been saved and rebuilt.

The following two states exist:

New, meaning no user action has been taken yet.
Edited, i.e. a user action has already been performed.


Date & time



The current date and time are displayed. If you move the mouse cursor over the date, you will get the time difference to the server where fx-project is hosted as an information tooltip. This information is important if you are in different time zones or if there has been a time change from summer to winter time or vice versa.


Response time



Specifies the duration of the program processing time for the called program function.

Program types

Basically, there are three different types of programs in fx-project: default programs, administrator programs and user programs.

1. Standard Programs.
Standard programs are program functions that are automatically assigned to each user without any special assignment of rights, such as user preference, password, filter, etc. This means at the same time that every new user needs at least as many license points as necessary for the standard programs.

2. Admin Programs.
Admin programs are special program functions that can only be used by the main administrator or a user with administrator rights, such as the new creation of clients, users or special programs to reset the password for a user.

3. User Programs.
User programs are program functions that can be assigned to any normal user, such as time tracking, control center, scheduler, etc.

General procedure for defining a project

In order to be able to create a project, some prerequisites have to be met so that the mandatory fields can be filled in during input:


Create client:

When defining the project, it is important that the principals have already been entered in the Creation>Customers>Basic Data program function. In addition, the contact person must be defined in Creation>Customers>Contact Person. Only if these requirements are met, a project can also be assigned to a principal.


Employee data:

In order to be able to plan a project completely, all employees involved in the project should be created in the program functions Creation>Employees>Basic Data or Creation>Contractors>Basic Data beforehand. Likewise, the settings regarding working time and availability should be correctly stored in the respective additional data.
The resource planning is then done either in the function Planning>Persons>Assign Person Resources (HR) or most simply directly in the graphical project planning Planning>Projects>Matrix: Graphically as Gantt.


Determine project manager, deputy project manager and project manager:

In order to select a project manager, the appropriate employee roles must be assigned to the desired individuals. To do this, first go to the program function Creation>Employees>Roles (for internal persons) or Creation>Contractors>Roles (for external persons) and assign a special "employee role" to the corresponding employee, in this case project manager or project manager.


In addition, special skills of the employees can be stored, so that employees with special knowledge can be found more quickly during resource planning. These skills are also stored in the project, in order to be able to make later appropriate evaluations on projects. In Administration>Skills>Skill Groups and Administration>Skills>Skills, the characteristics of these skills can be defined individually as a group and subgroup.


Creating a project:

Once the above requirements are met, the desired project can be defined in Creation>Projects>Create Main Project. In the second step, using the graphical input in Planning>Projects>Matrix: Graphically as Gantt, the project can be designed in the matrix, the effort can be planned, The project details can be set and the resources can be assigned.

Creation > Client > Basic Data

Main information of the client system


Management (creation, modification or deletion) of the basic data of clients such as name, personal picture, address or communication data. Deleting a client destroys all existing data of this client. Client no. 1 is indispensable for working with fx-project and therefore cannot be deleted.




Selection


In this sub-menu the person/company name to be edited is selected. If it is a program function for employee data (ext./int.) the selection field Inactive is additionally activated for selection. If the field Inactive is activated, also person groups which are no longer active are displayed.



Field Descriptions

Client:

Select the client to be edited or displayed.

Sort Communication:

Setting how to sort the communication data to be displayed.


Select

After a click on this button the corresponding data of the selected client will be loaded and displayed for editing or viewing.




Summary of information


People Overview

In the mask Summary of information you get a complete overview of the over- and under-organized persons.



Field Descriptions

Overview:

Overview gives a short overview of the selected person.




Definition


Main data of a client

Definition stores the most important data for a client and thus defines it.

In the new creation mode, an administrator must also be created and a client from which the Administration>Client>Reference Values are to be transferred must be selected.

After the successful creation, the administrator can immediately log in to the new client. To do this, he takes the new client ID from the confirmation message.



Field Descriptions

Client No.:

Internal key for identifying a client. A client is a legally independent company.

Organizational units within a company are not considered to be clients.

Name:

The name of the client is entered in this field.

Image:

Assigned image in PNG, JPG, GIF or BMP format.

Name affix:

Administration>Skills>Skill Groups is an extension of the field Control>General>Control Center. Here additional information can be stored, which possibly had no place in the upper field.

Identif. No.:

Identification No. stores initials, customer numbers, or any other type of number for a person.

Table for freely variable values:

Table for freely changeable values. Here the user can individually extend table information, e.g. address type, salutation, title of persons, etc.

Valid from:

Date from which a record is valid.

Valid to:

Date until when a record is valid.

Inactive:

A check mark in Department indicates people who should be hidden (employees who have left, old customers, ...).
Checked in Selection, the field also causes the inactive persons to be displayed with the addition "inactive".

Inactivating a client also causes it to be completely locked and no one can log in anymore.

User Name:

In this field, the user name is displayed or entered in text form (maximum 20 characters).

This can be structured according to the naming convention of the client and is normally managed by the administrator.

Suggestions for the naming convention: first name, last name, initials or a name chosen by the user.

Password:

A personal password must be entered in this field. For your own security, the password should be at least six characters long, should not contain any "$" special characters, etc., and should not consist of any easily guessable sequences of letters or numbers such as "123456", "654321", "qwertz" etc.

The password is stored internally in encrypted form, so that a new password must be requested if it is "forgotten".

E-Mail-Address:

The e-mail address is displayed or entered in this field.

Repeat Password:

Please enter the new password again to avoid typos.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Delete Add.

Delete additional data (= address and communication data) of the person/company

By clicking on the button Delete Add. Data all selected additional data, i.e. address and communication data of the person/company will be deleted.

Delete Company

Delete entire person or company, including all additional data.

By clicking on the button Delete Person the entire selected person or company including their additional data such as pictures, address and communication data will be deleted.
A person or company cannot be deleted if there are still subordinate persons to it.




Addresses


Address management

The submask Addresses stores addresses for the selected person/company. The number of empty entries can be determined by the program function Administration>Users>User Settings. The different types of addresses are maintained in Administration>Client>Reference Values with Address Type.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

A check mark in Checkbox indicates that this entry should be deleted.

Address Type:

In Address Type you select the address type of the address.

State:

State contains the state of the address.

Street:

Street contains street and house number of the address.

Cntry:

Country Code contains the country code of the address.

Code:

Creation>Contractors>Roles contains the postal code of the address.

Place:

City/Town contains the location of the address.

1307:

Horizontal line




Communication


Communication management

In mask Communication all relevant information on how to reach a person (except the address) can be stored. New types are maintained in Administration>Client>Reference Values with Communication Type.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

A check mark in Checkbox indicates that this entry should be deleted.

Communicat.Type:

In Communication Type, the communication type is selected. "Default" types are displayed in Summary of information.

Number:

Number contains the communication number (phone number, e-mail address, ...).

Annotation:

Annotation contains additional information about the number (validity, availability times, ...).

1307:

Horizontal line

Creation > Client > Contact Person

Contact persons of the client system


Management (creation, modification or deletion) of the contact person data of clients such as name, gender, title, identification number, personal picture, address or communication data. The main administrator of a client is indispensable to work with fx-project, therefore it cannot be deleted.




Selection


In this sub-menu the person/company name to be edited is selected. If it is a program function for employee data (ext./int.) the selection field Inactive is additionally activated for selection. If the field Inactive is activated, also person groups which are no longer active are displayed.



Field Descriptions

Person:

blank

Sort Communication:

Setting how to sort the communication data to be displayed.


Select

A click on this button confirms the selection of the person and loads the corresponding data for editing or viewing.




Summary of information


People Overview

In the mask Summary of information you get a complete overview of the over- and under-organized persons.



Field Descriptions

Overview:

Overview gives a short overview of the selected person.




Definition


People management

Definition stores the most important data for a person as well as their assignment. Field Job Description is only a definition without special rights for data access and can be changed in program function Administration>Client>Reference Values with Job Description. Project managers with corresponding rights etc. are defined in the program function Creation>Employees>Skills/Abilities! Field Department can be managed in program function Administration>Departments>Department Administration.



Field Descriptions

Salutation:

In Administration>Skills>Skills the salutation of a person can be selected.

Sex:

In this field the gender of a person is selected, e.g. "male" or "female".

Image:

Assigned image in PNG, JPG, GIF or BMP format.

Name:

This field contains the last name of the contact person of the client.

Customer (Client):

Here you can select the client of the activity (project, subproject or task).

First Name:

This field stores the first name of the client's contact person.

Department:

Indicates the department in which the employee works.

Name affix:

Administration>Skills>Skill Groups is an extension of the field Control>General>Control Center. Here additional information can be stored, which possibly had no place in the upper field.

Job Description:

In Job Description the job description under which the person has been hired is selected.

Identif. No.:

Identification No. stores initials, customer numbers, or any other type of number for a person.

Title:

In Administration>Users>User Settings the title of a person can be selected.

Allocated to:

Allocated to Object included the parent.
$message_274;: -
$message_2090;: $message_274;
$message_275;: $message_275;
$message_840;: $message_2091;
$message_276;: -
Customer - Contact Person: Customer
$message_1372;: $message_275;
$message_841;: $message_1372;
$message_2091;: -
$message_2092;: $message_2092;

Valid from:

Date from which a record is valid.

Valid to:

Date until when a record is valid.

Inactive:

A check mark in Department indicates people who should be hidden (employees who have left, old customers, ...).
Checked in Selection, the field also causes the inactive persons to be displayed with the addition "inactive".

Inactivating a client also causes it to be completely locked and no one can log in anymore.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Delete Add.

Delete additional data (= address and communication data) of the person/company

By clicking on the button Delete Add. Data all selected additional data, i.e. address and communication data of the person/company will be deleted.

Delete Company

Delete entire person or company, including all additional data.

By clicking on the button Delete Person the entire selected person or company including their additional data such as pictures, address and communication data will be deleted.
A person or company cannot be deleted if there are still subordinate persons to it.




Addresses


Address management

The submask Addresses stores addresses for the selected person/company. The number of empty entries can be determined by the program function Administration>Users>User Settings. The different types of addresses are maintained in Administration>Client>Reference Values with Address Type.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

A check mark in Checkbox indicates that this entry should be deleted.

Address Type:

In Address Type you select the address type of the address.

State:

State contains the state of the address.

Street:

Street contains street and house number of the address.

Cntry:

Country Code contains the country code of the address.

Code:

Creation>Contractors>Roles contains the postal code of the address.

Place:

City/Town contains the location of the address.

1307:

Horizontal line




Communication


Communication management

In mask Communication all relevant information on how to reach a person (except the address) can be stored. New types are maintained in Administration>Client>Reference Values with Communication Type.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

A check mark in Checkbox indicates that this entry should be deleted.

Communicat.Type:

In Communication Type, the communication type is selected. "Default" types are displayed in Summary of information.

Number:

Number contains the communication number (phone number, e-mail address, ...).

Annotation:

Annotation contains additional information about the number (validity, availability times, ...).

1307:

Horizontal line




M000388

Creation > Customers > Basic Data

Customer/initiator of a project - usually a company or your own company for internal projects


Management (new creation, modification or deletion) of the basic data of clients such as name, title, identification number, personal picture, address or communication data.




Selection


In this sub-menu the person/company name to be edited is selected. If it is a program function for employee data (ext./int.) the selection field Inactive is additionally activated for selection. If the field Inactive is activated, also person groups which are no longer active are displayed.



Field Descriptions

Person:

blank

Sort Communication:

Setting how to sort the communication data to be displayed.


Select

A click on this button confirms the selection of the person and loads the corresponding data for editing or viewing.




Summary of information


People Overview

In the mask Summary of information you get a complete overview of the over- and under-organized persons.



Field Descriptions

Overview:

Overview gives a short overview of the selected person.




Definition


People management

Definition stores the most important data for a person as well as their assignment. Field Job Description is only a definition without special rights for data access and can be changed in program function Administration>Client>Reference Values with Job Description. Project managers with corresponding rights etc. are defined in the program function Creation>Employees>Skills/Abilities! Field Department can be managed in program function Administration>Departments>Department Administration.



Field Descriptions

Salutation:

In Administration>Skills>Skills the salutation of a person can be selected.

Sex:

In this field the gender of a person is selected, e.g. "male" or "female".

Image:

Assigned image in PNG, JPG, GIF or BMP format.

Name:

Control>General>Control Center contains the name of the person.

Customer (Client):

Here you can select the client of the activity (project, subproject or task).

First Name:

First Name stores the first name of a person.

Department:

Indicates the department in which the employee works.

Name affix:

Administration>Skills>Skill Groups is an extension of the field Control>General>Control Center. Here additional information can be stored, which possibly had no place in the upper field.

Job Description:

In Job Description the job description under which the person has been hired is selected.

Identif. No.:

Identification No. stores initials, customer numbers, or any other type of number for a person.

Title:

In Administration>Users>User Settings the title of a person can be selected.

Allocated to:

Allocated to Object included the parent.
$message_274;: -
$message_2090;: $message_274;
$message_275;: $message_275;
$message_840;: $message_2091;
$message_276;: -
Customer - Contact Person: Customer
$message_1372;: $message_275;
$message_841;: $message_1372;
$message_2091;: -
$message_2092;: $message_2092;

Valid from:

Date from which a record is valid.

Valid to:

Date until when a record is valid.

Inactive:

A check mark in Department indicates people who should be hidden (employees who have left, old customers, ...).
Checked in Selection, the field also causes the inactive persons to be displayed with the addition "inactive".

Inactivating a client also causes it to be completely locked and no one can log in anymore.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Delete Add.

Delete additional data (= address and communication data) of the person/company

By clicking on the button Delete Add. Data all selected additional data, i.e. address and communication data of the person/company will be deleted.

Delete Company

Delete entire person or company, including all additional data.

By clicking on the button Delete Person the entire selected person or company including their additional data such as pictures, address and communication data will be deleted.
A person or company cannot be deleted if there are still subordinate persons to it.

Cntry:

Code:

Creation>Contractors>Roles contains the postal code of the address.

Place:

City/Town contains the location of the address.

Cost master data block


Universal mask for assigning any cost master data like cost unit, cost center, cost type etc. to different objects like master project, task, employee, material etc.



Field Descriptions

Text:

Name of the employee

Text:

Cost object

Cost Unit:

A cost object is an object to which costs are allocated in business accounting. Usually, this is understood to be a good or service. However, other objects can also be selected as cost objects in business cost accounting, such as a process (activity-based costing), a project (project costing) or a customer (customer profitability accounting).

Text:

Cost center

Cost Center:

Cost center accounting is a component of operational cost accounting. A cost center is a spatially or organizationally delimited location of an organization where costs are incurred. Cost centers correspond, for example, to individual departments, individual machines, individual projects, individual persons or other delimited groupings.

Text:

Cost type

Cost Element:

The cost element categorizes costs incurred in cost accounting according to their own nature. Here, each cost element corresponds to an assigned task.

Text:

Activity type

Service Type:

The activity type in cost accounting is a reference value that indicates the qualitative technical description of the production activity. Here, it can be classified between productive (=value-adding) and non-productive types.




Addresses


Address management

The submask Addresses stores addresses for the selected person/company. The number of empty entries can be determined by the program function Administration>Users>User Settings. The different types of addresses are maintained in Administration>Client>Reference Values with Address Type.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

A check mark in Checkbox indicates that this entry should be deleted.

Address Type:

In Address Type you select the address type of the address.

State:

State contains the state of the address.

Street:

Street contains street and house number of the address.

Cntry:

Country Code contains the country code of the address.

Code:

Creation>Contractors>Roles contains the postal code of the address.

Place:

City/Town contains the location of the address.

1307:

Horizontal line




Communication


Communication management
