Annotation:

Annotation contains additional information about the number (validity, availability times, ...).

1307:

Horizontal line

Creation > Employees > Contract Data

Contract data of an internal employee, such as entry/exit date, standard hourly rate, working hours, working days, annual leave, date of birth, etc.


Additional data for employees, which can be scheduled as resources, e.g. entry and exit date, target working hours per week, standard EC or CC, account details, etc. Furthermore, it is possible to determine on which days of the week an employee works or has time off, as well as their capping hours.




Person selection


Selection of one or more persons from a list depending on the program function.

To create or edit persons, switch to the corresponding program function under the main menu item Master data.



Field Descriptions

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.


Select

A click on this button confirms the selection of the person and loads the corresponding data for editing or viewing.




Contract data


Employee data

With the help of this mask all relevant additional data of an employee can be edited.

Some values, e.g. Cost per Hour or Yield per Hour are relevant for resource planning. They are preset there as default values, but can be adjusted from project to project.

In connection with the working hours per day or per week, restrictions may occur (depending on your system settings). In this case, you must follow any error messages or adjust your system settings.



Field Descriptions

Name:

In this field the family name of the person or the name of the legal entity (e.g. company name) is displayed or entered.

Religion:

Religious affiliation of a person, e.g. Roman Catholic, Protestant, Greek Orthodox, etc.

GIF-Picture:

Assigned image in PNG, JPG, GIF or BMP format.

Maiden Name:

The birth name of a person can be entered in this field if it differs from the family name.

Birthday:

The date of birth of a person must be entered in this field in the format selected in the "User settings".

Company Address:

In this field, an entry must be selected from a selection of possible references to company (or branch) addresses.

PP:

This is the monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial expenditure for the company per hour of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to VK=sales price).

Entry Date:

The entry date of a person, i.e. since when the employee has been employed by the company, must be entered in this field.

Mobile Area:

In the field, an entry is selected from a list of possible operational areas for the employee. This entry specifies in which federal states or countries the employee is available on a mobile basis.

SP:

This is the monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial return for the company per day of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to EK=purchase price).

Leave Date:

This field can be used to enter a person's leaving date, i.e. until when the employee was employed by the company.

Working Hours/Week:

This field displays the number of working hours to be worked by an employee (per week) and on which days the employee is available as a resource.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Workdays:

Indicates how many days the employee is contractually required to work per week.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Mon:

This field can be used to check whether the resource is available on Monday or not.

Tue:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Tuesday or not.

Wed:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Wednesday or not.

Thu:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Thursday or not.

Fri:

In this field you can check whether the resource is available on Friday or not.

Sat:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Saturday (weekend) or not.

Sun:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Sunday (weekend) or not.

Working Start Time:

Indicates at what time the employee (usually) should / must appear for work.
This information also affects the display of the calendar, i.e. if 10:00 is entered here for an employee with a daily working time of 8 hours, then the period from 10:00 to 18:00 is displayed in the calendar, taking into account any existing break
.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Break:

In Break, the duration of the break the employee is entitled to, in hours.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Time Period:

Displays the runtime of the project in a combined field.

Vacation/Year:

Shows the employee's vacation per year (in days).

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Rem. Vac.:

Displays the remaining vacation for the year.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Bank Code:

The unique bank code of the employee's bank details can be entered in this field.

IBAN:

The IBAN (= International Bank Account Number) is an international, standardized notation for bank account numbers.

Composition of IBAN:

  1. 2-digit country code (consisting of letters)
    2. .
  2. 2-digit check digits (consisting of digits)
    3. .
  3. Max. 30-digit BBAN (= Basic Bank Account Number), i.e. the account identification (consisting of letters and/or digits)



The IBAN can comprise a maximum of 34 digits. A German IBAN always has exactly 22 digits, as it consists of the 2-digit country code DE, followed by a 2-digit check digit, followed by the 8-digit bank code, followed by the 10-digit account number. Shorter account numbers are extended to 10 digits with leading zeros.

Bank Account No.:

The account number of the employee's bank account is entered in this field.

BIC:

The BIC (= Bank Identifier Code or SWIFT address) is an internationally standardized code that uniquely identifies each directly or indirectly participating partner worldwide.

The BIC has a length of 8 or 11 alphanumeric characters with the following composition:

  1. 4-digit bank code (consisting of digits)
    2. .
  2. 2-digit country code (consisting of digits)

  3. 2-digit location coding (consisting of digits and/or numbers)

  4. 3-digit coding of the branch or department (consisting of digits and/or numbers)

Handicapped:

This field specifies whether the employee has a severe disability or not.

Flextime:

This field indicates whether the worker is entitled to work in floating day.

If the user is authorized to do so, he can book time records to "Floating day" within the time recording.

This allows the user to enter a floating day for e.g. Friday, if he has already fulfilled his target until Thursday.

By making this entry, the user is also prevented from being registered via the time recording check program, even though he has already worked the necessary hours.

Time Recording Check:

To control the daily time recording, a check program can run in the scheduler which checks whether the time recording has been carried out correctly.

If this value is set, the check is carried out in the scheduler and the employee receives a notification if there is no or an incorrect time recording.

If this value is not set, the check in the scheduler is not performed.

Time Restriction:

Specifies whether time restrictions per day are to be adhered to during time recording, i.e. if this value is set, the time recording hours per day may not exceed the set limit value defined for the client.

If this value is not set, the full 24 hours can be recorded daily.

Internal Annotation:

This field is used to annotate a project for internal purposes only.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Creation > Employees > Roles

Roles of an internal employee such as general management, project management, etc.


Administration of defined company roles such as "Management", "Project Management", "Administration" etc. or of freely definable project responsibility roles of the int. employees. The assignment of company roles has an effect on the person and project rights that this employee is allowed to see by default.




Person selection


Selection of one or more persons from a list depending on the program function.

To create or edit persons, switch to the corresponding program function under the main menu item Master data.



Field Descriptions

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.


Select

A click on this button confirms the selection of the person and loads the corresponding data for editing or viewing.




personal skills


Listing of an employee's skills for one or more groups.

A checkbox determines whether the employee has a skill or not.

If yes, additional information about the employee's ability can be entered in further fields, e.g. how much experience he already has in an area or how good his knowledge is in it.

In addition, internal remarks can be noted in a comment field, such as important notes or similar.

An important capability is the so-called co-worker role. By assigning these roles, the person inherits special rights, which are explained in more detail in the notes section.

NOTE:
Management
A person with the Management role has all rights to every project and document by default, and is allowed to see all information about every person except for the persons private appointments.
Project Management
Only one person with the role Project Management can be assigned to projects as project manager. This person then automatically has display rights on all sublevels of a project to which they are assigned. However, it may only make changes at the parent project level by default, unless it has been granted rights elsewhere.
Project Lead
Only a person with the role Project Lead can be assigned to projects as project lead or deputy project lead. This person then has all rights to the projects he/she is assigned to by default. In addition, this person is the only person besides the resource planner authorized to assign resources to a project..

Resource Planning
A person with the role Resource Planning has by default display rights on all projects and is allowed to assign resources besides the project manager. Consequently, this also means that they are allowed to see all people in this program function.
Administration
A person with the role Administration is allowed to see all information about each person except the personal appointments of the persons.



Field Descriptions

Del.:

Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

Skill Name:

This field contains the names of the skills of the individual persons, e.g. "English", "Russian" or similar as skills for the group "foreign languages".

Exp.:

This field indicates how long an employee has possessed a particular skill, that is, how many years of experience he or she already has.

Evaluation:

The level of knowledge of a skill is to be entered in this field. The standard evaluation is based on school grades (1 = "very good", 2 = "good", ..., 6 = "insufficient").

Comment:

This field can be used to enter additional comments about an employee's ability, such as internal remarks, important notes, or the like .

Edited:

In this field, the user name is displayed or entered in text form (maximum 20 characters).

This can be structured according to the naming convention of the client and is normally managed by the administrator.

Suggestions for the naming convention: first name, last name, initials or a name chosen by the user.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Creation > Employees > Skills/Abilities

Skills and abilities of an internal employee


Management of freely definable skills of int. employees. The assignment of skills can be used e.g. for filtering and searching resources.




Person selection


Selection of one or more persons from a list depending on the program function.

To create or edit persons, switch to the corresponding program function under the main menu item Master data.



Field Descriptions

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.


Select

A click on this button confirms the selection of the person and loads the corresponding data for editing or viewing.




personal skills


Listing of an employee's skills for one or more groups.

A checkbox determines whether the employee has a skill or not.

If yes, additional information about the employee's ability can be entered in further fields, e.g. how much experience he already has in an area or how good his knowledge is in it.

In addition, internal remarks can be noted in a comment field, such as important notes or similar.

An important capability is the so-called co-worker role. By assigning these roles, the person inherits special rights, which are explained in more detail in the notes section.

NOTE:
Management
A person with the Management role has all rights to every project and document by default, and is allowed to see all information about every person except for the persons private appointments.
Project Management
Only one person with the role Project Management can be assigned to projects as project manager. This person then automatically has display rights on all sublevels of a project to which they are assigned. However, it may only make changes at the parent project level by default, unless it has been granted rights elsewhere.
Project Lead
Only a person with the role Project Lead can be assigned to projects as project lead or deputy project lead. This person then has all rights to the projects he/she is assigned to by default. In addition, this person is the only person besides the resource planner authorized to assign resources to a project..

Resource Planning
A person with the role Resource Planning has by default display rights on all projects and is allowed to assign resources besides the project manager. Consequently, this also means that they are allowed to see all people in this program function.
Administration
A person with the role Administration is allowed to see all information about each person except the personal appointments of the persons.



Field Descriptions

Del.:

Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

Skill Name:

This field contains the names of the skills of the individual persons, e.g. "English", "Russian" or similar as skills for the group "foreign languages".

Exp.:

This field indicates how long an employee has possessed a particular skill, that is, how many years of experience he or she already has.

Evaluation:

The level of knowledge of a skill is to be entered in this field. The standard evaluation is based on school grades (1 = "very good", 2 = "good", ..., 6 = "insufficient").

Comment:

This field can be used to enter additional comments about an employee's ability, such as internal remarks, important notes, or the like .

Edited:

In this field, the user name is displayed or entered in text form (maximum 20 characters).

This can be structured according to the naming convention of the client and is normally managed by the administrator.

Suggestions for the naming convention: first name, last name, initials or a name chosen by the user.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Creation > Employees > Annual Vacation

Management of annual leave and/or carry-over of previous year's leave


The annual leave of each internal employee can be changed here comfortably, as well as a carry-over value from the previous year can be set.




Person selection


Define selection criteria to filter the persons to be listed for which annual leave is to be displayed and/or defined.



Field Descriptions

Search Text:

This field is used to enter the string to search for.

Time Span from:

This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Active Employee:

This checkbox can be used to select whether all employees who match the selection criteria should be displayed or only those employees who have a displayable active record in this period.

Checkbox ticked = Only employees who have a displayable active record.

Department:

Indicates the department in which the employee works.

Time Span to:

This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Display History:

If this checkbox is ticked, an additional history is displayed in addition to the normal data.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




Previous year's holiday


Previous year's holiday

Enter the leave from the previous year if the person's additional data has already been entered.

You see all employees of the client with the annual leave entitlement, the current remaining leave, as well as the input field "from previous year".

Enter the person's leave from the previous year in the field "from previous year" and repeat this process until all persons who still have leave from the previous year have been taken into account.

Then click on OK. The remaining leave is now corrected for each person.



Field Descriptions

Year:

The year is specified in this field.

Vacation per Year:

Shows the employee's vacation per year (in days).

Carry from Prv. Year:

Vacation carried over from the previous year.

Vac. Taken:

Display field for vacation taken in the current year.

Active:

Display whether a special program is active or inactive.


Year

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Creation > Employees > Weekly and Overtime Hours

Setting of an internal employee's overtime (+/-) at a specific time


In order to record any overtime of an employee, the start time (date) and the start number of hours of the calculation are defined here. From this point on, the defined target working time is compared with the actual times of the employees from the time recording. The result corresponds to the overtime of the employee.




Person selection


Define selection criteria for filtering the persons to be listed for whom the weekly and overtime hours are to be displayed and/or defined.



Field Descriptions

Search Text:

This field is used to enter the string to search for.

Time Span from:

This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Active Employee:

This checkbox can be used to select whether all employees who match the selection criteria should be displayed or only those employees who have a displayable active record in this period.

Checkbox ticked = Only employees who have a displayable active record.

Department:

Indicates the department in which the employee works.

Time Span to:

This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Display History:

If this checkbox is ticked, an additional history is displayed in addition to the normal data.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




Define start values for individual employees


Define time recording carryover start values for individual employees



Field Descriptions

Employee:

Shows which employees are assigned to a project as workers.

In the case of (sub-)projects, all employees who are assigned to the respective subtasks are displayed here.

EDat.:

The entry date of a person, i.e. since when the employee has been employed by the company, must be entered in this field.

Hrs/W:

This field displays the number of working hours to be worked by an employee (per week) and on which days the employee is available as a resource.

Month:

In this field, the calendar month is output via a selection menu.

Year:

The year is specified in this field.

Overtime Carry:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Overtime Carry:

Remaining overtime before the current time recording.

Annotation:

This field displays general comments about a project.

Dat.:

Data


Employee

Clicking this button saves the entered data and continues the program execution.

Creation > Contractors > Basic Data

Basic data of an external contractor, such as name, gender, department, assignment and/or validity period


Management (new creation, modification or deletion) of basic data of external employees such as name, gender, title, identification number, personal picture, address or communication data.




Selection


In this sub-menu the person/company name to be edited is selected. If it is a program function for employee data (ext./int.) the selection field Inactive is additionally activated for selection. If the field Inactive is activated, also person groups which are no longer active are displayed.



Field Descriptions

Person:

blank

Sort Communication:

Setting how to sort the communication data to be displayed.


Select

A click on this button confirms the selection of the person and loads the corresponding data for editing or viewing.




Summary of information


People Overview

In the mask Summary of information you get a complete overview of the over- and under-organized persons.



Field Descriptions

Overview:

Overview gives a short overview of the selected person.




Definition


People management

Definition stores the most important data for a person as well as their assignment. Field Job Description is only a definition without special rights for data access and can be changed in program function Administration>Client>Reference Values with Job Description. Project managers with corresponding rights etc. are defined in the program function Creation>Employees>Skills/Abilities! Field Department can be managed in program function Administration>Departments>Department Administration.



Field Descriptions

Salutation:

In Administration>Skills>Skills the salutation of a person can be selected.

Sex:

In this field the gender of a person is selected, e.g. "male" or "female".

Image:

Assigned image in PNG, JPG, GIF or BMP format.

Name:

Control>General>Control Center contains the name of the person.

Customer (Client):

Here you can select the client of the activity (project, subproject or task).

First Name:

First Name stores the first name of a person.

Department:

Indicates the department in which the employee works.

Name affix:

Administration>Skills>Skill Groups is an extension of the field Control>General>Control Center. Here additional information can be stored, which possibly had no place in the upper field.

Job Description:

In Job Description the job description under which the person has been hired is selected.

Identif. No.:

Identification No. stores initials, customer numbers, or any other type of number for a person.

Title:

In Administration>Users>User Settings the title of a person can be selected.

Allocated to:

Allocated to Object included the parent.
$message_274;: -
$message_2090;: $message_274;
$message_275;: $message_275;
$message_840;: $message_2091;
$message_276;: -
Customer - Contact Person: Customer
$message_1372;: $message_275;
$message_841;: $message_1372;
$message_2091;: -
$message_2092;: $message_2092;

Valid from:

Date from which a record is valid.

Valid to:

Date until when a record is valid.

Inactive:

A check mark in Department indicates people who should be hidden (employees who have left, old customers, ...).
Checked in Selection, the field also causes the inactive persons to be displayed with the addition "inactive".

Inactivating a client also causes it to be completely locked and no one can log in anymore.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Delete Add.

Delete additional data (= address and communication data) of the person/company

By clicking on the button Delete Add. Data all selected additional data, i.e. address and communication data of the person/company will be deleted.

Delete Company

Delete entire person or company, including all additional data.

By clicking on the button Delete Person the entire selected person or company including their additional data such as pictures, address and communication data will be deleted.
A person or company cannot be deleted if there are still subordinate persons to it.




Cost master data block


Universal mask for assigning any cost master data like cost unit, cost center, cost type etc. to different objects like master project, task, employee, material etc.



Field Descriptions

Text:

Name of the employee

Text:

Cost Object

Cost Unit:

A cost object is an object to which costs are allocated in business accounting. Usually, this is understood to be a good or service. However, other objects can also be selected as cost objects in business cost accounting, such as a process (activity-based costing), a project (project costing) or a customer (customer profitability accounting).

Text:

Cost center

Cost Center:

Cost center accounting is a component of operational cost accounting. A cost center is a spatially or organizationally delimited location of an organization where costs are incurred. Cost centers correspond, for example, to individual departments, individual machines, individual projects, individual persons or other delimited groupings.

Text:

Cost type

Cost Element:

The cost element categorizes costs incurred in cost accounting according to their own nature. Here, each cost element corresponds to an assigned task.

Text:

Activity type

Service Type:

The activity type in cost accounting is a reference value that indicates the qualitative technical description of the production activity. Here, it can be classified between productive (=value-adding) and non-productive types.




Addresses


Address management

The submask Addresses stores addresses for the selected person/company. The number of empty entries can be determined by the program function Administration>Users>User Settings. The different types of addresses are maintained in Administration>Client>Reference Values with Address Type.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

A check mark in Checkbox indicates that this entry should be deleted.

Address Type:

In Address Type you select the address type of the address.

State:

State contains the state of the address.

Street:

Street contains street and house number of the address.

Cntry:

Country Code contains the country code of the address.

Code:

Creation>Contractors>Roles contains the postal code of the address.

Place:

City/Town contains the location of the address.

1307:

Horizontal line




Communication


Communication management

In mask Communication all relevant information on how to reach a person (except the address) can be stored. New types are maintained in Administration>Client>Reference Values with Communication Type.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

A check mark in Checkbox indicates that this entry should be deleted.

Communicat.Type:

In Communication Type, the communication type is selected. "Default" types are displayed in Summary of information.

Number:

Number contains the communication number (phone number, e-mail address, ...).

Annotation:

Annotation contains additional information about the number (validity, availability times, ...).

1307:

Horizontal line

Creation > Contractors > Contract Data

Contract data of an external contractor, such as entry/exit date, standard hourly rate, working hours, working days, annual leave, date of birth, etc.


Additional data for employees, which can be scheduled as resources, e.g. entry and exit date, target working hours per week, standard EC or CC, account details, etc. Furthermore, it is possible to determine on which days of the week an employee works or has time off, as well as their capping hours.




Person selection


Selection of one or more persons from a list depending on the program function.

To create or edit persons, switch to the corresponding program function under the main menu item Master data.



Field Descriptions

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.


Select

A click on this button confirms the selection of the person and loads the corresponding data for editing or viewing.




Contract data


Employee data

With the help of this mask all relevant additional data of an employee can be edited.

Some values, e.g. Cost per Hour or Yield per Hour are relevant for resource planning. They are preset there as default values, but can be adjusted from project to project.

In connection with the working hours per day or per week, restrictions may occur (depending on your system settings). In this case, you must follow any error messages or adjust your system settings.



Field Descriptions

Name:

In this field the family name of the person or the name of the legal entity (e.g. company name) is displayed or entered.

Religion:

Religious affiliation of a person, e.g. Roman Catholic, Protestant, Greek Orthodox, etc.

GIF-Picture:

Assigned image in PNG, JPG, GIF or BMP format.

Maiden Name:

The birth name of a person can be entered in this field if it differs from the family name.

Birthday:

The date of birth of a person must be entered in this field in the format selected in the "User settings".

Company Address:

In this field, an entry must be selected from a selection of possible references to company (or branch) addresses.

PP:

This is the monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial expenditure for the company per hour of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to VK=sales price).

Entry Date:

The entry date of a person, i.e. since when the employee has been employed by the company, must be entered in this field.

Mobile Area:

In the field, an entry is selected from a list of possible operational areas for the employee. This entry specifies in which federal states or countries the employee is available on a mobile basis.

SP:

This is the monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial return for the company per day of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to EK=purchase price).

Leave Date:

This field can be used to enter a person's leaving date, i.e. until when the employee was employed by the company.

Working Hours/Week:

This field displays the number of working hours to be worked by an employee (per week) and on which days the employee is available as a resource.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Workdays:

Indicates how many days the employee works contractually in the week.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Mon:

This field can be used to check whether the resource is available on Monday or not.

Tue:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Tuesday or not.

Wed:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Wednesday or not.

Thu:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Thursday or not.

Fri:

In this field you can check whether the resource is available on Friday or not.

Sat:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Saturday (weekend) or not.

Sun:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Sunday (weekend) or not.

Working Start Time:

Indicates at what time the employee (usually) should / must appear for work.
This information also affects the display of the calendar, i.e. if 10:00 is entered here for an employee with a daily working time of 8 hours, then the period from 10:00 to 18:00 is displayed in the calendar, taking into account any existing break
.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Break:

In Break, the duration of the break the employee is entitled to is specified in hours.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Time Period:

Displays the runtime of the project in a combined field.

Vacation/Year:

Shows the employee's vacation per year (in days).

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Rem. Vac.:

Displays the remaining vacation for the year.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Bank Code:

The unique bank code of the employee's bank details can be entered in this field.

IBAN:

The IBAN (= International Bank Account Number) is an international, standardized notation for bank account numbers.

Composition of IBAN:

  1. 2-digit country code (consisting of letters)
    2. .
  2. 2-digit check digits (consisting of digits)
    3. .
  3. Max. 30-digit BBAN (= Basic Bank Account Number), i.e. the account identification (consisting of letters and/or digits)



The IBAN can comprise a maximum of 34 digits. A German IBAN always has exactly 22 digits, as it consists of the 2-digit country code DE, followed by a 2-digit check digit, followed by the 8-digit bank code, followed by the 10-digit account number. Shorter account numbers are extended to 10 digits with leading zeros.

Bank Account No.:

The account number of the employee's bank account is entered in this field.

BIC:

The BIC (= Bank Identifier Code or SWIFT address) is an internationally standardized code that uniquely identifies each directly or indirectly participating partner worldwide.

The BIC has a length of 8 or 11 alphanumeric characters with the following composition:

  1. 4-digit bank code (consisting of digits)
    2. .
  2. 2-digit country code (consisting of digits)

  3. 2-digit location coding (consisting of digits and/or numbers)

  4. 3-digit coding of the branch or department (consisting of digits and/or numbers)

Handicapped:

This field specifies whether the employee has a severe disability or not.

Flextime:

This field indicates whether the worker is entitled to work in floating day.

If the user is authorized to do so, he can book time records to "Floating day" within the time recording.

This allows the user to enter a floating day for e.g. Friday, if he has already fulfilled his target until Thursday.

By making this entry, the user is also prevented from being registered via the time recording check program, even though he has already worked the necessary hours.

Time Recording Check:

To control the daily time recording, a check program can run in the scheduler which checks whether the time recording has been carried out correctly.

If this value is set, the check is carried out in the scheduler and the employee receives a notification if there is no or an incorrect time recording.

If this value is not set, the check in the scheduler is not performed.

Time Restriction:

Specifies whether time restrictions per day are to be adhered to during time recording, i.e. if this value is set, the time recording hours per day may not exceed the set limit value defined for the client.

If this value is not set, the full 24 hours can be recorded daily.

Internal Annotation:

This field is used to annotate a project for internal purposes only.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Creation > Contractors > Roles

Roles of an external contractor such as project management, project leadership, etc.


Administration of defined company roles such as "Management", "Project Management", "Administration" etc. or of freely definable project responsibility roles of external employees. The assignment of company roles has an effect on the person and project rights which this employee may see by default.




Person selection


Selection of one or more persons from a list depending on the program function.

To create or edit persons, switch to the corresponding program function under the main menu item Master data.



Field Descriptions

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.


Select

A click on this button confirms the selection of the person and loads the corresponding data for editing or viewing.




personal skills


Listing of an employee's skills for one or more groups.

A checkbox determines whether the employee has a skill or not.

If yes, additional information about the employee's ability can be entered in further fields, e.g. how much experience he already has in an area or how good his knowledge is in it.

In addition, internal remarks can be noted in a comment field, such as important notes or similar.

An important capability is the so-called co-worker role. By assigning these roles, the person inherits special rights, which are explained in more detail in the notes section.

NOTE:
Management
A person with the Management role has all rights to every project and document by default, and is allowed to see all information about every person except for the persons private appointments.
Project Management
Only one person with the role Project Management can be assigned to projects as project manager. This person then automatically has display rights on all sublevels of a project to which they are assigned. However, it may only make changes at the parent project level by default, unless it has been granted rights elsewhere.
Project Lead
Only a person with the role Project Lead can be assigned to projects as project lead or deputy project lead. This person then has all rights to the projects he/she is assigned to by default. In addition, this person is the only person besides the resource planner authorized to assign resources to a project..

Resource Planning
A person with the role Resource Planning has by default display rights on all projects and is allowed to assign resources besides the project manager. Consequently, this also means that they are allowed to see all people in this program function.
Administration
A person with the role Administration is allowed to see all information about each person except the personal appointments of the persons.



Field Descriptions

Del.:

Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

Skill Name:

This field contains the names of the skills of the individual persons, e.g. "English", "Russian" or similar as skills for the group "foreign languages".

Exp.:

This field indicates how long an employee has possessed a particular skill, that is, how many years of experience he or she already has.

Evaluation:

The level of knowledge of a skill is to be entered in this field. The standard evaluation is based on school grades (1 = "very good", 2 = "good", ..., 6 = "insufficient").

Comment:

This field can be used to enter additional comments about an employee's ability, such as internal remarks, important notes, or the like .

Edited:

In this field, the user name is displayed or entered in text form (maximum 20 characters).

This can be structured according to the naming convention of the client and is normally managed by the administrator.

Suggestions for the naming convention: first name, last name, initials or a name chosen by the user.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Creation > Contractors > Skills/Abilities

Skills and abilities of an external contractor


Management of freely definable skills of ext. employees. The assignment of skills can be used e.g. for filtering and searching resources.




Person selection


Selection of one or more persons from a list depending on the program function.

To create or edit persons, switch to the corresponding program function under the main menu item Master data.



Field Descriptions

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.


Select

A click on this button confirms the selection of the person and loads the corresponding data for editing or viewing.




personal skills


Listing of an employee's skills for one or more groups.

A checkbox determines whether the employee has a skill or not.

If yes, additional information about the employee's ability can be entered in further fields, e.g. how much experience he already has in an area or how good his knowledge is in it.

In addition, internal remarks can be noted in a comment field, such as important notes or similar.

An important capability is the so-called co-worker role. By assigning these roles, the person inherits special rights, which are explained in more detail in the notes section.

NOTE:
Management
A person with the Management role has all rights to every project and document by default, and is allowed to see all information about every person except for the persons private appointments.
Project Management
Only one person with the role Project Management can be assigned to projects as project manager. This person then automatically has display rights on all sublevels of a project to which they are assigned. However, it may only make changes at the parent project level by default, unless it has been granted rights elsewhere.
Project Lead
Only a person with the role Project Lead can be assigned to projects as project lead or deputy project lead. This person then has all rights to the projects he/she is assigned to by default. In addition, this person is the only person besides the resource planner authorized to assign resources to a project..

Resource Planning
A person with the role Resource Planning has by default display rights on all projects and is allowed to assign resources besides the project manager. Consequently, this also means that they are allowed to see all people in this program function.
Administration
A person with the role Administration is allowed to see all information about each person except the personal appointments of the persons.



Field Descriptions

Del.:

Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

Skill Name:

This field contains the names of the skills of the individual persons, e.g. "English", "Russian" or similar as skills for the group "foreign languages".

Exp.:

This field indicates how long an employee has possessed a particular skill, that is, how many years of experience he or she already has.

Evaluation:

The level of knowledge of a skill is to be entered in this field. The standard evaluation is based on school grades (1 = "very good", 2 = "good", ..., 6 = "insufficient").

Comment:

This field can be used to enter additional comments about an employee's ability, such as internal remarks, important notes, or the like .

Edited:

In this field, the user name is displayed or entered in text form (maximum 20 characters).

This can be structured according to the naming convention of the client and is normally managed by the administrator.

Suggestions for the naming convention: first name, last name, initials or a name chosen by the user.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Creation > Employees > Weekly and Overtime Hours

Setting of an internal employee's overtime (+/-) at a specific time


In order to record any overtime of an employee, the start time (date) and the start number of hours of the calculation are defined here. From this point on, the defined target working time is compared with the actual times of the employees from the time recording. The result corresponds to the overtime of the employee.




Person selection


Define selection criteria for filtering the persons to be listed for whom the weekly and overtime hours are to be displayed and/or defined.



Field Descriptions

Search Text:

This field is used to enter the string to search for.

Time Span from:

This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Active Employee:

This checkbox can be used to select whether all employees who match the selection criteria should be displayed or only those employees who have a displayable active record in this period.

Checkbox ticked = Only employees who have a displayable active record.

Department:

Indicates the department in which the employee works.

Time Span to:

This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Display History:

If this checkbox is ticked, an additional history is displayed in addition to the normal data.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




Define start values for individual employees


Define time recording carryover start values for individual employees



Field Descriptions

Employee:

Shows which employees are assigned to a project as workers.

In the case of (sub-)projects, all employees who are assigned to the respective subtasks are displayed here.

EDat.:

The entry date of a person, i.e. since when the employee has been employed by the company, must be entered in this field.

Hrs/W:

This field displays the number of working hours to be worked by an employee (per week) and on which days the employee is available as a resource.

Month:

In this field, the calendar month is output via a selection menu.

Year:

The year is specified in this field.

Overtime Carry:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Overtime Carry:

Remaining overtime before the current time recording.

Annotation:

This field displays general comments about a project.

Dat.:

Data


Employee

Clicking this button saves the entered data and continues the program execution.

Creation > Contacts > Basic Data

Basic data of contacted companies and/or persons


Management (new creation, modification or deletion) of the basic data of contacts such as name, title, identification number, personal picture, address or communication data.




Selection


In this sub-menu the person/company name to be edited is selected. If it is a program function for employee data (ext./int.) the selection field Inactive is additionally activated for selection. If the field Inactive is activated, also person groups which are no longer active are displayed.



Field Descriptions

Person:

blank

Sort Communication:

Setting how to sort the communication data to be displayed.


Select

A click on this button confirms the selection of the person and loads the corresponding data for editing or viewing.




Summary of information


People Overview

In the mask Summary of information you get a complete overview of the over- and under-organized persons.



Field Descriptions

Overview:

Overview gives a short overview of the selected person.




Definition


People management

Definition stores the most important data for a person as well as their assignment. Field Job Description is only a definition without special rights for data access and can be changed in program function Administration>Client>Reference Values with Job Description. Project managers with corresponding rights etc. are defined in the program function Creation>Employees>Skills/Abilities! Field Department can be managed in program function Administration>Departments>Department Administration.



Field Descriptions

Salutation:

In Administration>Skills>Skills the salutation of a person can be selected.

Sex:

In this field the gender of a person is selected, e.g. "male" or "female".

Image:

Assigned image in PNG, JPG, GIF or BMP format.

Name:

Control>General>Control Center contains the name of the person.

Customer (Client):

Here you can select the client of the activity (project, subproject or task).

First Name:

First Name stores the first name of a person.

Department:

Indicates the department in which the employee works.

Name affix:

Administration>Skills>Skill Groups is an extension of the field Control>General>Control Center. Here additional information can be stored, which possibly had no place in the upper field.

Job Description:

In Job Description the job description under which the person has been hired is selected.

Identif. No.:

Identification No. stores initials, customer numbers, or any other type of number for a person.

Title:

In Administration>Users>User Settings the title of a person can be selected.

Allocated to:

Allocated to Object included the parent.
$message_274;: -
$message_2090;: $message_274;
$message_275;: $message_275;
$message_840;: $message_2091;
$message_276;: -
Customer - Contact Person: Customer
$message_1372;: $message_275;
$message_841;: $message_1372;
$message_2091;: -
$message_2092;: $message_2092;

Valid from:

Date from which a record is valid.

Valid to:

Date until when a record is valid.

Inactive:

A check mark in Department indicates people who should be hidden (employees who have left, old customers, ...).
Checked in Selection, the field also causes the inactive persons to be displayed with the addition "inactive".

Inactivating a client also causes it to be completely locked and no one can log in anymore.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Delete Add.

Delete additional data (= address and communication data) of the person/company

By clicking on the button Delete Add. Data all selected additional data, i.e. address and communication data of the person/company will be deleted.

Delete Company

Delete entire person or company, including all additional data.

By clicking on the button Delete Person the entire selected person or company including their additional data such as pictures, address and communication data will be deleted.
A person or company cannot be deleted if there are still subordinate persons to it.




Addresses


Address management

The submask Addresses stores addresses for the selected person/company. The number of empty entries can be determined by the program function Administration>Users>User Settings. The different types of addresses are maintained in Administration>Client>Reference Values with Address Type.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

A check mark in Checkbox indicates that this entry should be deleted.

Address Type:

In Address Type you select the address type of the address.

State:

State contains the state of the address.

Street:

Street contains street and house number of the address.

Cntry:

Country Code contains the country code of the address.

Code:

Creation>Contractors>Roles contains the postal code of the address.

Place:

City/Town contains the location of the address.

1307:

Horizontal line




Communication


Communication management

In mask Communication all relevant information on how to reach a person (except the address) can be stored. New types are maintained in Administration>Client>Reference Values with Communication Type.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

A check mark in Checkbox indicates that this entry should be deleted.

Communicat.Type:

In Communication Type, the communication type is selected. "Default" types are displayed in Summary of information.

Number:

Number contains the communication number (phone number, e-mail address, ...).

Annotation:

Annotation contains additional information about the number (validity, availability times, ...).

1307:

Horizontal line

Creation > Contacts > Contact Person

Contact person of a contacted company


Management (new creation, modification or deletion) of contact data of contacts such as name, gender, salutation, identification number, personal picture, address or communication data.




Selection


In this sub-menu the person/company name to be edited is selected. If it is a program function for employee data (ext./int.) the selection field Inactive is additionally activated for selection. If the field Inactive is activated, also person groups which are no longer active are displayed.



Field Descriptions

Person:

blank

Sort Communication:

Setting how to sort the communication data to be displayed.


Select

A click on this button confirms the selection of the person and loads the corresponding data for editing or viewing.




Summary of information


People Overview

In the mask Summary of information you get a complete overview of the over- and under-organized persons.



Field Descriptions

Overview:

Overview gives a short overview of the selected person.




Definition


People management

Definition stores the most important data for a person as well as their assignment. Field Job Description is only a definition without special rights for data access and can be changed in program function Administration>Client>Reference Values with Job Description. Salutation:

Sex:

Image:

Name:

Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Delete Add.

Delete additional data (= address and communication data) of the person/company

By clicking on the button Delete Add. Data all selected additional data, i.e. address and communication data of the person/company will be deleted.

Delete Company

Delete entire person or company, including all additional data.

By clicking on the button Delete Person the entire selected person or company including their additional data such as pictures, address and communication data will be deleted.
A person or company cannot be deleted if there are still subordinate persons to it.




Addresses


Address management

The submask Addresses stores addresses for the selected person/company. The number of empty entries can be determined by the program function Administration>Users>User Settings. The different types of addresses are maintained in Administration>Client>Reference Values with Address Type.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

A check mark in Checkbox indicates that this entry should be deleted.

Address Type:

In Address Type you select the address type of the address.

State:

State contains the state of the address.

Street:

Street contains street and house number of the address.

Cntry:

Country Code contains the country code of the address.

Code:

Creation>Contractors>Roles contains the postal code of the address.

Place:

City/Town contains the location of the address.

1307:

Horizontal line




Communication


Communication management

In mask Communication all relevant information on how to reach a person (except the address) can be stored. New types are maintained in Administration>Client>Reference Values with Communication Type.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

A check mark in Checkbox indicates that this entry should be deleted.

Communicat.Type:

In Communication Type, the communication type is selected. "Default" types are displayed in Summary of information.

Number:

Number contains the communication number (phone number, e-mail address, ...).

Annotation:

Annotation contains additional information about the number (validity, availability times, ...).

1307:

Horizontal line

Creation > Projects > Order Requests

Creation of planned requirements that become a main project after release


Manage (create, modify or delete) orders, i.e. planned requirements. The title, a contact person, completion date, order cause and priority as well as order target and note can be entered as pure text values.

A new main project can be created from each order with a single mouse click.




Determine selection criteria


Select order directly or limit list by criteria.



Field Descriptions

Order title:

The order title contains the name or designation of the planned operation (project). When an order is activated, a new master project is created from this title.

Client of a project.:

Here you can select the client of the activity (project, subproject or task).

Filter categories for projects:

Define filter categories for projects or select them in a selection field.

Year:

The year is specified in this field.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




Order list


Display of all orders which correspond to the set criteria.

By clicking on the [ACTIVATE] icon , an order can be created as a parent project. At the same time, all project managers will be notified by e-mail about the new project. By clicking on the [ACTIVATE] icon the information about the order can be viewed again.



Field Descriptions

Order Title:

The order title contains the name or designation of the planned operation (project). When an order is activated, a new master project is created from this title.

Proj. No.:

This is the directory number for a project.

The directory number cannot be changed for parent projects.

The directory number is automatically adjusted when deleting or moving.

By manually changing the directory number, you can move projects within a hierarchy.

Contact Prs. C.:

This field shows the contact person or the customer. By selecting a contact person, in some cases (e.g. project definition) a customer is automatically selected as well, since each contact person is assigned to exactly one customer.

A contact person is created via the input mask in the menu item "Master data".

Completion:

Latest planned date by which the order or the associated project is to be completed.

Link:

This field is optional. If a link is entered, the automatic user rights query is bypassed and the Trans_ID field is cleared.




Data sheet


Convenient management and creation of orders.

Based on the selected order, a new parent project is automatically generated and all project managers are informed about it by e-mail if the project checkbox is ticked.

If an order is deleted, associated parent projects remain unaffected. However, if the parent project has not yet been subdivided into other projects, it will be deleted as well.



Field Descriptions

Order Title:

The order title contains the name or designation of the planned operation (project). When an order is activated, a new master project is created from this title.

Contact Prs. C.:

This field shows the contact person or the customer. By selecting a contact person, in some cases (e.g. project definition) a customer is automatically selected as well, since each contact person is assigned to exactly one customer.

A contact person is created via the input mask in the menu item "Master data".

Favorite Processor:

Free text field to request a desired person from the contractor (CO) to process the order.

Completion Date:

Latest planned date by which the order or the associated project is to be completed.

Project:

By setting the checkbox a project will be generated from the order.

Order Cause:

As the name suggests, this field contains the cause, the reason for an order. This field is a lookup value and can be freely extended there.

Order Priority:

As the name suggests, this field contains the priority of an order. This field is a lookup value and can be freely extended there.

Order Goal:

Detailed description of the objective of the contract.

Annotation:

This field displays general comments about a project.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Creation > Projects > Create Main Project

Creation of a new main project including definition of upper limits (deadlines, costs)


To plan costs and deadlines, a project must first be created. A project can contain subprojects and tasks. Tasks cannot exist outside of projects.




Create project


Creation of a new main project including the definition of the basic data, the main responsible persons and the budget framework.



Field Descriptions

Project Name:

In the project name, the name or designation of the task (project, subproject, task) is specified.

Project No.:

This is the directory number for a project.

The directory number cannot be changed for parent projects.

The directory number is automatically adjusted when deleting or moving.

By manually changing the directory number, you can move projects within a hierarchy.

Contact Person Cust.:

This field shows the contact person or the customer. By selecting a contact person, in some cases (e.g. project definition) a customer is automatically selected as well, since each contact person is assigned to exactly one customer.

A contact person is created via the input mask in the menu item "Master data".

Project Manager:

Specifies which person should be the project manager of this project.

This field only serves as a further decision criterion in various reports, the Project Manager does not enjoy any additional rights or similar, these lie exclusively with the 1st Project Leader.

The Project Manager is only set in projects and is then also selected in the respective tasks of the project.

Green displayed persons in the selection field are project managers, which are already assigned to at least one project in this role.

Project managers are created using the role mask with role "Project Manager".

1st Project Leader:

In this field the manager of a project is displayed or must be selected from a selection list. The project manager is defined once in the master project, and is then preselected as a PROPOSAL in all underlying projects.

Green displayed persons in the selection field are project leaders, which are already assigned to at least one project in this role.

Project managers are created using the role mask with role "Project Manager".

2nd Project Leader:

Here you can specify a deputy project manager for a project, who will stand in for the project manager if the latter is absent.

Green displayed persons in the selection field are deputy project managers who are already assigned to at least one project in this role.

Deputy project managers are created using the role mask with role "project manager".

Planned Start Date:

The target start date of the project is displayed or specified here, i.e. from when the project is to be started according to planning.

Planned End Date:

The target end date of the respective reference object, e.g. project, time data, trip data, etc. is displayed or specified here, i.e. by when the object should be completed according to planning.

Int. PFrm.:

This value specifies the internally planned net budget framework (target) for the persons who will execute the assigned tasks. This value is defined for projects (parent project or sub-project) and thus specifies the limit for all subordinate sub-projects or tasks. If the limit is exceeded, a warning is issued. Depending on the client setting, this frame can be increased or not by task planning.

Ext. PFrm.:

This value specifies the externally planned net budget framework (target) for the persons who will execute the assigned tasks. This value is defined for projects (parent or sub-project) and thus specifies the limit for all subordinate sub-projects or tasks. If the limit is exceeded, a warning is issued. Depending on the client setting, this frame can be increased or not by task planning.

Int. MFrm.:

This value specifies the internally planned (should be) net budget framework for the material that will be required for the execution of the tasks. This value is defined for projects (parent or sub-project) and thus specifies the limit for all subordinate sub-projects or tasks. If the limit is exceeded, a warning is issued. Depending on the client setting, this limit can be increased or not by task planning.

Ext. MFrm.:

This value specifies the externally planned (to be) net budget framework for the material that will be required for the execution of the tasks. This value is defined for projects (parent or sub-project) and thus specifies the limit for all subordinate sub-projects or tasks. If the limit is exceeded, a warning is issued. Depending on the client setting, this limit can be increased or not by task planning.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Creation > Projects > Copy

Copy a task, a subproject or a complete main project to another project


Enables the copying of entire project hierarchies incl. subprojects and optional resource allocation from a source process to any target level. In doing so, the deadline period can be conveniently moved in the target frame, the project main responsible persons can be adjusted and the project titles can be individually changed.

By copying, a new parent project can easily be created from a subproject.


NOTE:
It should be noted here that when copying subprojects, the deadline period must fit in the period of the target project.




Copy projects


Copy projects

Select here which project is to be copied and, if necessary, assign an item to it ("Assigned to"). You must also specify when the new project is to start.

The ticked checkbox Displ. Sub Projects causes all subprojects of the selected project to be copied as well, just as ticking the field "Take over resources" takes over all resources of the template.

The reference numbers of copied projects are provided with a "(c*)" character.

Example: original Ref-No.: A6ZhdR copy => Ref-No.: A6ZhdR (c*)



Field Descriptions

Selection of the activity (project, subproject, task) for which you are authoriz:

In Project the task (project or task) to be copied is selected.

Higher-level unit:

This field contains the "parent unit".
For projects, this would be the parent project [(sub)project].

For documents this would be the unit you belong to (e.g. project, appointment, note etc.).

Displ. Sub Projects:

If the checkbox is activated, all subordinate subprojects and tasks are included in addition to the main project.

Attention!
This can lead to longer waiting times for large projects.

Copy Resources:

If this field is checked, the resources that are assigned to a task are also copied.

Transfer Dest. Value:

If this checkbox is ticked, the additional information is pre-populated with the values of the selected target project, i.e. project manager, project leader, etc.


Select

Clicking on this button will forward the selected data.




Additional information


Additional information for the copy routine.

Details of additional information to be taken into account during the copying process, such as client, project manager, project manager, etc.

NOTE:
A stretching or compression of the project deadlines is not yet supported, but a deadline adjustment is supported, if no deadlines are affected.
.



Field Descriptions

Contact Prs. C.:

Here the contact person of the ordering party is selected.

Project Manager:

Here the project manager of the task (project, subproject or task) is selected.

1st Project L.:

Here the project manager of the activity (project, subproject or task) is selected.

2nd Project L.:

The deputy project manager of the activity (project, subproject or task) is selected here.

Pln. Start Date:

The target start date of the project is displayed or specified here, i.e. from when the project is to be started according to planning.

Project Categories:

Define filter categories for projects or select them in a selection field.

Pln. End Date:

The target end date of the respective reference object, e.g. project, time data, trip data, etc. is displayed or specified here, i.e. by when the object should be completed according to planning.

Determinat. Method:

Determination of the method how the project progress (= percentage of completion) is to be determined.

Report Date:

Determination of the reporting date when the project progress (= percentage of completion) is to be determined.


Accept

Clicking this button saves the entered data and continues the program execution.




Preview


Preview mask

Display of a preview list of the projects to be copied. With the checkboxes in front of the new project numbers, individual structure branches can be shown or hidden.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

Proj. No.:

This is the directory number for a project.

The directory number cannot be changed for parent projects.

The directory number is automatically adjusted when deleting or moving.

By manually changing the directory number, you can move projects within a hierarchy.

Project Name:

In the project name, the name or designation of the task (project, subproject, task) is specified.

Text:

R indicates resources are assigned, M indicates material is assigned.

Planned Start:

Target start date of the reference object

Planned End:

Target end date of the reference object


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Proj. No.

Adjust date according to the top-down method

Adjust the date using the top-down method, i.e. all levels further down are compressed into the top date if there is a time overlap.

Project Name

Adjust date using the bottom-up method

Adjust the date according to the bottom-up method, i.e. all levels further up are stretched to the following date if there is a time overlap.

Back

Jump back to the previous mask/page.

Creation > Materials > Material Definition

Creation or modification of immediate, consumption and/or time materials


Creation and management of immediate, consumable and/or time material definitions.

Immediate materials are materials that are assigned once to tasks, whereby the corresponding costs and/or revenues are transferred directly to the project budget, e.g. computers, printers, etc.

Consumable materials are materials that can be consumed by a person on a unit basis (piece, meter, etc.) on a daily basis, e.g. cables, sockets, etc.

Time materials are materials that can be consumed by a person on an hourly basis and to the day, analogous to time recording, e.g. company cars, rented rooms, etc.




Material selection


Search criteria can be used to limit the number of material lists that are to be displayed or changed. As search criteria, for example, article numbers, material names, assigned projects, material types, usage types, storage locations and/or start or end dates can be specified.



Field Descriptions

Int. Artikelnummer:

If a number is entered here, only materials are listed which contain this number completely or partially.

Materialname:

If a name is entered here, only materials are listed which contain this name completely or partially.

Project:

If a project is selected here on the one hand only immediate materials are indicated, which are assigned directly, or on the other hand only consumption or time materials, which are assigned indirectly by an already occurred consumption posting to this project or a subordinate task.

Materialtyp:

If a type is selected here, only materials of that type are listed (material types are self-defined lookup values).

Lagerort:

If a location is selected here, only materials are listed which are stored at this location.

Verwendungsart:

Specify what type of material to list: Immediate, Consumable, and/or Time material.

Search from:

If a date is entered here, only materials are listed whose validity start date is either blank or on or before this date.

Search up to:

If a date is entered here, only materials are listed whose validity end date is either blank or on or after this date.


Search

Clicking on this button starts the search.




Material definition


Instant materials are materials that can be assigned once to tasks, e.g. computers, printers, etc.. If a material is assigned to a task, the corresponding costs and/or revenues are directly transferred to the project budget. Whether an instant material is billable or not can be defined by an entry in the date field "Billable from".

Consumable materials are materials which can be consumed by a person on a unit basis (pieces, meters, etc.) to the exact day, e.g. cables, sockets, etc. The date fields "Start date" and "End date" can be used to specify the period in which this material can be consumed. A consumable material can generally be used by all persons and can be added to authorized tasks. Consumables can optionally be defined as stock items, so that their stocks can be controlled in the stock management.

Time materials are materials which can be used by a person by the hour and to the day, analogous to time recording, e.g. company cars, rented rooms, etc. The date fields "Start date" and "End date" can be used to define the period in which this material can be used. A time material can generally be used by all persons and can be added to authorized tasks. For time materials, it is also possible to define on which days of the week and for how many hours/day they are available, just like for persons (HR).



Field Descriptions

Int. Item Number:

Unique internal article number of a material.

Ext. Item Number:

External article number of a material, which does not necessarily have to be unique, since this number was usually assigned by an external company.

Image:

Assigned material image in PNG, JPG, GIF or BMP format.

Material Name:

Name or description of a material.

Created by:

Person who entered the material for the first time.

Usage Category:

Usage type of a material, that is, for which purposes this material is used.

Instant materials are materials that are assigned to tasks once, whereby the corresponding costs and/or revenues are transferred directly to the project budget, e.g. computers, printers, etc.

Consumable materials are materials that can be consumed by a person on a unit basis (pieces, meters, etc.) on a daily basis, e.g. cables, sockets, etc.

Time materials are materials that can be consumed by a person on an hourly basis and to the day, analogous to time recording, e.g. company cars, rented rooms, etc.

Material Type:

Type of a material, that is, to which material group it belongs. The material types can be defined as lookup values themselves.

Purchase/start date:

The purchase date of an immediate material, or the effective start date of a consumable or time material.

Amount:

How much was purchased of an immediate material. For a consumable or time material, this quantity is always 1.00.

Dummy:

Dummy

Unit of measure of an article, e.g. kg, piece, meter, etc.:

Unit of the material, e.g. piece, kg, m, etc. The units can be defined as lookup values themselves. For time materials, the unit is always "hrs".

Material Status:

Budget status of the material:

Created means that the material has been entered but not yet ordered, received or paid. The values do not yet have any effect on the material budget of the assigned task. This means, for example, that materials can already be entered even if the material budget of the task is not sufficient or has not yet been adjusted. This material status is always set for consumption or time materials, since the material budget consumption is calculated here on the basis of the daily consumption entry.

Ordered means that the immediate material has already been ordered, but has not yet arrived or been paid for. The Int value (quantity x purchase price) affects the internally planned material budget of the assigned task.

Paid means that the immediate material has been ordered, arrived and paid. Only a paid material can be settled in an outgoing invoice. The Int value (quantity x purchase price) affects the internally consumed material budget of the assigned task, and the Ext value (quantity x sales price) affects the externally consumed material budget of the assigned task.

Invoice/end date:

The invoice date of an immediate material, or the effective end date of a consumable or time material.

Act. Cost/Unit:

Purchase price (EK) per unit, which have an impact on the internal budget (= costs of the company).

Sales Price/Unit:

Sales price (VK) per unit, which has an impact on the external budget (= revenue of the company, which can be settled with a client).

VAT-Rate:

Statutory value-added tax rate at which the invoice is issued. The gross amount to be billed is calculated from this tax rate.

Task:

Task for which an immediate material was purchased. (This field is hidden for consumable or time materials).

Int. Rem. Material:

This value indicates the internally still available net budget (target) for an immediate material, i.e. this is the difference between:
Int. approved material budget - Int. planned material budget - Int. consumed material budget.

Ext. Rem. Material:

This value indicates the externally still available residual net budget (target) for an immediate material, i.e. this is the difference between:
Ext. approved material budget - Ext. consumed/settled material budget.

Release:

The release indicates whether the immediate material has already been released for settlement.

Stocked Item:

Indicates whether the consumable is a stock item (= ) or not (= ) .

Stock Location:

Location where a stock consumable is stored.

Stock (Act.):

Number of total consumables currently available in the warehouse. This value corresponds to the difference between the total inflow (= material increase) minus the total outflow (= material reduction).

Dummy:

Dummy

Text box 11:

Text field

Stock (Min.):

Number of minimum available consumables in the warehouse, i.e. this is how many materials should always be in stock in the warehouse.
This value is mainly used to check the stock in order to see immediately what should be reordered.

Text box 12:

Text field

Stock (Removals):

The total number of issues of consumables from the warehouse, that is, the total number of materials by which the warehouse stock was reduced.

Stock (Used):

Total number of consumables already consumed from the warehouse, i.e. materials withdrawn from the warehouse. This value is determined from the total number of day-specific entries recorded for material consumption.

Text field 13:

Text field

Stock (Max.):

Maximum number of consumables available in the warehouse, i.e. the maximum number of materials that can or should be in stock in the warehouse.
This value is mainly used as a control upper limit for reordering materials.

Text field 14:

Text field

Stock (Entries):

Total number of receipts of consumables into the warehouse, that is, the total number of materials by which the warehouse stock was increased.

Work Station:

Information field indicating how many workers can work simultaneously on a fully loaded material.

Text box 15:

Text field

Hours/Day:

Information field indicating the number of hours per day that the material can or should be used as scheduled.

Text box 16:

Text field

Working Day:

Information field showing the number of days the material can or should be used as scheduled. (This value is automatically calculated by the marked days of the week).

Dummy:

Dummy

Text box 17:

Text field

Mo (Monday) - Su (Sunday):

Days of the week on which the material can or should be used as scheduled.

Tue:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Tuesday or not.

Wed:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Wednesday or not.

Thu:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Thursday or not.

Fri:

In this field you can check whether the resource is available on Friday or not.

Sat:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Saturday (weekend) or not.

Sun:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Sunday (weekend) or not.

Description:

Explanatory descriptions, details, remarks or similar for materials.


Save

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Back

By clicking on this button, the current change is discarded and the selection list is called up again.




Cost master data block
