With a standard eight-hour day and a task runtime of four days, the workloads of the two employees in the case just mentioned would be 50% (=> 32 / 16) and 25% (=> 32 / 8) respectively.

The total workload of an employee for an appointment is calculated from the individual workloads within the tasks for this appointment, i.e. if an employee has three tasks assigned on one day, with individual workloads of 40%, 30% and 20%, then the total workload for this employee for this day would be 90%.

Missing days and holidays are taken into account in the workload calculation
.

Planning > Projects > Weekly Project Deployment Schedule

Schedule the weekly deployment in selected projects




Select period of use



Field Descriptions

Date:

With the help of the field "Date specification" you can directly display a desired day.

This option is preferable if you want to "jump" over a longer period of time, because here only one date has to be entered instead of a tedious scrolling forward or backward.

CW:

Number of the week in which the day of the current time recording record lies.

Higher-Level Proj.:

The number you enter in this field controls how many project levels are displayed in the report.

Sublevel "0" corresponds to the highest level.

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

Project:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Disp. service.:

Determines whether maintenance tasks should be displayed or not.

A maintenance task is a task that does not cause any workload because, for example, the effort was planned with 0. Useful, for example, for recurring long-running tasks without exactly predictable scheduling.

Disp. Piled Up T.:

If set, stacked tasks, i.e. tasks from the past that have not yet been completed, are also displayed.

Only Weekly Plan:

If set, only weekly tasks that have already been set will be displayed, regardless of any other selection criteria that may have been set.
Weekly tasks are set in the change mode of the corresponding program function.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.

Today

Button of the date selection. After clicking you will find yourself at today's date.




Project weekly schedule



Field Descriptions

Time:

Used to enter or display a time.

Project No.:

This is the directory number for a project.

The directory number cannot be changed for parent projects.

The directory number is automatically adjusted when deleting or moving.

By manually changing the directory number, you can move projects within a hierarchy.

Path:

In this field the path to a file is specified, this can also be changed directly in the mask.

Reference:

A reference number may be entered in this field.

It is used for a possible reference creation to other programs.

Tasks:

Here you can define whether tasks (and possibly to-dos) should also be displayed in the project selection list or not. If this checkbox is not set, only projects and subprojects are displayed.

Project Location:

Location where the project will be carried out. For construction projects, this can also be the construction site.

Persons:

Here you can select which employees should be included in the cost report.

Material ID:

Internal key for the Material table.

Night:

Overnight stay

Planning > Costs > Hourly Rates

Determination of hourly rates for persons, groups of persons, projects and skills


EK/VK allocation to the most different categories. The EK/VKs are used to support the budget and expense calculation.




EK/VK - Category selection


Definition of the selection categories for listing in the following input mask.

NOTE:
Requires JavaScript, as selection field is dynamically adjusted using AJAX.



Field Descriptions

Category:

In this field, the category is selected via a selection field.

Selection field for field types of session variable names:

Selection field for field types of session variable names.

Skill Group:

In this field, the individual employee skill groups can be selected, i.e. the employee areas they cover. The selected group ID is stored internally.


OK

Clicking the OK button confirms changes to the record or criteria.




EK/VK - Definition


Entry or deletion of the EK/VKs for the previously selected category.

When planning the target effort or the person budgets in the projects, these EC/ACs are used as a calculation basis to support you.

A field can be left "empty". Then the content of a possibly superior object or category will be used for the calculation. If no entry is found, 0.00 is used.

If both the purchase and the sales field are left "empty", this is equivalent to checking the "Delete" checkbox.



Field Descriptions

Field Name:

Display of the (sub)project name and capabilities.

Type:

Hourly rate - standard, skill, skill group.

PP:

This is the monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial expenditure for the company per hour of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to VK=sales price).

SP:

This is the monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial return for the company per day of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to EK=purchase price).

Del.:

This field indicates whether the related field for this profile may be deleted.


Save

Button to save data.

Planning > Costs > Budget Approval

Approve Task Budgets (if Budget Approval is activated client-wide)


Listing (optionally also with history) of already approved task budgets for persons or material.

In the new creation or change mode, planned budgets can be approved, equipped with new additional budget or optionally provided with an approval text. Furthermore, the planned deadline period can also be confirmed or changed here, so that time entries are only possible in this area.


NOTE:
Only the additional budget, i.e. the remaining amount between the planned and already approved budget, needs to be re-approved. The sum of all approved additional budgets results in the total approved budget.




Selection of tasks to be approved


Selection of tasks to be approved

Here you can define which tasks should be displayed for budget approval.

If a parent project or subproject is selected, all subordinate tasks of this project are listed.

If a time period is specified, only tasks that lie within this period are displayed.

If History is checked, then for each displayed task also already existing previous approvals are displayed.

Only those budget types are displayed which correspond to the checked type, i.e. internal and/or external.

NOTE:
Only tasks are displayed, which are also visible in the selection mask, i.e. the general project filter settings are effective.



Field Descriptions

Project:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Start Date:

If a date is written into this field, then all determined dates are limited to dates whose start date is after the date entered here.

End Date:

If a date is written into this field, then all determined dates are limited to dates whose end date is before the date entered here.

Show History:

If this checkbox is ticked, an additional history is displayed in addition to the normal data.

Init. Time Span:

Specifies whether the new approval period should be preset with the planned target period of the task.

Int. Total Budget:

This value specifies the total net internal budget (target), that is, this is the sum of the internal personnel budget + internal material budget.

Ext. TBudget:

This value specifies the total external net budget (target), that is, this is the sum of the external personnel budget + external material budget.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




List of tasks to be approved


List of tasks to be approved

Here all projects are listed according to the previously selected structure.

The individual lines are divided into internal and external budget data, both the planned and the already approved data are displayed. For tasks, the newly approved additional budget can be entered, as well as the newly approved period. The new additional budget to be approved usually corresponds to the difference between the planned budget and the total of the budgets already approved. This value is also the default value for the fields.

For tasks, a comment can also be added to each new approval.

If the checkbox is selected for projects, all subordinate tasks are automatically approved with the entered values. If no value is entered, the difference between planned and already approved budget is automatically used for new approval.

NOTE:
If History was checked, then for each task also possibly existing old budget approvals are listed in detail.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

Proj. No.:

This is the directory number for a project.

The directory number cannot be changed for parent projects.

The directory number is automatically adjusted when deleting or moving.

By manually changing the directory number, you can move projects within a hierarchy.

Status:

This field shows how far a project has already progressed. In input mode, you can assign an attribute from a selection list to a project here, which reflects whether or how far a project is already advanced.

The status can also be used to decide whether project data should be included in a report or not.

Text:

Budget: Int. planned, Int. approved, Int. approval change

Person Budget:

This value indicates the general net budget (target) for persons, i.e. both the internal and the external budget.

Material Budget:

This value specifies the overall net (target) budget for materials, that is, both the internal and external budget.

Total Budget:

This value indicates the overall total net budget (target) for people and materials, i.e. both the internal and external budget.

Pln. Start:

The target start date of the project is displayed or specified here, i.e. from when the project is to be started according to planning.

Pln. End:

The target end date of the respective reference object, e.g. project, time data, trip data, etc. is displayed or specified here, i.e. by when the object should be completed according to planning.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.




Report of the approved tasks


Report of the approved tasks

Here all projects are listed according to the previously selected structure.

The individual lines are divided into internal and external budget data, both the planned and the already approved data are displayed.

NOTE:
If History was checked, then for each task also possibly existing old budget approvals are listed in detail.



Field Descriptions

Proj. No.:

This is the directory number for a project.

The directory number cannot be changed for parent projects.

The directory number is automatically adjusted when deleting or moving.

By manually changing the directory number, you can move projects within a hierarchy.

Status:

This field shows how far a project has already progressed. In input mode, you can assign an attribute from a selection list to a project here, which reflects whether or how far a project is already advanced.

The status can also be used to decide whether project data should be included in a report or not.

Text:

Budget: Int. planned, Int. approved, Int. approval change

Person Budget:

This value indicates the general net budget (target) for persons, i.e. both the internal and the external budget.

Material Budget:

This value specifies the overall net (target) budget for materials, that is, both the internal and external budget.

Total Budget:

This value indicates the overall total net budget (target) for people and materials, i.e. both the internal and external budget.

Pln. Start:

The target start date of the project is displayed or specified here, i.e. from when the project is to be started according to planning.

Pln. End:

The target end date of the respective reference object, e.g. project, time data, trip data, etc. is displayed or specified here, i.e. by when the object should be completed according to planning.

Planning > Persons > Search

Search and list of specific persons


Persons are searched and found according to freely defined patterns. These patterns can be composed of name, person type, job title or department.




Search people


Search people

Here you can enter the search criteria for the person search. The more detailed the entries are, the more accurate the hit list will be.

NOTE:
If all fields remain empty, then you will receive all persons included in the system, which, however, depending on the respective amount of data, could lead to longer waiting times.



Field Descriptions

Name:

In this field the family name of the person or the name of the legal entity (e.g. company name) is displayed or entered.

Type of Person:

Categorization of persons, e.g. clients, employees, customers etc. are to be distinguished.

First Name:

This field displays or enters the first name of a person if the field is empty (maximum 40 characters allowed).

Job Description:

In this field the position of a person in a company according to the job description is selected, e.g. "management", "administration", "project manager" etc.. This field therefore only contains the job position under which a person has been hired.

However, each person can also be assigned different employee roles in the corresponding skills mask, e.g. a "business manager" can also or in particular receive the skill "project manager" and then be used as such in a project accordingly.

So that a project can be created, at least one person must be assigned the employee role "project manager".

Contact Possibility:

By activating this checkbox, the search is extended to the communication data of the persons found. Otherwise, only personal data, such as name or position in the company, and address data are displayed.

Primary key in the "Department" table:

Indicates the department in which the employee works.


Search

Clicking on this button starts the search.




Hits of the people search


Hits of the people search

This list contains all persons matching the search criteria. In addition, their most important data is displayed.
By ticking the checkbox Contact Possibility you receive additional communication data for the persons found.



Field Descriptions

Name:

In this field the family name of the person or the name of the legal entity (e.g. company name) is displayed or entered.

First Name:

This field displays or enters the first name of a person if the field is empty (maximum 40 characters allowed).

PersonType:

Categorization of persons, e.g. clients, employees, customers etc. are to be distinguished.

Dept.:

Indicates the department in which the employee works.

Job Desc.:

In this field the position of a person in a company according to the job description is selected, e.g. "management", "administration", "project manager" etc.. This field therefore only contains the job position under which a person has been hired.

However, each person can also be assigned different employee roles in the corresponding skills mask, e.g. a "business manager" can also or in particular receive the skill "project manager" and then be used as such in a project accordingly.

So that a project can be created, at least one person must be assigned the employee role "project manager".

Street:

The street with house number is entered in this field.

Code:

The postal code of the town is entered in this field.

Place:

The person's place of residence is entered in this field.

Cntry:

This field is used to select a country code from a country table.

The country code corresponds to the currently valid car license plates, e.g. "USA", "F", "NL", "D" etc.

Communication Type:

This field is used to select the type of communication connection, such as telephone, fax, e-mail, etc., from a drop-down menu.

Number:

The actual communication connection, such as telephone number, fax number, e-mail address, etc., is entered or displayed in this field. The entries in this field depend on the previously selected communication type.

Planning > Persons > Assign Person Resources (HR)

Assignment of person resources (HR) to tasks with various evaluation options


The resource planning of persons is used to display as well as to assign resources. Basically, persons are assigned to tasks, because time recording can only be done on tasks. If a person is assigned to a project or subproject, this person is also automatically assigned to all underlying tasks. When selecting tasks, multiple selection is possible, which is achieved by holding down the CTRL key. Persons with certain skills can be filtered for display using the "Skill" selection field. If the checkmark is set at "Show projects", already assigned projects of the individual persons are graphically displayed.




Employee utilization / employee availability


Settings for the graphical display of employee workload/availability

Only employees with the ability Employee role -> "Project manager" or "General manager" may carry out resource planning.

Resource planning is only possible if a project or task has been selected.

The main client 1 can additionally manage its resources across clients, if this option was selected during the installation.



Field Descriptions

Project:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Person:

In the selection field Person all employees defined in the person criteria are listed. All persons contained here are displayed in the graphic formatting.

If only one employee is selected, only changes can be made to this person.

Dept.:

Indicates the department in which the employee works.

Skill:

By selection of a certain ability or an ability group the display of the indicated coworkers can be influenced, since then only changes can be accomplished with the persons, who have the appropriate abilities. All other employees will be displayed as well, but only "greyed out".

Time from:

A date must be entered in this field from which time the graphical representation of the employee workload should begin.
(The date must be entered in the format defined in the user settings.)

Time to:

A date must be entered in this field by which time the graphical representation of the employee workload should occur.
(The date must be entered in the format defined in the user settings.)

Calendar Displ. Mode:

Used to specify the calendar time intervals per column, i.e. days, weeks, months or years.

If "Automatic" has been set, the calendar time interval is determined programmatically based on the length of the total period to be displayed.

Time from Project:

If this checkbox is checked, the entered time span is automatically overwritten with the time data from the selected project.

Display Utilization:

If this checkbox is ticked, the employee workload is displayed in the graphical representation of the employee data.

Disp. active tasks:

Determines whether active tasks should be displayed or not.

If this checkbox is activated, all tasks with the status "active" are listed. Otherwise, these tasks will be hidden.
This checkbox should remain checked in the resource planning always to get correct utilization values!

Disp. service.:

Determines whether maintenance tasks should be displayed or not.

A maintenance task is a task that does not cause any workload because, for example, the effort was planned with 0. Useful, for example, for recurring long-running tasks without exactly predictable scheduling.

Disp. Only Planned:

Used to display only planned-target data, i.e. actual data from time recording, appointments, etc. are not taken into account.

Display Projects:

If this checkbox is selected, the project workloads of the individual projects to which the employee is already assigned are displayed in the graphical representation of the employee data.

Disp. approved tasks:

Determines whether or not to display scheduled tasks with approved budgets.

If this checkbox is activated, all tasks with the statuses "planned" and with approved person budgets are listed. Otherwise these tasks will be hidden.

Only Assigned Pers.:

If this mode is activated, only persons are listed who are already assigned to at least one of the selected tasks.

Disp. planned tasks:

Determines whether or not to display scheduled tasks without approved budgets.

If this checkbox is activated, all tasks with the statuses "planned" and without approved person budget are listed. Otherwise these tasks will be hidden.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.

Planning > Persons > Weekly Person Deployment Schedule

Schedule weekly deployment of selected human resources (HR)




Select period of use



Field Descriptions

Date:

With the help of the field "Date specification" you can directly display a desired day.

This option is preferable if you want to "jump" over a longer period of time, because here only one date has to be entered instead of a tedious scrolling forward or backward.

CW:

Number of the week in which the day of the current time recording record lies.

Higher-Level Proj.:

Number of parent project levels, which should be displayed in addition to the assigned task.

  • 0 = no projects, only assigned task
  • 1 = additionally with parent project
  • 2 = additionally with 2 parent projects
  • usw.


Sort Sequ.:

Specify the sort order of the displayed fields.

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

Project:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Disp. service.:

Determines whether maintenance tasks should be displayed or not.

A maintenance task is a task that does not cause any workload because, for example, the effort was planned with 0. Useful, for example, for recurring long-running tasks without exactly predictable scheduling.

Disp. Piled Up T.:

If set, stacked tasks, i.e. tasks from the past that have not yet been completed, are also displayed.

Only Weekly Plan:

If set, only weekly tasks that have already been set will be displayed, regardless of any other selection criteria that may have been set.
Weekly tasks are set in the change mode of the corresponding program function.

Tasks:

Here you can define whether tasks (and possibly to-dos) should also be displayed in the project selection list or not. If this checkbox is not set, only projects and subprojects are displayed.

Reference:

A reference number may be entered in this field.

It is used for a possible reference creation to other programs.

Project Location:

Location where the project will be carried out. For construction projects, this can also be the construction site.

Workday:

Indicates how many days the employee is required to work per week.

Effort:

If this field is checked, the effort fields are shown in the project report.

Show Material:

If this checkbox is set, materials are displayed.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.

Today

Button of the date selection. After clicking you will find yourself at today's date.




Person weekly schedule



Field Descriptions

Person:

blank

Monday:

This field can be used to check whether the resource is available on Monday or not.

Tuesday:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Tuesday or not.

Wednesday:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Wednesday or not.

Thursday:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Thursday or not.

Friday:

In this field you can check whether the resource is available on Friday or not.

Saturday:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Saturday (weekend) or not.

Sunday:

In this field you can check if the resource is available on Sunday (weekend) or not.

Planning > Persons > Team Building

When forming a team for a project, subproject or task, a team is created from existing human resources (HR)


Manage (create, change or delete) freely definable project teams, i.e. assign individual persons to a team. The name of the team can be freely assigned. Furthermore, a person can optionally be defined as team leader.

A project team can be set as a filter criterion for persons in order to simplify resource planning, for example.




Selection of the project team to be worked on


Selection of the project team to be worked on



Field Descriptions

Project Team:

Project Team:

Group of people assembled as a team for a specific project.

Project:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.


Accept

Clicking this button saves the entered data and continues the program execution.




Assignment of persons to a project team


Assignment of persons to a project team



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

Name:

In this field the family name of the person or the name of the legal entity (e.g. company name) is displayed or entered.

External:

i indicates that the employee is internal, e indicates that the employee is external.

Leader:

Setting the checkbox determines who is the leader of the project team.

Utilizat.:

Indicates the percentage to which a resource is already utilized (by other projects).

Materials always have 100% capacity utilization when allocated.

For employees, the utilization is calculated from the values of the target workday and the target effort for the task.
For example, an employee with a standard eight-hour day is assigned to a task with a target effort of 24 hours. The duration of the task is three days.
=>Within these three days, the employee can work three times eight hours according to the target workday
=>24 hours / (3 * 8 hours) => 1 => Utilization of the employee is exactly 100% for this task.
Now let's assume the same task is now to be completed in four days
=>24 hours / (4 * 8 hours) => 0.75 => Utilization of the employee is exactly 75% for this task.
If more than one employee is assigned to a task, the workload can be split so that, for example, one employee does 16 hours and the other does 8 hours. With a standard eight-hour day and a task runtime of four days, the workloads of the two employees in the case just mentioned would be 50% (=> 32 / 16) and 25% (=> 32 / 8) respectively.

The total workload of an employee for an appointment is calculated from the individual workloads within the tasks for this appointment, i.e. if an employee has three tasks assigned on one day, with individual workloads of 40%, 30% and 20%, then the total workload for this employee for this day would be 90%.

Missing days and holidays are taken into account in the workload calculation
.

Working Hours/Week:

This field displays the number of working hours to be worked by an employee (per week) and on which days the employee is available as a resource.

Date:

Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Execution > Times > TR (Day)

Time recording for individual tasks of a day


Time recording is used for daily recording of hours and activities. This determines the current progress of the tasks, as well as the actual actual consumption. Time recording can be billed separately for hour-based tasks. Furthermore, a current hours status can be viewed at any time via detailed daily, weekly, monthly or yearly lists, in order to illustrate overtime, floating days, caps, etc.




Person selection


Selection of one or more persons from a list depending on the program function.

To create or edit persons, switch to the corresponding program function under the main menu item Master data.



Field Descriptions

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.


Select

A click on this button confirms the selection of the person and loads the corresponding data for editing or viewing.




Daily overview


Time data listing for a selected day

In the Daily overview, the recorded hours of a person for a selected day are listed in chronological order.

Entries can be changed or deleted by clicking on the corresponding symbol at the right edge of the line. New entries as well as changes are made in the corresponding edit mask.

With the help of the "Calendar Selection" on the right side it is possible to change to another Daily overview, a Weekly/monthly overview or Annual overview.



Field Descriptions

Time Data:

Start and end times of the recorded work, if they have been entered. A totals symbol is displayed for time total records.

Break:

Number of work break performed in time format during this time period.

Tasks:

Number and name of the task on which the time recording was booked.

Serv.-Type:

Subgroup of the task to which the time recording was posted.

Activity:

Detailed description of the performed work steps.

Status:

Release status of the posting record, where means:
· x (not yet released),
· MA (released by employee),
· PL (released by project manager) and
· VW/GL (released by administration or. Management approved).

An additional R indicates that this time entry has already been accounted for.

TSum:

Number of recorded hours in time format.

Display:

Clicking on the icon displays detailed information about this time tracking record in a new window.

Edit:

By clicking on the icon this time recording record is displayed for editing in the hours input mask.
If this icon is grayed out, this means that the record can no longer be changed. It may have already been billed or have a higher release status.

Delete:

By clicking on the icon this time recording record is deleted and at the same time preassigned for a possible new creation in the hours input mask. (Thus, a possibly accidentally deleted record can be created again and the deletion thus undone.)
If this icon is grayed out, this means that the record can not be deleted. Possibly it was already settled or has a higher release status.




Expense recording


Entering the time data

In Expense recording the user enters his hours for the selected day or changes selected hourly rates.

Already worked hours for the selected day he sees in Daily overview, from where he can also select hours for editing.

To switch to Weekly/monthly overview or Annual overview, use the "Calendar Selection" on the right.

The project manager can be informed if a certain project is already finished, if the hours worked are billable or which delays are to be expected or have occurred.

Hours can only be recorded for active tasks to which the person has been assigned.

Changes can only be made as long as the record has not yet been allocated.

"Unknown": on this project employees can write their hours if there is no suitable project.

"Floating day": this project gives the user the possibility to record his floating day.

Via the settings it can be set client-wide whether start and end time or only the hourly effort should be saved.

If two of the three fields are filled in, the third is automatically calculated when writing to the database.

NOTE:
The entries for the field "Project" can be administrated at the menue item"Define Projects".
The entries for the field "Release Status" can be administrated at the menue item"Controlling/Approve Time-Recordings".
$message_2258;



Field Descriptions

Selection of the activity (project, subproject, task) for which you are authoriz:

Select and define the task to which hours are to be booked. If no suitable task is available, the bookings can also be made to [Unknown] and changed later.

Date:

Input field for the current date for which time recording entries are to be made. By default, this defaults to today's date.

CW:

Number of the week in which the day of the current time recording record lies.

Customer:

Client of the selected task. This entry can be left empty if a task has been selected, as it will then be automatically adjusted correctly when saving. For a booking on [Unknown] on the other hand, the client should be specified in order to be able to handle possible later time transfers more easily.

Release:

The release indicates whether the record has been released for settlement.

Deviation:

Variances indicate the additional effort by how many hours a project is delayed.

Alias field for time unit:

The time unit indicates whether the project is delayed by minutes, hours, man-days, man-weeks, man-months or man-years.

Rel. DOC:

The "Relative POC" depends on the determination method stored for the selected task and is used to determine the progress of the project.

Method:

Determination method of the degree of completion, which was deposited with the selected task.

TR n. invoice.:

Defines whether a time recording record is billable or not.

Completed:

Defines whether all work for a task is already done or not. (= equivalent to a project progress of 100%).
The responsible project manager receives an email about the completion of the task, as well as a date in the control center, where he can indicate whether the task is actually completed. Depending on his decision, the task is set to the status "completed" or remains active, and the employee is notified by e-mail that there are still improvements to be made.
If the project manager completes the task himself via time recording, no e-mail is sent or an appointment is created.

Start Time:

In start time is the start time of the worked activity.

End Time:

End time indicates the end time of the worked activity.

Time Sum:

Time spent in time format with 24-hour day limit.

Break:

Number of work break performed in time format during this time period.

Activity:

Detailed description of the performed work steps.

Annotation:

Internal additional information on the work steps performed, which should not be displayed in the performance record or similar.


Save

Clicking on this button saves the changes.




Weekly/monthly overview


Time data listing for a selected week or month

In the Weekly/monthly overview the recorded hours, as well as the absence days of a person or the day designations for a selected week or for a selected month are listed according to days.

By clicking on the edit or add icon on the right side of each day row, you can switch to the corresponding Daily overview.

The "Calendar Selection" on the right side can also be used to switch to Daily overview, another Weekly/monthly overview or Annual overview.



Field Descriptions

Day of Week:

Full day of the week name.

Date:

Input field for the current date for which time recording entries are to be made. By default, this defaults to today's date.

Activity:

Detailed description of the performed work steps.

H-Chk:

Traffic light graphic, which shows whether there is an hours recording for this day or not.

Plan.Hrs.:

The target hours indicate how many hours on average the person is contractually expected to work in the specified period.

Act.Hrs.:

The actual hours indicate how many hours the person actually worked in the specified period.

Delta-Val.:

The delta hours are the difference between actual and target hours. They indicate how many hours the person has worked more or less than contractually agreed in the specified period (= overtime or minus hours).

Edit:

Clicking on the or icon will switch to the corresponding Daily overview.




Annual overview


Time data listing for a selected year

The Annual overview lists a person's recorded hours and days of absence by month for a selected year.

By clicking on the arrow symbol at the right edge of each month line, you can switch to the corresponding Weekly/monthly overview.

The "Calendar Selection" on the right can be used to go to Daily overview, also to Weekly/monthly overview or to another Annual overview.



Field Descriptions

Name of Month:

Full name of the month.

Days:

Total number of days this month.

Workday:

Number of working days in this month.

Leave:

Number of vacation days in this month.

Sp. Leave:

Number of special leave days in this month.

Training:

Number of training days in this month.

Sick:

Number of sick days in this month.

Absent:

Number of unspecified absence days in this month.

Flextime:

Number of floating days in this month.

Plan.Hrs.:

The target hours indicate how many hours on average the person is contractually expected to work in the specified period.

Act.Hrs.:

The actual hours indicate how many hours the person actually worked in the specified period.

Delta-Val.:

The delta hours are the difference between actual and target hours. They indicate how many hours the person has worked more or less than contractually agreed in the specified period (= overtime or minus hours).

Edit:

Clicking on the icon will switch to the corresponding Weekly/monthly overview.

Execution > Times > TR (Week/Month)

Time recording of selected tasks over a period of 1 week or 1 month


Time recording on a weekly or monthly basis is used to quickly record hours and activities over a longer period of time for the same tasks.

NOTE:
When saving the data records, the validation (check) and database routine of the program function Execution>Times>TR (Day) is called up internally. For this reason, an activation of this program function is a basic requirement to be able to perform weekly or monthly bookings.




Selection


The data entered in the selection mask is used to restrict and define the input mask to be displayed.

Person:
Here the person must be selected, to which the time recording is to be made. Normally only the own person is preset here, except the registered person has the employee roles "management" or "administration". With this role also other person data can be accessed and the input for these persons can be done.

Display Tasks:
Multiple selection field in which it is determined which tasks are to be listed for new creation in the input mask.

Customer (Client):
A client can be selected here, which will be set to [Unknown] in all newly created time entries. Useful if it is defined client-wide that clients have to be specified.

Activity
A text can be entered here, which will be preset in all newly created time entries. Useful if it is defined client-wide that activities have to be specified.

Date or CW:
Date or calendar week, which form the basis for the period to be displayed. If both values are incompatible with each other, then the last entry specified is used. If both entries were made at the same time, then the date entry has priority.

View:
Sets the period to be displayed, which contains the date value. The following options are available:

  • five days: corresponding to a working week from Monday to Friday
  • seven days: corresponding to a calendar week from Monday to Sunday
  • one month: corresponding to a complete month

.

Detailed Information:
If this checkbox is ticked (= default setting), then additional columns with information about the task are displayed in the input mask (such as target hours, actual hours, period or priority).

Display or Today:
When clicking on the button Display or Today the input mask is called up and prefilled with the corresponding data. If you click on Today, any date entries will be overwritten with today's date. If there are entries from an already existing input mask that have not yet been saved, a warning message is displayed.



Field Descriptions

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

Project:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Customer:

Here you can select the client of the activity (project, subproject or task).

Activity:

In this field you have the possibility to describe your work in detail. The more exact the descriptions, the more exactly the work progress can be reconstructed at a later time.

Date:

Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

CW:

Number of the week in which the day of the current time recording record lies.

View:

In the field "View" you can specify how many days should be displayed on the calendar, e.g. one-day view or 7-day week etc.

Detailed Inf.:

By ticking this checkbox, the normal report is extended by additional, more detailed information.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.

Today

Button of the date selection. After clicking you will find yourself at today's date.




Enter


In the input mask all existing time registrations of the defined period are listed with the possibility to change or delete them (exception: time registrations which have already been accounted).

Subsequently, all selected tasks as well as the special case [Unknown] are listed in a separate line each in order to be able to execute new entries.

If the period is set to month and a lot of tasks are listed, so that they do not fit in the display area, you can move them to the left and right as well as up and down using scroll bars. The task, headings or totals part always remains in the display.

The left section contains task information adapted to the selected person, i.e. their target hours according to the percentage resource planning, actual hours, etc.

The right section is the actual input section. For each day, a time recording can be performed here for exactly one task, in these four standard fields:

  • Start corresponding to the start time, e.g. 10:00.
  • End corresponding to the end time, e.g. 15:00 o'clock.
  • Break corresponding to the work break, e.g. 0:30 h (= 30 minutes)
  • Duration corresponding to the work duration, e.g. 4:50 h



The logical relations between the fields are calculated by JavaScript, i.e. if a start time and an end time are entered, the duration is automatically calculated and displayed immediately, etc.

The footer displays day information, which is also automatically calculated by JavaScript. These are:

  • Total break corresponding to the sum of all work breaks of this day
  • Total duration corresponding to the sum of all working hours of this day
  • Target hours per day corresponding to the employee-specific target hours per day. the employee-specific target hours of this day
  • Difference target hours corresponding to the difference duration - target hours



When clicking on the Save button, the data is validated and written to the database by indirectly calling the "normal" time entry on a daily basis for each record.

NOTE:
Clicking on the date in the day column will jump to the "normal" time entry on a daily basis for that day. If there are any unsaved entries a warning message will be displayed.


Clicking with the right mouse button in one of the input fields will open an action menu in which further functionalities are provided, such as:

  • Edit entry: Opens a new window to be able to enter additional information for this time entry such as activity, note, billable, degree of completion etc.
  • Delete entry: Deletes the currently selected entries of the new entry from the list or marks an already existing time entry for deletion.
  • Delete day: like Delete entry, but for the whole day



Color legend of days:

Workday
Today
No work day (e.g..E.g. weekend, floating day, special day such as vacation, sick, training, etc.)
holiday (half or full day)



Field Descriptions

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.


Save

Button to save data.

Execution > Times > TR (Sum)

Time recording of any number of hours for individual tasks


The time total recording is used for the collected hours and activities recording either for one day or for a whole period of time without daily hours limitation or checking the compliance with the work breaks.

This is a simple way to determine the current progress of tasks, as well as the actual actual consumption without having to perform an explicit daily time recording.

Time total recordings have the same properties as normal time recordings, i.e. they can also be accounted separately for hour-based tasks or have an effect on the overtime calculation, etc.




Person selection


Selection of one or more persons from a list depending on the program function.

To create or edit persons, switch to the corresponding program function under the main menu item Master data.



Field Descriptions

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.


Select

A click on this button confirms the selection of the person and loads the corresponding data for editing or viewing.




Daily overview


Time data listing for a selected day

In the Daily overview, the recorded hours of a person for a selected day are listed in chronological order.

Entries can be changed or deleted by clicking on the corresponding symbol at the right edge of the line. New entries as well as changes are made in the corresponding edit mask.

With the help of the "Calendar Selection" on the right side it is possible to change to another Daily overview, a Weekly/monthly overview or Annual overview.



Field Descriptions

Time Data:

Start and end times of the recorded work, if they have been entered. A totals symbol is displayed for time total records.

Break:

Number of work break performed in time format during this time period.

Tasks:

Number and name of the task on which the time recording was booked.

Serv.-Type:

Subgroup of the task to which the time recording was posted.

Activity:

Detailed description of the performed work steps.

Status:

Release status of the posting record, where means:
· x (not yet released),
· MA (released by employee),
· PL (released by project manager) and
· VW/GL (released by administration or. Management approved).

An additional R indicates that this time entry has already been accounted for.

TSum:

Number of recorded hours in time format.

Display:

Clicking on the icon displays detailed information about this time tracking record in a new window.

Edit:

By clicking on the icon this time recording record is displayed for editing in the hours input mask.
If this icon is grayed out, this means that the record can no longer be changed. It may have already been billed or have a higher release status.

Delete:

By clicking on the icon this time recording record is deleted and at the same time preassigned for a possible new creation in the hours input mask. (Thus, a possibly accidentally deleted record can be created again and the deletion thus undone.)
If this icon is grayed out, this means that the record can not be deleted. Possibly it was already settled or has a higher release status.




Recording of expense totals


In Recording of expense totals collected hour and activity records can be entered or modified either for one day or for a whole time period without daily hour limitation or check of compliance with work breaks.

Hours already recorded for the selected day are listed in Daily overview. There entries can also be selected for editing or deletion.

The project manager can be informed whether the work on a certain task has already been completed, what degree of progress the work has, or whether the hours worked are billable or not.


NOTE:

  • Hours can only be recorded for active tasks to which one is assigned as a resource.
  • Changes can only be made as long as the record has not yet been charged or released by a higher instance.
  • On "Unknown"can always be posted if no suitable task has yet been assigned.




Field Descriptions

Tasks:

Select and define the task to which hours are to be booked. If no suitable task is available, the bookings can also be made to [Unknown] and changed later.

CW:

Number of the week in which the day of the current time recording record lies.

Customer:

Client of the selected task. This entry can be left empty if a task has been selected, as it will then be automatically adjusted correctly when saving. For a booking on [Unknown] on the other hand, the client should be specified in order to be able to handle possible later time transfers more easily.

Rel. DOC:

The "Relative POC" depends on the determination method stored for the selected task and is used to determine the progress of the project.

Method:

Determination method of the degree of completion, which was deposited with the selected task.

TR non invoiceable:

Defines whether a time recording record is billable or not.

Completed:

Defines whether all work for a task is already done or not. (= equivalent to a project progress of 100%).
The responsible project manager receives an email about the completion of the task, as well as a date in the control center, where he can indicate whether the task is actually completed. Depending on his decision, the task is set to the status "completed" or remains active, and the employee is notified by e-mail that there are still improvements to be made.
If the project manager completes the task himself via time recording, no e-mail is sent or an appointment is created.

Start Date:

Date to which the entered time expenditure is to be posted.

End Date:

If a date is specified, the time entered will be prorated to the working days between the start and end dates.

Time Sum:

Time spent in time format without 24-hour day limit.

Activity:

Detailed description of the performed work steps.

Annotation:

Internal additional information on the work steps performed, which should not be displayed in the performance record or similar.


Save

Clicking on this button saves the changes.




Weekly/monthly overview


Time data listing for a selected week or month

In the Weekly/monthly overview the recorded hours, as well as the absence days of a person or the day designations for a selected week or for a selected month are listed according to days.

By clicking on the edit or add icon on the right side of each day row, you can switch to the corresponding Daily overview.

The "Calendar Selection" on the right side can also be used to switch to Daily overview, another Weekly/monthly overview or Annual overview.



Field Descriptions

Day of Week:

Full day of the week name.

Date:

Current date of the listed row.

Activity:

More detailed description of the day, such as working day, day of absence or public holiday, etc.

H-Chk:

Traffic light graphic, which shows whether there is an hours recording for this day or not.

Plan.Hrs.:

The target hours indicate how many hours on average the person is contractually expected to work in the specified period.

Act.Hrs.:

The actual hours indicate how many hours the person actually worked in the specified period.

Delta-Val.:

The delta hours are the difference between actual and target hours. They indicate how many hours the person has worked more or less than contractually agreed in the specified period (= overtime or minus hours).

Edit:

Clicking on the or icon will switch to the corresponding Daily overview.




Annual overview


Time data listing for a selected year

The Annual overview lists a person's recorded hours and days of absence by month for a selected year.

By clicking on the arrow symbol at the right edge of each month line, you can switch to the corresponding Weekly/monthly overview.

The "Calendar Selection" on the right can be used to go to Daily overview, also to Weekly/monthly overview or to another Annual overview.



Field Descriptions

Name of Month:

Full name of the month.

Days:

Total number of days this month.

Workday:

Number of working days in this month.

Leave:

Number of vacation days in this month.

Sp. Leave:

Number of special leave days in this month.

Training:

Number of training days in this month.

Sick:

Number of sick days in this month.

Absent:

Number of unspecified absence days in this month.

Flextime:

Number of floating days in this month.

Plan.Hrs.:

The target hours indicate how many hours on average the person is contractually expected to work in the specified period.

Act.Hrs.:

The actual hours indicate how many hours the person actually worked in the specified period.

Delta-Val.:

The delta hours are the difference between actual and target hours. They indicate how many hours the person has worked more or less than contractually agreed in the specified period (= overtime or minus hours).

Edit:

Clicking on the icon will switch to the corresponding Weekly/monthly overview.

Execution > Times > Transfer

Transfer recorded time data to other tasks


Transfer of time recording entries from one task to another. Mass transfers are also possible.




Determine selection criteria


Define selection criteria for time account changes

Here, the employees' time account entries (possibly posted as unknown) can be assigned to a task over a certain period of time.



Field Descriptions

Indicates whether a material is purchased separately for a project.:

Indicates if a material is purchased extra "for (a) project". The acquisition cost is added to the internal consumed budget, the sales price is added to the external consumed budget of the project and its parents.

If no project is selected, these costs do not flow into the project.

Act. Start:

Indicates the start date of the respective reference object, e.g. projects, time data, travel data, etc.

Selection of the activity (project, subproject, task) for which you are authoriz:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Act. End:

The actual end date of the respective reference object, e.g. project, time data, travel data, etc. is displayed or specified here.

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

Max. Chars:

Defines the maximum number of text characters to be displayed, i.e. if a text is too long (especially for print formatting), the text will be wrapped or truncated after the entered number of characters, depending on the "Line break" field set.

An entry of '0' means: no text wrapping. For print formatting, e.g., for the "Proof of service", the preset value of 50 (= default) is recommended.

Customer:

Here you can select the client of the activity (project, subproject or task).

Line Break:

Specifies whether texts are to be wrapped or truncated after a certain number of characters. When text is wrapped, the text remaining after a certain number of characters is continued in the next line and possibly wrapped again, and so on.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




List of time account entries


List of time account entries

Displays all time account entries that match the selection criteria.

With the help of this mask it is possible to book time account entries from one project to another. The prerequisite for this is that the person is assigned as a resource in both projects and the "source project" contains time data of this employee.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

Date:

Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

Time:

In this field, a selection menu can be used to select how fields of the type "Time span" are to be displayed or converted. Possible values are: "hour(s)", "day(s)", "month(s)" and "year(s)".

Proj. No.:

This is the directory number for a project.

The directory number cannot be changed for parent projects.

The directory number is automatically adjusted when deleting or moving.

By manually changing the directory number, you can move projects within a hierarchy.

Serv.-Type:

The activity type in cost accounting is a reference value that indicates the qualitative technical description of the production activity. Here, it can be classified between productive (=value-adding) and non-productive types.

Effort:

If this field is checked, the effort fields are shown in the project report.

Project:

In Project/Task the project or task is selected for which the key data should be displayed.

Activity:

In this field you have the possibility to describe your work in detail. The more exact the descriptions, the more exactly the work progress can be reconstructed at a later time.

Time:

In time spent the user can specify the time spent in hours and minutes.

TR ni:

Here you can specify whether the time recording should be invoiced or not.

Inv.:

Specifies the type of allocation.

Rel.:

The release indicates whether the record has been released for settlement.

Customer:

In customer the client of the project or subproject or task is selected.

Prs-Account.Ap.:

Specifies the type of billing according to which person services are billed, for example, fixed price, person days, hours, etc.

Depending on which value is set here, this has an influence on the invoice writing.
Fixed Price: In this case, the value entered in the Intern Plan. Budget field of this project will be used as the respective fixed price amount in the invoice writing.
Per Hour Basis: Invoice items are created based on hours worked (or travel expenses recorded).
Not Invoiceable: Tasks that carry this accounting type will not be included in the invoice writing for person fixed price or person hourly basis.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Execution > Times > Approval

Approval of recorded times by employees or superiors


Release of time recording entries in the corresponding control instance. I.e. before a possible accounting an entry should run through the release procedure. This ensures that correct data is available.

The control instances are arranged in the following sequence:
(1) MA=employee - (2) PL=project manager - (3) VW/GL=administration/management.




Selection criteria


Restricting the display quantity

In Selection criteria the period and project branch are restricted. This allows for individual, more manageable displays.



Field Descriptions

Time Span from:

This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Time Span to:

This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Ignore Release:

If this checkbox is set, already released entries in the selected period will be hidden, i.e. not listed.

Project:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Max. Project Chars:

Definition of the maximum number of text characters to be displayed for the project designation, i.e. if a text is too long (in particular for print formatting), the text is wrapped or truncated from the number of characters entered, depending on the "Line break" field set. If a value is entered, the project is also displayed without the project numbering.

An entry of '0' means: No text wrapping and project numbering (= default).

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

Max. Text Chars:

Defines the maximum number of text characters to be displayed, i.e. if a text is too long (especially for print formatting), the text will be wrapped or truncated after the entered number of characters, depending on the "Line break" field set.

An entry of '0' means: no text wrapping. For print formatting, e.g., for the "Proof of service", the preset value of 50 (= default) is recommended.

Customer:

Here you can select the client of the activity (project, subproject or task).

Line Break:

Specifies whether texts are to be wrapped or truncated after a certain number of characters. When text is wrapped, the text remaining after a certain number of characters is continued in the next line and possibly wrapped again, and so on.

Time Data:

In this field the user sees the start and end times of the activities performed.

Travel Costs:

Here you can select how the travel expenses entered in the time recording are to be included in the listed calculation.

Possible settings:


Display travel expenses in separate row:
- Travel expenses are included and displayed on the next line of the project to which they are assigned.

Add travel expenses to employee costs:
- Travel expenses are included and added to employee costs in the same row of the project to which they are assigned.

Show Travel Expenses Alone:
- Only all travel expenses incurred alone will be displayed in the listing, meaning that all other employee hourly costs will not be included in the calculation.

Do not add travel expenses:
- Travel costs are not included in the calculation, only employee hourly costs are listed.

Material:

If this checkbox is set, materials are displayed.

Annotation:

This field displays general comments about a project.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




Share


List of recorded times, travel expenses or material consumption depending on defined selection criteria. The individual entries can then be released. Released entries can no longer be changed by a lower instance. If authorized, the release can also be reversed.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

Date:

Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

Time:

Used to enter or display a time.

Project:

This field displays employees who are involved in the current project.

Type:

Type of the associated element.

Description:

Explanatory descriptions, details, comments or similar.

Internal Annotation:

This field is used to annotate a project for internal purposes only.

Amount:

How much of a material was purchased or consumed (Usually linked to a unit, e.g. piece, kg, etc.).

Unit:

In which unit is the quantity of article defined, e.g.: kg, m , pcs, or similar.

TR ni:

Here you can specify whether the time recording should be invoiced or not.

TC ni:

Indicates whether the travel expenses should be charged or not.

MU ni:

Indicates whether the material consumption should be charged or not.

Status:

The current status of a user is stored in this field:
0 - active (without SYS password) = without password automatically generated by the system after lock etc.
1 - active (with SYS password) = with system-generated password via [Password gen.].
2 - inactive
3 - locked


Save

Button to save data.

Execution > Travels > Travel Expense Recording

Recording of travel expenses, daily allowances and receipts


Travel expense entry is used for daily travel and receipt entry.

This determines the current progress of the tasks, as well as the actual actual consumption. Trips can be accounted separately as well as combined with the normal time recording.

You can use travel expense entry to enter your additional expenses for meals and receipts for trips.

The trips including the incurred costs can be viewed immediately via detailed weekly, monthly or annual lists in an overview and downloaded using the file manager, either as a PDF file or in CSV format.

You can also generate detailed activity reports from the trips with just a few clicks.




Person selection


Selection of one or more persons from a list depending on the program function.

To create or edit persons, switch to the corresponding program function under the main menu item Master data.



Field Descriptions

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.


Select

A click on this button confirms the selection of the person and loads the corresponding data for editing or viewing.




Travel expenses daily overview


Here you will find the daily overview of travel expenses.

The first mask displayed (if data has already been entered for the selected date) is the daily overview, which helps the employee to get an overview of the period for which data has already been entered.

In this screen, the entered trip data is listed and added up in chronological order. You see an overview of the specified kilometers, as well as the incurred costs gross and net. By clicking on the corresponding symbol, entries can be changed or deleted, as well as receipts and their day details can be recorded for the entered trip.

New travel expense entries are made using the input mask displayed below.

NOTE:
To switch to other views (weekly, monthly or yearly overview) please use the calendar on the right side.



Field Descriptions

Number:

Sequential unique numbering.

Date:

Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

Category:

You can select the document that applies to you from the list of document types.

For the voucher type "Hotel incl. meals" additional fields will be displayed, as special legal regulations apply here. If you store a hotel receipt including meals, the reimbursement amount is reduced by a flat rate for breakfast, lunch and dinner. For example, for breakfast on a trip abroad, a flat rate of 20% of the valid additional meals expense is deducted, and for lunch and dinner, 40% each.

For receipt types for car expenses, note that for business trips with a private car, all costs are settled with the claim of the miles/kms per diems. Other costs, such as receipts for fuel and oil, may not be settled additionally. This does not apply to parking fees.

For international trips, a VAT rate of 0% is preset, since VAT may only be deducted for domestic receipts.

Rel.:

The current status of a user is stored in this field:
0 - active (without SYS password) = without password automatically generated by the system after lock etc.
1 - active (with SYS password) = with system-generated password via [Password gen.].
2 - inactive
3 - locked

Km (one-w):

Here the simple distance between the two travel locations must be entered in km. The number entered must be entered as an integer, therefore kilometres travelled must always be rounded up.
e.g. real distance of 234,40 km => 235 km

RK (nt.):

This field contains the net amount to be settled for travel expenses.
In this selection field you can choose the type of trip.

  • Inland trip:
    A domestic trip is when you temporarily (maximum 3 months) away from your home and away from your regular place of work in the domestic professional activity.
  • Foreign trip:
    A foreign trip is when you are temporarily (maximum 3 months) outside your home and away from your regular place of work abroad professionally active.
  • Receipts without trip:
    This accounting type allows you to enter receipts without them having to be assigned to a trip. So it is also possible to account for receipts that are not related to a trip.
  • Other:
    Here you can enter other trips that do not fit into any other category.


VAT:

This field contains the expected VAT amount for this trip, i.e. the difference between gross and net. Expected because the effective VAT amount can be overwritten when the invoice is issued.

TE (Gr.):

In this field, enter the gross amount in the displayed company currency that has been incurred for the selected task as travel expenses or travel receipt.

Edit:

You can use the change icon to change trip or receipt entries that have been made. Note, however, that if you change trip data, the receipts and day specifications stored for them are deleted and must be entered again so that the calculations of the travel expenses are always correct. Once the trip itself or its receipts have been settled, the trip can no longer be changed or deleted.

Delete:

You can use the delete icon to delete trip or receipt entries that have been made. As soon as the trip itself or its receipts have been accounted, the trip can no longer be deleted.

Day Specificat.:

Icon for creating a day specification for a trip. Day specifications are, for example, meals or accommodation per diems.

You can use the trip costs day specifications to enter the per diems and accommodations per diems incurred for the trip.

Daily per diems for meals:
Extra expenses for meals include the additional costs, also called "expenses", which a person has to bear because he or she is away from home or away from the regular place of work for work-related reasons and therefore cannot eat as cheaply as at home. The additional expenses incurred for work-related reasons can be claimed under tax law as income-related expenses or business expenses under certain conditions.
For each country, you can declare per diems for a length of stay of less than 14 hours but at least 8 hours, less than 24 hours but at least 14 hours, and for 24 hours. If a trip begins after 16:00 and ends before 08:00 of the following day without an overnight stay, the travel times of both days are to be added and attributed to the day on which the most travel time was spent and, provided that the required time of at least 8 hours was reached, an additional meal expense can be claimed.
In this mask, you can select the per diems incurred for your trip and receive the same output of the costs.

Daily per diems overnight stay:
Overnight per diems can only be granted if the traveler is an employee. The employer may reimburse his employee for overnight expenses tax-free:
In the amount of the expenses proven by receipt or without proof in the amount of the lump sum, which varies from country to country, insofar as the employee did not receive the accommodation from the employer or from a third party free of charge or at a reduced price due to his employment relationship.
The tax-free payment of the lump sums is also not permitted for overnight stays in a vehicle. In the case of the use of a sleeping car or a ship's cabin, the lump sums may only be paid tax-free if the overnight stay has begun or ended in other accommodation.
Business owners have not been able to claim any lump sums for overnight stays at all since 2008. Costs for overnight stays can only be claimed by entrepreneurs as business expenses in the amount actually incurred, which must be proven by receipt.
In this mask you can select the per diems incurred for your trip.

Meals arranged by the employer:
With the help of this input mask, you can also enter for each travel day whether you have received meals arranged by your employer. A prerequisite for these meals is that the employer has agreed in writing or booked the delivery of the meals with the hotel or restaurant before the trip. The meals received free of charge are part of the taxable wages and are to be valued at the official non-cash remuneration value.
If the employee makes a personal contribution at least in the amount of the official non-cash remuneration value of the respective meal, it is not to be recorded as wages.
If you have provided information on free meals, these are valued at the official non-cash remuneration value and deducted from your claim for reimbursement of travel expenses. Your own contribution has therefore been made. In order to enter these meals in this input mask, place a check mark in the field less Paym. in Kind.

Sep. Voucher:

Icon for creating individual receipts for a trip. This allows you to record and verify the expenses incurred for your trip using individual receipts.
verify them.

You can select the relevant receipt from the list of receipt types.

For receipt types for vehicle expenses, note that for business trips with a private vehicle, all costs are covered by the mileage allowance. Other costs, such as receipts for fuel and oil, may not be settled additionally. This does not apply to parking fees.

For international trips, a VAT rate of 0% is preset, since VAT may only be deducted for domestic receipts.




Mileage allowances


You can use this input mask to enter your trips.

Under Project the task to which the trip is to be booked can be selected. The Customer (Client) is automatically adjusted to the selected task. With the help of the checkbox TR non invoiceable you can determine whether the hours spent on the trip should be billable in invoicing. If you tick the checkbox Time Data Section, the time spent is also transferred to the employee's time recording, provided that the start and end date of the trip fall on the same day. Here you can also enter the start and end times of the trip, which are the basis for time recording and hour accounting.

In the lower part of the screen you can calculate and enter the mileage allowances for domestic and international trips, post receipts without trips, and enter other trips. In the selection field "Country/Place" you can select the trip country. The countries that can be selected here can be stored in the settings menu under travel expense per diems together with the valid statutory per diems. These flat rates are country-specific and can be viewed in the official country lists of the Federal Ministry of Finance.

Under Start and destination, you can list the starting point and end point of your trip.

If you enter a mileage, the gross amount is automatically calculated according to the vehicle type used, based on the per diems stored under Travel expense settings.

In the activity window you have the possibility to describe your activities in detail and in the annotation field you will find space to leave any necessary comments.

NOTE:
When you save the trip data, the trip will now be viewable in the upper window as a travel expense daily report. Now you can make in the next step by means of the icons placed next to exact day information on additional expenses for meals and accommodation lump sums, as well as record travel receipts.



Field Descriptions

Activity Rep-ID:

The activity report number groups together several time recording entries, is determined during the activity statement and printed on it. With its help, the records to be allocated can be found and processed more quickly.

Release:

The release indicates whether the record has been released for settlement.

Selection of the activity (project, subproject, task) for which you are authoriz:

Here you can select the task to which a trip should be posted. Care should be taken that the trip must be within the time frame of the task. Also, it must be assigned to the task.

Act. Start:

In this input field the start date of the trip has to be entered.

Start Time:

In this input field the start time of the trip must be entered.

Customer:

In this field, you can select the sold-to party for which the trip was started. If you have already selected a task in the upper selection field, the principal is automatically adjusted to the task.

Act. End:

In this input field the end date of the trip has to be entered.

End Time:

In this input field the end time of the trip must be entered.

TCR n. invoice.:

This checkbox allows you to determine if the travel expenses should be billable in invoicing.

Time Data:

With a hook in this checkbox the spent times are taken over immediately into the time registration of the employee, provided that start and end date of the trip fall on the same day.

TR n. invoice.:

Used to determine if the hours spent on the trip should be billable as time data in invoicing.

Time Sum:

In this input field the time spent on the trip can be entered in hours and minutes in the format "hh:mm".

Travel Type:

In this selection field you can choose the type of trip.

Domestic trip:
A domestic trip is when you are temporarily (maximum 3 months) away from your home and away from your regular place of work in Germany.

Travel abroad:
A travel abroad is deemed to have taken place if you temporarily (for a maximum of 3 months) work abroad away from your home and your regular place of work.

Receipts without trip:
This accounting type allows you to enter receipts without having to assign them to a trip. In this way, it is also possible to settle receipts that are not connected to a trip.

Other:
Here you can enter other trips that do not fit into any other category.

Travel No.:

Unique number of a trip or receipt.

Activity:

In this field you have the possibility to describe your work in detail. The more exact the descriptions, the more exactly the work progress can be reconstructed at a later time.

Annotation:

In this field you can leave general remarks to the trip data.

Text Lines:

Text line


Save

Button to save data.




Daily Details


In this mask you can enter your daily data for the entered trip in detail and receive a cost summary immediately.

Daily allowances for meals:
Additional expenses for meals include the additional costs, also called "expenses", which a person has to bear because he/she is away from his/her own home or away from the regular place of work for professional reasons and therefore cannot eat as cheaply as at home. The additional expenses incurred for work-related reasons can be claimed under tax law as income-related expenses or business expenses under certain conditions.
For each country, you can declare per diems for a length of stay of less than 14 hours but at least 8 hours, less than 24 hours but at least 14 hours, and for 24 hours. If a trip begins after 16:00 and ends before 08:00 of the following day without an overnight stay, the travel times of both days are to be added and attributed to the day on which the most travel time was spent and, provided that the required time of at least 8 hours was reached, an additional meal expense can be claimed.
In this mask, you can select the per diems incurred for your trip and receive the same output of the costs.

Daily per diems overnight stay:
Overnight per diems can only be granted if the traveler is an employee. The employer may reimburse his employee for overnight expenses tax-free:
In the amount of the expenses proven by receipt or without proof in the amount of the lump sum, which varies from country to country, insofar as the employee did not receive the accommodation from the employer or from a third party free of charge or at a reduced price due to his employment relationship.
