The tax-free payment of the lump sums is also not permitted for overnight stays in a vehicle. In the case of the use of a sleeping car or a ship's cabin, the lump sums may only be paid tax-free if the overnight stay has begun or ended in other accommodation.
Business owners have not been able to claim any lump sums for overnight stays at all since 2008. Costs for overnight stays can only be claimed by entrepreneurs as business expenses in the amount actually incurred, which must be proven by receipt.
In this mask you can select the per diems incurred for your trip.

Meals arranged by the employer:
With the help of this input mask, you can also enter for each travel day whether you have received meals arranged by your employer. A prerequisite for these meals is that the employer has agreed in writing or booked the delivery of the meals with the hotel or restaurant before the trip. The meals received free of charge are part of the taxable wages and are to be valued at the official non-cash remuneration value.
If the employee makes a personal contribution at least in the amount of the official non-cash remuneration value of the respective meal, it is not to be recorded as wages.
If you have provided information on free meals, these are valued at the official non-cash remuneration value and deducted from your claim for reimbursement of travel expenses. Your own contribution has therefore been made. In order to enter these meals in this input mask, place a check mark in the field less Paym. in Kind.



Field Descriptions

Type of Travel:

In this selection field you can choose the type of trip.

Domestic trip:
A domestic trip is when you are temporarily (maximum 3 months) away from your home and away from your regular place of work in Germany.

Travel abroad:
A travel abroad is deemed to have taken place if you temporarily (for a maximum of 3 months) work abroad away from your home and your regular place of work.

Receipts without trip:
This accounting type allows you to enter receipts without having to assign them to a trip. In this way, it is also possible to settle receipts that are not connected to a trip.

Other:
Here you can enter other trips that do not fit into any other category.

Annotation:

In this field you can leave general remarks to the trip data.

TCR non invoiceable:

This checkbox allows you to determine if the travel expenses should be billable in invoicing.

Text Lines:

Text line


Save

Button to save data.




Individual documents


If you had expenses during a trip that you can prove with receipts, you have the option of entering these receipts in this input screen.

You can select the relevant receipt in the list of receipt types.

For receipt types for car expenses, note that for business trips with a private car, all costs are covered by the mileage allowance. Other costs, such as receipts for fuel and oil, may not be settled additionally. This does not apply to parking fees.

For international trips, a VAT rate of 0% is preset, since VAT may only be deducted for domestic receipts.



Field Descriptions

Type of Travel:

In this selection field you can choose the type of trip.

Domestic trip:
A domestic trip is when you are temporarily (maximum 3 months) away from your home and away from your regular place of work in Germany.

Travel abroad:
A travel abroad is deemed to have taken place if you temporarily (for a maximum of 3 months) work abroad away from your home and your regular place of work.

Receipts without trip:
This accounting type allows you to enter receipts without having to assign them to a trip. In this way, it is also possible to settle receipts that are not connected to a trip.

Other:
Here you can enter other trips that do not fit into any other category.

Voucher No.:

Unique number of a trip or receipt.

Annotation:

In this field you can leave general remarks to the trip data.

S. Voucher Type:

You can select the document that applies to you from the list of document types.

For the voucher type "Hotel incl. meals" additional fields will be displayed, as special legal regulations apply here. If you store a hotel receipt including meals, the reimbursement amount is reduced by a flat rate for breakfast, lunch and dinner. For example, for breakfast on a trip abroad, a flat rate of 20% of the valid additional meals expense is deducted, and for lunch and dinner, 40% each.

For receipt types for car expenses, note that for business trips with a private car, all costs are settled with the claim of the miles/kms per diems. Other costs, such as receipts for fuel and oil, may not be settled additionally. This does not apply to parking fees.

For international trips, a VAT rate of 0% is preset, since VAT may only be deducted for domestic receipts.

Pay. Type:

The payment type for travel expense receipts specifies who paid the receipt.

There are two possibilities:

  • Company
    The receipt was paid by the company, e.g. usually for airline tickets, hotel accommodation etc.
  • Private
    The receipt was paid privately by the employee, e.g. usually for food, parking, taxi etc.

Start Date:

In this field the date of the single document must be entered. If a document extends over several days, then the start date must be entered here.
The date must be within the period of the underlying trip!

TC ni:

This checkbox allows you to determine if the travel expenses should be billable in invoicing.

Subject:

Additional information for an individual document.

Here you can enter the subject of a single receipt (max. 128 characters), e.g. the hotel name for a "hotel receipt", the restaurant name for a "catering receipt", the type of vehicle for a "rental car" etc.

TE (Nt.):

This field contains the net amount to be settled for travel expenses.
In this selection field you can choose the type of trip.

  • Inland trip:
    A domestic trip is when you temporarily (maximum 3 months) away from your home and away from your regular place of work in the domestic professional activity.
  • Foreign trip:
    A foreign trip is when you are temporarily (maximum 3 months) outside your home and away from your regular place of work abroad professionally active.
  • Receipts without trip:
    This accounting type allows you to enter receipts without them having to be assigned to a trip. So it is also possible to account for receipts that are not related to a trip.
  • Other:
    Here you can enter other trips that do not fit into any other category.


VAT:

Here you can select the VAT rate applicable to the individual receipt.
For foreign trips, a VAT rate of 0% is preset, since VAT may only be deducted for domestic receipts.

TE (Gr.):

In this field, enter the gross amount in the displayed company currency that has been incurred for the selected task as travel expenses or travel receipt.

Text Lines:

Text line


Save

Button to save data.




Cost Report


In this mask you get a travel expense report of the employee optionally in a weekly, monthly, or annual view. The report can be displayed and downloaded directly via the file manager in PDF or CSV format with just a few clicks.



Field Descriptions

Day:

Full day of the week name.

Date:

Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

Time:

Used to enter or display a time.

Project:

This field displays employees who are involved in the current project.

Serv.-Type:

The activity type in cost accounting is a reference value that indicates the qualitative technical description of the production activity. Here, it can be classified between productive (=value-adding) and non-productive types.

Plan.Hrs.:

Indicates how many hours an employee must work in a given period of time

Act.Hrs.:

Indicates how many hours an employee actually worked in a given time period.

Delta:

The delta hours are the difference between actual and target hours. They indicate how many hours the person has worked more or less than contractually agreed in the specified period (= overtime or minus hours).

PP:

This is the monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial expenditure for the company per hour of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to VK=sales price).

Costs:

Specifies whether the material always incurs costs (fixed) or only when used (variable).

VAT:

VAT on the total price of certain items.

Gross:

Invoice costs including statutory value added tax

Inv.Hrs.:

This field contains the billable hours for an entered activity.

SP:

This is the monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial return for the company per day of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to EK=purchase price).

Income:

Yield = Number of hours to be billed x VK

U-Margin:

Consumption margin for a project, i.e. the difference between ext. consumed budget and int. consumed budget.

Rel.:

The release indicates whether the record has been released for settlement.

Clear:

Specifies whether or not to display offsetting entries.

Inv.:

Specifies whether or not to display billed entries.

Link:

This field is optional. If a link is entered, the automatic user rights query is bypassed and the Trans_ID field is cleared.

Execution > Travels > Approval

Approval of the recorded travels, expenses, daily allowances or receipts by employees, contractors or superiors


Release of travel expense entries in the relevant control instance. I.e. before a possible settlement an entry should run through the release procedure. This ensures that correct data is available.

The control instances are arranged in the following sequence:
(1) MA=employee - (2) PL=project manager - (3) VW/GL=administration/management.




Selection criteria


Restricting the display quantity

In Selection criteria the period and project branch are restricted. This allows for individual, more manageable displays.



Field Descriptions

Time Span from:

This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Time Span to:

This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Ignore Release:

Ignore release

Project:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Max. Project Chars:

Definition of the maximum number of text characters to be displayed for the project designation, i.e. if a text is too long (in particular for print formatting), the text is wrapped or truncated from the number of characters entered, depending on the "Line break" field set. If a value is entered, the project is also displayed without the project numbering.

An entry of '0' means: No text wrapping and project numbering (= default).

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

Max. Text Chars:

Defines the maximum number of text characters to be displayed, i.e. if a text is too long (especially for print formatting), the text will be wrapped or truncated after the entered number of characters, depending on the "Line break" field set.

An entry of '0' means: no text wrapping. For print formatting, e.g., for the "Proof of service", the preset value of 50 (= default) is recommended.

Customer:

Here you can select the client of the activity (project, subproject or task).

Line Break:

Specifies whether texts are to be wrapped or truncated after a certain number of characters. When text is wrapped, the text remaining after a certain number of characters is continued in the next line and possibly wrapped again, and so on.

Time Data:

In this field the user sees the start and end times of the activities performed.

Travel Costs:

Here you can select how the travel expenses entered in the time recording are to be included in the listed calculation.

Possible settings:


Display travel expenses in separate row:
- Travel expenses are included and displayed on the next line of the project to which they are assigned.

Add travel expenses to employee costs:
- Travel expenses are included and added to employee costs in the same row of the project to which they are assigned.

Show Travel Expenses Alone:
- Only all travel expenses incurred alone will be displayed in the listing, meaning that all other employee hourly costs will not be included in the calculation.

Do not add travel expenses:
- Travel costs are not included in the calculation, only employee hourly costs are listed.

Material:

If this checkbox is set, materials are displayed.

Annotation:

This field displays general comments about a project.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




Share


List of recorded times, travel expenses or material consumption depending on defined selection criteria. The individual entries can then be released. Released entries can no longer be changed by a lower instance. If authorized, the release can also be reversed.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

Date:

Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

Time:

Used to enter or display a time.

Project:

This field displays employees who are involved in the current project.

Type:

Type of the associated element.

Description:

Explanatory descriptions, details, comments or similar.

Internal Annotation:

This field is used to annotate a project for internal purposes only.

Amount:

How much of a material was purchased or consumed (Usually linked to a unit, e.g. piece, kg, etc.).

Unit:

In which unit is the quantity of article defined, e.g.: kg, m , pcs, or similar.

TR ni:

Here you can specify whether the time recording should be invoiced or not.

TC ni:

Indicates whether the travel expenses should be charged or not.

MU ni:

Indicates whether the material consumption should be charged or not.

Status:

The current status of a user is stored in this field:
0 - active (without SYS password) = without password automatically generated by the system after lock etc.
1 - active (with SYS password) = with system-generated password via [Password gen.].
2 - inactive
3 - locked


Save

Button to save data.

Execution > Materials > Search

Search and list specific materials


In this search mask, a search can be carried out on the recorded material resources by entering a search term. The search can be limited by the material type.




Material selection


Search criteria can be used to limit the number of material lists that are to be displayed or changed. As search criteria, for example, article numbers, material names, assigned projects, material types, usage types, storage locations and/or start or end dates can be specified.



Field Descriptions

Article Type N.:

Type of article

Text Line:

Text line

Project:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Type of the associated element:

Type of the associated element.

Residence of the person:

The person's place of residence is entered in this field.

Category:

In this field, the category is selected via a selection field.

Search from:

In this search field you can define the validity start of the time frame of the search.

Search up to:

In this search field you can set the validity end of the time frame of the search.


Search

Clicking on this button starts the search.




Material list


List of all materials in the company sorted by article number, which meet the filter criteria previously set in the selection mask.



Field Descriptions

Del.:

This field indicates whether the related field for this profile may be deleted.

Stat.:

Displays the status of a record.

Int. Item Number:

Unique internal number of an article, material, etc.

Ext. Item Number:

Unique external number of an article, material, etc.

Material Name:

Name or description of a material.

Usage Category:

Usage type of a material, that is, for which purposes this material is used.

Instant materials are materials that are assigned to tasks once, whereby the corresponding costs and/or revenues are transferred directly to the project budget, e.g. computers, printers, etc.

Consumable materials are materials that can be consumed by a person on a unit basis (pieces, meters, etc.) on a daily basis, e.g. cables, sockets, etc.

Time materials are materials that can be consumed by a person on an hourly basis and to the day, analogous to time recording, e.g. company cars, rented rooms, etc.

Material Type:

Type of a material, that is, to which material group it belongs. The material types can be defined as lookup values themselves.

For Project:

Indicates if a material is purchased extra "for (a) project". The acquisition cost is added to the internal consumed budget, the sales price is added to the external consumed budget of the project and its parents.

If no project is selected, these costs do not flow into the project.

Amount:

How much of a material was purchased or consumed (Usually linked to a unit, e.g. piece, kg, etc.).

Unit:

In which unit is the quantity of items sold, e.g. kg, pieces, meters etc.?

Start Date:

If a date is written into this field, then all determined dates are limited to dates whose start date is after the date entered here.

End Date:

If a date is written into this field, then all determined dates are limited to dates whose end date is before the date entered here.

Stock:

Indicates whether or not an item or material is stocked in a location.

Stock Loc.:

Location where an item or material is stored.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Stock Min.:

Number of minimum available consumables in the warehouse, i.e. this is how many materials should always be in stock in the warehouse.
This value is mainly used to check the stock in order to see immediately what should be reordered.

Stock Max.:

Maximum number of consumables available in the warehouse, i.e. the maximum number of materials that can or should be in stock in the warehouse.
This value is mainly used as a control upper limit for reordering materials.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Stock Ent.:

Total number of receipts of consumables into the warehouse, that is, the total number of materials by which the warehouse stock was increased.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Stock Rem.:

The total number of issues of consumables from the warehouse, that is, the total number of materials by which the warehouse stock was reduced.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Stock Act.:

Number of total consumables currently available in the warehouse. This value corresponds to the difference between the total inflow (= material increase) minus the total outflow (= material reduction).

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Stock Used:

Total number of consumables already consumed from the warehouse, i.e. materials withdrawn from the warehouse. This value is determined from the total number of day-specific entries recorded for material consumption.

Planned-Actual-Comp.:

Calculation formula:

Target/Actual comparison= ACT (= sum of all efforts made so far)
Target (= sum of planned efforts)


The target/actual comparison is the simplest method to determine the degree of progress of a project. A prerequisite for this is good effort planning.

The percentage of completion can be adjusted at any time by changing the effort planning.
For an effective determination of the POC, all methods must be considered and evaluated together!

Plnd.Cost/Unit:

Planned costs of an immediate material per unit, that is, these costs are acquisition costs of an ordered but not yet paid immediate material.

(For consumables or time materials, this value is always 0.00)

Act. Cost/Unit:

Purchase price (EK) per unit, which have an impact on the internal budget (= costs of the company).

Sale Price/Unit:

Sales price (VK) per unit, which has an impact on the external budget (= revenue of the company, which can be settled with a client).

Plnd. Cost/Tot.:

Planned total costs of an immediate material of all units, that is, these costs are acquisition costs of all ordered but not yet paid immediate materials.

Formula:
Planned total cost = Planned cost per unit * Quantity

(For consumable or time materials, this value is always 0.00)

Purch Cost/Tot.:

Total purchase prices (EKs) of all units, which have an impact on the internal budget (= costs of the company).

Formula:
Total purchase price = purchase price per unit * quantity

Sale Price/Tot.:

Total sales prices (VKs) of all units, which have an impact on the external budget (= revenue of the company, which can be settled with a client).

Formula:
Total sales price = sales price per unit * quantity

U-Margin:

Consumption margin for a project, i.e. the difference between ext. consumed budget and int. consumed budget.

Invoice No:

The placeholder for the invoice number is an admin setting value.

MT (Open):

This value indicates the externally still open, i.e. not settled (is) net costs for immediate materials.

MT (Invo.):

This value indicates the already externally billed (is) net cost for immediate materials.

I-Margin:

Invoice margin for a project, i.e. the difference between ext. settled budget and int. consumed budget.
If no invoice writing is used, this value is always negative, if int. budget was consumed.

Act.:

Action number: 1 - display, 2 - edit, 3 - create, 4 - delete

Execution > Materials > Stock

Manage the material stock of consumables


The stock levels of consumables, which have been marked as stock items, are listed here and can be managed, i.e. stocks can be removed or added. In the delete mode the complete stock can be emptied.




Material selection


Search criteria can be used to restrict the number of material lists that are to be displayed or changed. As search criteria e.g. article numbers, material names, material types, storage locations and/or start or end date can be specified.



Field Descriptions

Int. Artikelnummer:

If a number is entered here, only materials are listed which contain this number completely or partially.

Materialname:

If a name is entered here, only materials are listed which contain this name completely or partially.

Project:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Materialtyp:

If a type is selected here, only materials of that type are listed (material types are self-defined lookup values).

Lagerort:

If a location is selected here, only materials are listed which are stored at this location.

Verwendungsart:

Only consumable materials can be stock items with inventory.

Search from:

If a date is entered here, only materials are listed whose validity start date is either blank or on or before this date.

Search up to:

If a date is entered here, only materials are listed whose validity end date is either blank or on or after this date.


Search

Clicking on this button starts the search.




Material list


List of all storage materials in the company, sorted by article number, which meet the filter criteria previously set in the selection mask.



Field Descriptions

Del.:

This field indicates whether the related field for this profile may be deleted.

Stat.:

Status of a stock item, i.e. it is warned in traffic light colors if there are too few or too many materials in the stock.

Int. Item Number:

Unique internal article number of a stock material.

Ext. Item Number:

Unique external number of an article, material, etc.

Material Name:

Name or description of a material.

Usage Category:

Usage type of a material, that is, for which purposes this material is used.

Instant materials are materials that are assigned to tasks once, whereby the corresponding costs and/or revenues are transferred directly to the project budget, e.g. computers, printers, etc.

Consumable materials are materials that can be consumed by a person on a unit basis (pieces, meters, etc.) on a daily basis, e.g. cables, sockets, etc.

Time materials are materials that can be consumed by a person on an hourly basis and to the day, analogous to time recording, e.g. company cars, rented rooms, etc.

Material Type:

Type of a material, that is, to which material group it belongs. The material types can be defined as lookup values themselves.

For Project:

Indicates if a material is purchased extra "for (a) project". The acquisition cost is added to the internal consumed budget, the sales price is added to the external consumed budget of the project and its parents.

If no project is selected, these costs do not flow into the project.

Amount:

How much of a material was purchased or consumed (Usually linked to a unit, e.g. piece, kg, etc.).

Unit:

In which unit is the quantity of items sold, e.g. kg, pieces, meters etc.?

Start Date:

If a date is written into this field, then all determined dates are limited to dates whose start date is after the date entered here.

End Date:

If a date is written into this field, then all determined dates are limited to dates whose end date is before the date entered here.

Stock:

Indicates whether or not an item or material is stocked in a location.

Stock Loc.:

Location where an item or material is stored.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Stock Min.:

Number of minimum available consumables in the warehouse, i.e. this is how many materials should always be in stock in the warehouse.
This value is mainly used to check the stock in order to see immediately what should be reordered.

Stock Max.:

Maximum number of consumables available in the warehouse, i.e. the maximum number of materials that can or should be in stock in the warehouse.
This value is mainly used as a control upper limit for reordering materials.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Stock Ent.:

Total number of receipts of consumables into the warehouse, that is, the total number of materials by which the warehouse stock was increased.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Stock Rem.:

The total number of issues of consumables from the warehouse, that is, the total number of materials by which the warehouse stock was reduced.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Stock Act.:

Number of total consumables currently available in the warehouse. This value corresponds to the difference between the total inflow (= material increase) minus the total outflow (= material reduction).

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Stock Used:

Total number of consumables already consumed from the warehouse, i.e. materials withdrawn from the warehouse. This value is determined from the total number of day-specific entries recorded for material consumption.

Planned-Actual-Comp.:

Calculation formula:

Target/Actual comparison= ACT (= sum of all efforts made so far)
Target (= sum of planned efforts)


The target/actual comparison is the simplest method to determine the degree of progress of a project. A prerequisite for this is good effort planning.

The percentage of completion can be adjusted at any time by changing the effort planning.
For an effective determination of the POC, all methods must be considered and evaluated together!

Plnd.Cost/Unit:

Planned costs of an immediate material per unit, that is, these costs are acquisition costs of an ordered but not yet paid immediate material.

(For consumables or time materials, this value is always 0.00)

Act. Cost/Unit:

Purchase price (EK) per unit, which have an impact on the internal budget (= costs of the company).

Sale Price/Unit:

Sales price (VK) per unit, which has an impact on the external budget (= revenue of the company, which can be settled with a client).

Plnd. Cost/Tot.:

Planned total costs of an immediate material of all units, that is, these costs are acquisition costs of all ordered but not yet paid immediate materials.

Formula:
Planned total cost = Planned cost per unit * Quantity

(For consumable or time materials, this value is always 0.00)

Purch Cost/Tot.:

Total purchase prices (EKs) of all units, which have an impact on the internal budget (= costs of the company).

Formula:
Total purchase price = purchase price per unit * quantity

Sale Price/Tot.:

Total sales prices (VKs) of all units, which have an impact on the external budget (= revenue of the company, which can be settled with a client).

Formula:
Total sales price = sales price per unit * quantity

U-Margin:

Consumption margin for a project, i.e. the difference between ext. consumed budget and int. consumed budget.

Invoice No:

The placeholder for the invoice number is an admin setting value.

MT (Open):

This value indicates the externally still open, i.e. not settled (is) net costs for immediate materials.

MT (Invo.):

This value indicates the already externally billed (is) net cost for immediate materials.

I-Margin:

Invoice margin for a project, i.e. the difference between ext. settled budget and int. consumed budget.
If no invoice writing is used, this value is always negative, if int. budget was consumed.

Act.:

Click on this icon in delete mode to "delete" the material if no stock has been consumed yet. If a stock has already been consumed, the stock can be "emptied" by clicking on this icon.

Execution > Materials > Consumption

Material consumption recording of consumable or time materials for individual tasks of a day


Recording or listing the daily material consumption or material usage.




Material selection


Search criteria can be used to limit the number of material lists that are to be displayed or changed. As search criteria, for example, article numbers, material names, assigned projects, material types, usage types, storage locations and/or start or end dates can be specified.



Field Descriptions

Int. Artikelnummer:

If a number is entered here, only materials are listed which contain this number completely or partially.

Materialname:

If a name is entered here, only materials are listed which contain this name completely or partially.

Task:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Materialtyp:

If a type is selected here, only materials of that type are listed (material types are self-defined lookup values).

Lagerort:

If a location is selected here, only materials are listed which are stored at this location.

Verwendungsart:

Specify what type of material to list: Consumable and/or time material.

Search from:

In this search field you can define the validity start of the time frame of the search.

Search up to:

In this search field you can set the validity end of the time frame of the search.


Search

Clicking on this button starts the search.




Material allocation and consumption


Recording of the daily material consumption or the material usage of consumable or time materials.

Consumption recording can only be carried out for active tasks to which the selected person has been assigned in resource planning.

Changes can only be made as long as the consumption recording has not yet been allocated or released by a higher instance.

Entries can be posted to [Unknown] as long as, for example, no suitable task has been created.

To switch to the weekly, monthly or yearly overview the calendar of the navigation help on the right side can be used. By clicking on the "Today" icon in the calendar, the current week overview can be displayed and an entry can be made for today's date.



Field Descriptions

Material:

Selection of the consumption or time material for which a consumption or usage is to be recorded for this day.

If the desired material should not be listed due to the current selection criteria, the selection mask can be called again by a click on the [Back] button and adapted if necessary!

Captured for:

Selection of the person for whom the material entry is to be made.

The listed persons here depend on the one hand on the person authorization of the current person (= employee role etc.), and on the other hand on the authorization of the corresponding persons for a material consumption recording (= program assignment).

Task:

Selection of the task or [Unknown] on which the material entry is to be performed.

The tasks listed are dependent on the person selected and their active task assignment for that day based on resource scheduling.

Customer:

Selection of an optional sold-to party for a material entry on [Unknown].

This value is automatically adjusted to the client of a task when selecting a task.

Date:

Current date for which the material entry is to be made.

Normally this date is already correctly preset by the calendar navigation or by clicking on the icon of the overview list.

Start Time:

Start time of the material usage of the selected time material.

(This field is hidden for consumables!)

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

End Time:

End time of the material usage of the selected time material.

(This field is hidden for consumables!)

Hours:

Number of material usage hours of the selected time material. This value is calculated automatically as the difference between start and end time of the material usage.

(This field is hidden for consumables!)

Amount:

Number of material consumption (incl. unit) of the selected consumable material.

(This field is hidden for time materials!)

Dummy:

Dummy

Selling Unit:

In which unit is the quantity of items sold, e.g. kg, pieces, meters etc.?

ME n.verrech.:

Used to specify whether or not this material usage entry is billable.

Description:

Explanatory description, detail, remark or similar for this material consumption record.

Annotation:

Internal additional information for this material consumption recording, which should not be displayed in the service record or similar.


Save

Clicking this button will make the changes.




Material consumption list


This list displays all material consumption and usage within a specified time period.



Field Descriptions

Del.:

Checkbox to conveniently mark multiple material consumptions which should be deleted.

Day:

Weekday abbreviations, i.e. from "Mo" (= Monday) to "Su" (= Sunday).

Date:

Current date of the listed row.

Material Name:

Name of the material for which the material consumption was posted.

Tasks:

Number and name of the task for which the material consumption was booked.

Description:

Explanatory description, detail, remark or similar for this material consumption record.

Time:

In the case of a time material, the time span for which the material usage was booked is displayed here.

Quantity:

In the case of a consumable material, the number of consumed materials per unit that were posted is shown here.

Unit:

With a consumption material here the unit of the used materials stands which were booked.

Hr.-Costs:

Monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial expenditure for the company per hour of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to VK=sales price). Here the EK (purchase price) is to be entered, which the resource receives for the current project.

Example: An employee has a purchase price of 25 €. If he works on a "normal" project, his purchase price is also 25 €. But if he works on a project that needs all his experience, the price can be adjusted to this project (e.g. price 40 €). The adjustment is also possible for the sales price.

Hr.-Yield:

Monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial return for the company per day of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to EK=purchase price). The sales price that the resource generates for the current project must be entered here.

Example: An employee has a sales price of 40 €. If he works on a "normal" project, his sales price is also 40 €, but if he works on a project that requires all his experience, the sales price can be adjusted to this project (e.g. sales price 60 €). The adjustment is also possible for the EK.

U-Margin:

Consumption margin for a project, i.e. the difference between ext. consumed budget and int. consumed budget.

Info:

Information about this material consumption recording, ie:

person icon
display who made this capture. In the associated tooltip are extra information, as for whom and when this capture was performed including a detailed history, what was changed when.
Cancelable icon
Display whether this capture is billable or not.
billed icon
indicates whether this capture has already been billed or not.
released icon
indicates whether this capture has already been released or not.

Icon:

The individual icons for performing intentional actions, ie.

New creation icon
Create a new material consumption entry for that day.
Time icon
Directly switch to the time entry program function for that day.
Change icon
Open this material consumption recording in the detail view to possibly change.
Delete icon
Immediate deletion of this material consumption recording.

Execution > Materials > Approval

Approval of the recorded material consumption by employees or superiors


Release of material consumption entries in the corresponding control instance. This means that an entry should run through the release procedure before a possible settlement. This ensures that correct data is available.

The control instances are arranged in the following sequence:
(1) MA=employee - (2) PL=project manager - (3) VW/GL=administration/management.




Selection criteria


Search criteria can be used to restrict the number of entries to be released (materials or optionally also time data or travel expenses). Search criteria can be e.g. the period (normally the last month), a certain project, a certain person or a certain client.

Furthermore, a checkbox can be used to specify whether entries that have already been released should be displayed or hidden.



Field Descriptions

period of time:

Specify the time period (start and end date) in which found entries are to be displayed. Normally this period is preset with the last month.

CAUTION! If the period is long, this can lead to considerable waiting times.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Time Span to:

This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Release Hide entries:

If this checkbox is set, already released entries in the selected period will be hidden, i.e. not listed.

Project:

If a task or a project is selected here, only entries are listed which were booked directly to this task or indirectly to a subordinate task of this project.

In the selection field, only projects can be selected for which one has the corresponding rights and for which the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Max. Project Chars:

Definition of the maximum number of text characters to be displayed for the project designation, i.e. if a text is too long (in particular for print formatting), the text is wrapped or truncated from the number of characters entered, depending on the "Line break" field set. If a value is entered, the project is also displayed without the project numbering.

An entry of '0' means: No text wrapping and project numbering (= default).

Person:

If a person is selected here only entries are listed, which were booked directly for this person.

In the selection field, only persons can be selected for which one has the appropriate rights and for which the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Max. Text Chars:

Defines the maximum number of text characters to be displayed, i.e. if a text is too long (especially for print formatting), the text will be wrapped or truncated after the entered number of characters, depending on the "Line break" field set.

An entry of '0' means: no text wrapping. For print formatting, e.g., for the "Proof of service", the preset value of 50 (= default) is recommended.

Customer:

If a client is selected here only entries are listed, which were booked directly for tasks, which are assigned to this client.

In the selection field, only clients can be selected for which one has the corresponding rights and for which the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Line Break:

Specifies whether texts are to be wrapped or truncated after a certain number of characters. When text is wrapped, the text remaining after a certain number of characters is continued in the next line and possibly wrapped again, and so on.

List time data.:

Specify whether or not time entries should be listed. (In the time data release, this value is always set.)

List travel expenses.:

Specify whether or not travel expenses should be listed. (In the travel expenses release, this value is always set.)

List material consumptions.:

Specify whether material consumptions should be listed or not. (In the material release this value is always set.)

Display annotations:

Specify whether or not any internal notes entered should be listed in addition to the descriptions.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




Share


List of recorded times, travel expenses or material consumption depending on defined selection criteria. The individual entries can then be released. Released entries can no longer be changed by a lower instance. If authorized, the release can also be reversed.



Field Descriptions

(enable):

Entries marked here are released after clicking the [Save] button.

Date:

Current date of the listed row.

Time:

Time or time period of the time entry or time material of the listed row.

Project:

Assigned task of the entry of the listed row.

Type:

Type of entry of the listed row, ie.

Times:
Time entry

Travel:
Domestic travel
Foreign travel
Receipts without travel
- Daily details
- Receipts

Materials:
Immediate materials
-Time or consumable materials

Other:
Other

Description:

Explanatory descriptions or details of the entry of the listed line.

Internal Annotation:

Additional (mostly internal) annotations of the entry of the listed line.

(This column is only shown if the Show annotations field was checked in the selection mask.)

Amount:

Number of material consumption of the entry of the listed row.

Unit:

Unit of the material consumption of the entry of the listed line.

TR ni:

Indicates whether the times of this entry of the listed row are billable (= ) or not (= ).

If authorized, this property can be modified by checking or unchecking the appropriate checkbox.

TC ni:

Indicates whether the travel expenses of this entry of the listed row are allocable (= ) or not (= ).

If authorized, this property can be changed by checking or unchecking the corresponding checkbox.

MU ni:

Indicates whether the material consumption of this entry of the listed line is allocable (= ) or not (= ).

If authorized, this property can be changed by checking or unchecking the corresponding checkbox.

Status:

Release status of the posting record of the listed row, thereby means:

MAAs last instance released by employee
PLAs last instance released by. Project manager released
VW/GLAs last instance released by administration or management


Save

By clicking on this button the releases and possible chargeable statuses are changed.

Execution > Appointments > Search

Search and list certain appointments


Convenient search of appointments according to criteria that can be combined with each other. These criteria are "Person", "Subject", "Period" and "Appointment type".
All appointments found are listed clearly below each other according to person and period. If the authorization is available, the displayed appointment is linked with a change option.




Search criteria


Search criteria

Search for specific appointments using search criteria, e.g.
by a part of the subject of the appointment or
by a specific appointment type.

Of course, you can also combine different search criteria.
After clicking "Search", the system searches for the appointments that meet the criteria.



Field Descriptions

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

Reference:

Specifies the subject of an appointment.

Search fr.:

In this search field you can define the validity start of the time frame of the search.

Search to:

In this search field you can set the validity end of the time frame of the search.

App. Type:

The field "Appointment type" provides different appointment types for selection. While project managers can view all business appointments of an employee, you are not allowed to control private appointments.


Search

Clicking on this button starts the search.




Search results


Search results

All hits for a search are displayed in a list.
By clicking on the button OK (to the right of each hit), you will be automatically forwarded to this appointment.



Field Descriptions

Start of App.:

This field displays the start time for an appointment.

End of App.:

This field displays the end time for an appointment.

App. Type:

The field "Appointment type" provides different appointment types for selection. While project managers can view all business appointments of an employee, you are not allowed to control private appointments.

Reference:

Specifies the subject of an appointment.

OK:

Icon to confirm the action.

Execution > Appointments > Appointment Planner

Setting appointments incl. inviting people with automatic notification by e-mail


In this overview the comfortable input of own or foreign appointments is possible. The appointment can belong to the following categories:

  • Invitation
  • Business lunch
  • Conference
  • Contact
  • Meeting
  • Message
  • Private appointment
  • Miscellaneous

.
For each appointment, a responsible person must be specified, as well as the time period. Repeat appointments can also be created or edited here.

For each appointment type you can invite any person, who will be notified immediately by e-mail. Such invitations can be confirmed or rejected in the control center.




Selection


Select an appointment to view, change or delete.

Personal scheme:
Own appointments are always displayed at the top. The own person name is thereby bold deposited. Possible appointments of other persons are listed in alphabetical order, depending on the authorization.

Structure of an appointment line in the list:

  • First the period of the appointment is displayed.
  • If the appointment concerns you or if you have the right to change the appointment, a : colon followed by the appointment type is displayed. If a more detailed description is available for such appointments, it will also be displayed in brackets afterwards.
  • If the appointment is a recurrence appointment, {+} will be displayed at the end.
  • If the appointment is a reminder appointment, {!} will be displayed at the end.
  • If the appointment is already marked as "done" the whole line starts with an ! exclamation mark.
  • If the appointment cannot be changed, e.g. because of missing permission, the whole line is displayed enclosed in brackets. This mainly affects the display mode.

.

NOTE:
In display mode, appointments already marked as "done" are always displayed, otherwise only if a time restriction has been set in the time filter.



Field Descriptions

Appointment (ID), for the exact assignment of appointments:

Appointment (ID), for the exact allocation of appointments.


Accept

Clicking this button saves the entered data and continues the program execution.




Deadline data


Deadline data

The selection in the field Person depends on the authorization of the user. Normal employees can only select themselves, supervisors and project managers can select all persons.
If you can select other persons here, you can create appointments for these persons.

It is not possible to create holidays directly, because all employees have to create a holiday request, which then has to be confirmed by the supervisor or the administration.
Furthermore, leave days must always be half-day or full-day.

In order to invite other employees to appointments, you have to tick the persons to be invited in the following list view. If you then click on Invite, a free appointment is searched for, another click on Confirm Appointment creates the appointments.

For project notifications that signal the completion of a task, you can decide whether the project should remain closed (Project End) or needs to be touched up (Rectification). In either case, project collaborators will receive a message with the text you specified in the Confirmation Comment field....

NOTE:
Repetition dates can be created by specifying a repetition type and an end date for the repetition. After you click "OK", the appointment will be created to their specifications.



Field Descriptions

Default Action:

Normally "Display" should be entered here.

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

App. Type:

The field "Appointment type" provides different appointment types for selection. While project managers can view all business appointments of an employee, you are not allowed to control private appointments.

Pln. Start Date:

The target start date of the project is displayed or specified here, i.e. from when the project is to be started according to planning.

Start of App.:

Specifies the start time for an appointment.

Repetition:

Specifies the recurrence of an appointment (daily, weekly, etc.).

End Repet.:

Specifies the day on which the repetition of an appointment ends.

Example: An appointment with repetition is created on 13.2. If, for example, "daily" is selected when creating the appointment and the end date of the repetition is 20.2., this appointment will be entered eight times between 13 and 20 February.

Reminder:

Date field for the reminder of an appointment.

If a date is entered, a reminder appointment for the current appointment will be created on this day.

End of App.:

Indicates the end of an appointment.

Duration:

Specifies whether an appointment extends over the whole day or only half a day. The respective duration depends on the definition of the working day, e.g. from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. would correspond to a full-day appointment with a standard eight-hour day with one hour break.

If this field remains empty, the time information you entered is used.

No. Repet.:

number of repetitions

Here you can specify how often an appointment should be repeated, as an alternative to the end date.

Project:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Time-Rec. App.:

A time recording appointment is an appointment that is listed in the control center and can be transferred to the time recording with a simple click.

If a time recording appointment is assigned to a project/subproject, then the time recording is booked to the next following appointment project. On the other hand, if the appointment is not assigned to a project, then it is posted to [Unknown].
Application examples are invitation appointments to project meetings, business meals etc.

Meeting Loc.:

This field indicates the meeting point of an appointment (should only be used as an aid).

Finished:

If this box is checked, it does not mean that the appointment is deleted, it is just marked as "done".

Reference:

Specifies the subject of an appointment.

Description:

Explanatory descriptions, details, comments or similar.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Checking

check inputs

By clicking on this button, the entries are checked for correctness or completeness without immediately writing the entries to the database.




Invitation list for the appointment


Scheduling

Assists with group scheduling.

To invite other employees to appointments, you need to check the people to invite in the following list view.
If you then click on Invite, a free appointment is searched for, another click on Confirm Appointment creates the appointments.



Field Descriptions

Fold.:

File folder/directory

Specifies the file folder (directory) in which the files are located.

Inv.:

Specifies whether an employee should be invited to an appointment or not.

If an employee is invited to an appointment, he will receive an e-mail and a separate appointment in fx-project.

To delete the invitation of an employee you only have to uncheck the checkbox and press the button Invite again.

User:

In this field, the user name is displayed or entered in text form (maximum 20 characters).

This can be structured according to the naming convention of the client and is normally managed by the administrator.

Suggestions for the naming convention: first name, last name, initials or a name chosen by the user.

Text:

Current calendar week (KW) with date of the 1st weekday

Text:

Next calendar week (KW) with date of the 1st weekday

Text:

Next calendar week (KW) with date of the 1st weekday




Date listing


Listing of all appointments of a selected person for easier editing, e.g. deleting several appointments etc.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

Date:

Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

Time:

Displays the runtime of the project in a combined field.

Duration:

Specifies whether an appointment extends over the whole day or only half a day. The respective duration depends on the definition of the working day, e.g. from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. would correspond to a full-day appointment with a standard eight-hour day with one hour break.

If this field remains empty, the time information you entered is used.

App. Type:

The field "Appointment type" provides different appointment types for selection. While project managers can view all business appointments of an employee, you are not allowed to control private appointments.

Project:

This field displays employees who are involved in the current project.

Invite:

Specifies whether an employee should be invited to an appointment or not.

If an employee is invited to an appointment, he will receive an e-mail and a separate appointment in fx-project.

To delete the invitation of an employee you only have to uncheck the checkbox and press the button Invite again.

Subject:

In this field, enter the e-mail subject that should appear in the header of the e-mail.

Description:

Explanatory descriptions, details, comments or similar.

GIF-Icon:

Specifies which icon is used with this entry.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Execution > Appointments > Absence Planner

Applying for absences such as illness, vacation, training, etc. to superiors with integrated approval procedure


In this overview, the comfortable input of own or foreign absence dates or payments is possible.

The appointment can belong to the following categories:

  • Absent (only for ext. Employees)
  • Sickness (sick leave)
  • Training (training request)
  • Leave (leave request)
  • Special leave (special leave request)
  • Skipping day (sliding day request)
  • Overtime payout

For each appointment, a responsible person, as well as the period must be specified. It must also be specified whether the appointment is "full day" or "half day". Absence appointments are listed in the control center and can be confirmed or rejected there by the supervisor.




Selection


Select an appointment to view, change or delete.

Personal scheme:
Own appointments are always displayed at the top. The own person name is thereby bold deposited. Possible appointments of other persons are listed in alphabetical order, depending on the authorization.

Structure of an appointment line in the list:

  • First the period of the appointment is displayed.
  • If the appointment concerns you or if you have the right to change the appointment, a : colon followed by the appointment type is displayed. If a more detailed description is available for such appointments, it will also be displayed in brackets afterwards.
  • If the appointment is a recurrence appointment, {+} will be displayed at the end.
  • If the appointment is a reminder appointment, {!} will be displayed at the end.
  • If the appointment is already marked as "done" the whole line starts with an ! exclamation mark.
  • If the appointment cannot be changed, e.g. because of missing permission, the whole line is displayed enclosed in brackets. This mainly affects the display mode.

.

NOTE:
In display mode, appointments already marked as "done" are always displayed, otherwise only if a time restriction has been set in the time filter.



Field Descriptions

Appointment (ID), for the exact assignment of appointments:

Appointment (ID), for the exact allocation of appointments.


Accept

Clicking this button saves the entered data and continues the program execution.




Data


Display, enter, change or delete absence data such as vacation, illness or training.



Field Descriptions

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

Absence Type:

Indicates the type of absence (vacation, illness, training, etc.)

Pln. Start:

The target start date of the project is displayed or specified here, i.e. from when the project is to be started according to planning.

Pln. End:

The target end date of the respective reference object, e.g. project, time data, trip data, etc. is displayed or specified here, i.e. by when the object should be completed according to planning.

Duration:

Specifies whether an appointment extends over the whole day or only half a day. The respective duration depends on the definition of the working day, e.g. from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. would correspond to a full-day appointment with a standard eight-hour day with one hour break.

If this field remains empty, the time information you entered is used.

Hours:

Number of hours according to context, e.g. number of overtime hours to be paid, etc.

Description:

Explanatory descriptions, details, comments or similar.

Annotation:

This field displays general comments about a project.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.




Date listing


Listing of all appointments of a selected person for easier editing, e.g. deleting several appointments etc.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

Date:

Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

Time:

Displays the runtime of the project in a combined field.

Duration:

Specifies whether an appointment extends over the whole day or only half a day. The respective duration depends on the definition of the working day, e.g. from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. would correspond to a full-day appointment with a standard eight-hour day with one hour break.

If this field remains empty, the time information you entered is used.

App. Type:

The field "Appointment type" provides different appointment types for selection. While project managers can view all business appointments of an employee, you are not allowed to control private appointments.

Project:

This field displays employees who are involved in the current project.

Invite:

Specifies whether an employee should be invited to an appointment or not.

If an employee is invited to an appointment, he will receive an e-mail and a separate appointment in fx-project.

To delete the invitation of an employee you only have to uncheck the checkbox and press the button Invite again.

Subject:

In this field, enter the e-mail subject that should appear in the header of the e-mail.

Description:

Explanatory descriptions, details, comments or similar.

GIF-Icon:

Specifies which icon is used with this entry.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

Execution > Appointments > Today

Display current appointments and appointment requests


Listing of all today's appointments of a person according to the display in the "Control Center".




Dates


This report provides you with a compact overview of the current appointments in a specific time interval.

View in the control center.

In the view in the control center, you can query any time period using the calendar, e.g. a specific day, week, month or year.

By default, the view covers the current week.

In addition, you can see all unconfirmed absence requests of your employees (regardless of the currently selected date), which you can easily process by selecting them from the selection box and then clicking on "OK".

Under certain circumstances, individual appointments are marked red in this table. These are appointments of other employees (independent of the currently selected date), which cannot be kept due to missing days (e.g. vacation, sick) and therefore can be postponed by you.

By clicking on the calendar icon to the right of the appointment, you can open the respective appointment in the appointment entry to edit it if necessary.

View in "Appointments today"

Within the program function "Appointments today" you can only see today's appointments in this report.



Field Descriptions

Time Period:

Displays the runtime of the project in a combined field.

1406:

blank

Appointment Type:

This field represents a specific lookup value selected from a selection box (e.g. all country codes, currencies, etc.).

Time:

Full day of the week name.

Appr/Den:

Here you can decide whether an appointment is approved or rejected.

The employee whose request is being processed receives immediate notification of the decision on his or her request.

Done:

If this box is checked, it does not mean that the appointment is deleted, it is just marked as "done".

GIF-Icon:

Specifies which icon is used with this entry.


Time Period

OK button to confirm various entries

Execution > Appointments > Calendar

Appointment calendar in graphical form


Listing of a person's current appointments in a configurable calendar format (by the day, week or month).




Date selection


Screen for appointment selection

In the top line of the calendar control you have the possibility to select which entries you would like to see in your calendar.

The select field Employee Appointment only appears if the user has the ability "Employee role: Business manager or Project manager" and also the setting "Management and project managers see all appointments" is set to "Yes". If this is the case, then the user can see appointments of other persons by selecting their name in the select field (or "All" for the appointments of all persons).

There are different views to choose from, e.g. one-day view or seven-day view. With a click on Display the calendar is created according to the new settings.

With a click on Today you get to today's date

By entering the calendar week you can, as an alternative to the date, switch to a desired date.



Field Descriptions

Date Entry:

With the help of the field "Date specification" you can directly display a desired day.

This option is preferable if you want to "jump" over a longer period of time, because here only one date has to be entered instead of a tedious scrolling forward or backward.

CW:

The input of the calendar week is an alternative to the date, with which you can jump to the specified calendar week, followed by the click on the button "Show".

View:

In the field "View" you can specify how many days should be displayed on the calendar, e.g. one-day view or 7-day week etc.

Employee Appointment:

In this field you can specify whether (an authorized person) wants to see the appointments of his colleagues.

In the case that an employee wants to see the appointments of another employee, the respective employee has to be selected and "Show" has to be clicked. It is also possible to see the appointments of all employees at the same time via the entry "all".

Projects:

By ticking, projects are displayed in the appointment calendar. If a project is found in the displayed period (i.e. if a start or end date of a (sub-)project falls into the selected period, you can examine this project in the project view by clicking on the project symbol.

Task:

Tasks are displayed in the appointment calendar by ticking them. If a task is found in the displayed period (i.e. a start or end date of a task falls into the selected period), you can examine this task in the project view by clicking on the task symbol.

Business:

Business appointments are displayed in the appointment calendar by checking them off.

Private:

By unchecking the box, private appointments are displayed in the appointment calendar.

Leave:

Field to display an employee's vacation days.

Training:

Field to display the training days of an employee.

Sick:

Field to display the sick days of an employee.

Flextime:

This field indicates whether the worker is entitled to work in floating day.

If the user is authorized to do so, he can book time records to "Floating day" within the time recording.

This allows the user to enter a floating day for e.g. Friday, if he has already fulfilled his target until Thursday.

By making this entry, the user is also prevented from being registered via the time recording check program, even though he has already worked the necessary hours.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.

Today

Button of the date selection. After clicking you will find yourself at today's date.

Control > General > Control Center

Overview of the most important tasks, events or appointments


The control center displays the most important data for daily work. These are:

  • Current messages of the day as a ticker display.
  • Graphical Project overview with a listing of tasks due in the next 4 weeks, sorted by urgency.
  • Information block about progress estimates still to be submitted with a direct link to the corresponding program function.
  • A list of unread emails and documents of the last four weeks.
  • In the appointment block all current standard and absence appointments such as sick leave, vacation or training are displayed.
  • Special reports can also be created in the report generator and displayed here.

Control > Projects > Check Projects

Costs and times in a project are completely recalculated and possible inconsistencies can be corrected


Calculation of the most current key data of any project incl. comparison with obsolete data. Differences are highlighted in color before recalculation and listed in a detailed report.




Select mother project


Selection of a parent project to be reviewed and corrected if necessary.



Field Descriptions

Project:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Sort Sequ.:

Specify the sort order of the displayed fields.

Autom. Numbering:

If this field is checked, the project numbers are automatically renumbered consecutively without gaps.

Time Data:

In this field the user sees the start and end times of the activities performed.

Time Effort:

In time spent the user can specify the time spent in hours and minutes.

Int. TBud.:

This value specifies the total net internal budget (target), that is, this is the sum of the internal personnel budget + internal material budget.

Ext. TBud.:

This value specifies the total external net budget (target), that is, this is the sum of the external personnel budget + external material budget.

To. (Inv.):

This value indicates the total net costs that have already been settled externally (is).

History:

If this checkbox is ticked, an additional history is displayed in addition to the normal data.


Select

Clicking on this button will forward the selected data.




Calculation of the latest key data


Calculation of the latest key data

Here the most current key data of any project are recalculated.
The project always stays up to date, because you always access the most current data, like Actual Effort or Intern Plan. Budget etc..



Field Descriptions

No.:

This is the directory number for a project.

The directory number cannot be changed for parent projects.

The directory number is automatically adjusted when deleting or moving.

By manually changing the directory number, you can move projects within a hierarchy.

Project:

In the project name, the name or designation of the task (project, subproject, task) is specified.

Stat.:

This field shows how far a project has already progressed. In input mode, you can assign an attribute from a selection list to a project here, which reflects whether or how far a project is already advanced.

The status can also be used to decide whether project data should be included in a report or not.

Text:

[I] indicates the actual period, [S] the target period.

Time Per.:

Displays the runtime of the project in a combined field.

Text:

[B] indicates the calculated value, [D] the database value.

Plan. Eff.:

The target effort corresponds to the planned time effort in hours, man-days or man-years, etc. The estimated effort is entered when defining tasks. For projects/sub-projects, this value corresponds to the sum of all subordinate tasks.

Act. Eff.:

The actual effort corresponds to the sum of the work actually done on tasks from time, travel or material recording. For projects/sub-projects, this value corresponds to the sum of all subordinate tasks.

Devia:

Variances indicate the additional effort by how many hours a project is delayed.

Text:

[B] indicates calculated value, [D] indicates database value of internal person or material budget.

Int. PF:

This value specifies the internally planned net budget framework (target) for the persons who will execute the assigned tasks. This value is defined for projects (parent project or sub-project) and thus specifies the limit for all subordinate sub-projects or tasks. If the limit is exceeded, a warning is issued. Depending on the client setting, this frame can be increased or not by task planning.

Int. P.HRB:

This value indicates the internally planned net budget (target) for the persons who will carry out the assigned tasks.

Int.App.PB:

This value indicates the internally already approved net budget (target) for the persons who will carry out the assigned tasks.

Int.Act.PB:

This value indicates the net internally capitalized budget (debit) for the persons performing the assigned tasks. The capitalized budget corresponds to the approved budget for capitalized projects.

Int.Pln.PB:

This value indicates the internally planned net budget (debit) for the persons performing the assigned tasks. The planned budget is always 0.00 - because persons consume budget directly through time recording.

Int.U. HRB:

This value indicates the internally consumed net budget (actual) for the persons who have already executed assigned tasks. The consumed budget is determined by the time recording of the employees.

Text:

[B] indicates the calculated value, [D] the database value of the external person or material budget.

Ext. PF:

This value specifies the externally planned net budget framework (target) for the persons who will execute the assigned tasks. This value is defined for projects (parent or sub-project) and thus specifies the limit for all subordinate sub-projects or tasks. If the limit is exceeded, a warning is issued. Depending on the client setting, this frame can be increased or not by task planning.

Ext. P.HRB:

This value indicates the externally planned net budget (target) for the persons who will carry out the assigned tasks.

Ext.App.PB:

This value indicates the net budget (target) already approved externally for the persons who will carry out the assigned tasks.

Ext.Act.PB:

This value indicates the external capitalized net budget (debit) for the persons performing the assigned tasks. The capitalized budget corresponds to the approved budget for capitalized projects.

Ext.Pln.PB:

This value indicates the externally planned net budget (debit) for the persons performing the assigned tasks. The planned budget is always 0.00 - since persons consume budget directly through time recording.

Ext.U.HRB:

This value indicates the externally consumed net budget (actual) for the persons who have already performed assigned tasks. The consumed budget is determined by the time or travel expense recording of the employees.

Ext. I.HRB:

This value specifies the externally settled net budget (actual) for persons. The settled budget is determined by the settled time or travel expense recording of the employees.

P-Account.:

Specifies the type of billing according to which person services are billed, for example, fixed price, person days, hours, etc.

Depending on which value is set here, this has an influence on the invoice writing.
Fixed Price: In this case, the value entered in the Intern Plan. Budget field of this project will be used as the respective fixed price amount in the invoice writing.
Per Hour Basis: Invoice items are created based on hours worked (or travel expenses recorded).
Not Invoiceable: Tasks that carry this accounting type will not be included in the invoice writing for person fixed price or person hourly basis.

Text:

[B] indicates calculated value, [D] indicates database value for billed or open person or material budget.

FP:

This value indicates the already externally invoiced (is) net costs for fixed price tasks. These consist of both fixed personnel and fixed material costs.

AB:

This value indicates the already externally settled (is) net costs for hourly or quantity-based tasks. These costs consist of time recording, time material and consumable costs.

TE:

This value indicates the already externally settled (is) net costs for trips.

MT:

This value indicates the already externally billed (is) net cost for immediate materials.

Chk.:

Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".


No.

If the time frame of a project exceeds that of its parent(s), the "Adjust" button can be pressed, which will adjust the time frames to the new maximums.

Example: Project 2 is to be created under project 1. Project 1 starts on 3/1/2002 and ends on 4/25/2002, but project 2 should already start on 2/28/2002. To save you some steps, you can click the "Adjust" button after the system has recognized the conflict. This will set the start of project 1 to 2/28/2002, and the same will happen for any parent projects of project 1.

Control > Projects > Warn Messages

Warning messages automatically indicate when certain limits (time, costs) are exceeded


Setting or display of projects that have reached or are about to reach a certain critical state. These status criteria can be defined from a series of formulas, e.g. "Actual effort greater than a certain percentage of the target effort", "Internally consumed budget greater than a certain percentage of the internally approved budget", "Start date has been reached", "Deadline has been reached", etc.




Selecting and opening a project


Open project

Select a project from the existing tasks (project, subproject, task). Here you can select from the projects authorized to you.

By pressing the button Display Project the selected project is taken over in the following mask.



Field Descriptions

Internal number of a project that is automatically assigned when it is created.:

This field contains the internal number of a project. It is automatically assigned when projects are created and serves as the unique identification number (ID) of the project.


Display

Graphically display all projects that match the above selection criteria.




Overview of warnings


Overview of warnings

This screen provides an overview of the warning messages and their stored values, which is assigned to a project (and possibly its sub-processes).

With a click on the button Action you immediately reach the change mode of this warning message.



Field Descriptions

Name of Project:

In the project name, the name or designation of the task (project, subproject, task) is specified.

SubP.:

If the checkbox is activated, all subordinate subprojects and tasks are included in addition to the main project.

Attention!
This can lead to longer waiting times for large projects.

Warn1:

Specifies which value the warning was associated with, e.g. 65% or 45 days. This then results in a warning condition in the form of "$message_2156, 65%;".

Warn2:

Specifies which value the warning was associated with, e.g. 65% or 45 days. This then results in a warning condition in the form of "$message_2157, 65%;".

Warn3:

Specifies which value the warning was associated with, e.g. 65% or 45 days. This then results in a warning condition in the form of "$message_2158, 65%;".

Warn4:

Specifies which value the warning was associated with, e.g. 65% or 45 days. This then results in a warning condition in the form of "$message_2159, 65%;".

Warn5:

Specifies which value the warning was associated with, e.g. 65% or 45 days. This then results in a warning condition in the form of "$message_2253, 65%;".

Warn6:

Specifies which value the warning was associated with, e.g. 65% or 45 days. This then results in a warning condition in the form of "$message_2392, 45 days;".

Act.:




Define warnings


Defining warning messages or direct output of problem projects
A certain number of standard warning messages are available to you, which you can link to a specific percentage. These details are either displayed only or saved to the database.
Save data when button Save is clicked: the data you select is saved to the database and is available to the warning message program (which runs during the night). This evaluates the data and sends an email to the relevant project manager containing all the projects (as well as key project metrics) that have triggered an appropriate warning message.
Show data when button Display is clicked: the data you selected will be evaluated immediately and a report will be issued containing the projects that triggered a warning message. Caution. To save this warning message configuration, you must press the Save button, only then will the data be saved.
If the field Displ. Sub Projects is selected, the subprojects are also included in the reporting, this applies to the output in the table as well as to the automatic check if the data was written to the database.


NOTE:
Warning messages assigned to the value "inactive" will not be included in the report nor in the e-mail warning.



Field Descriptions

Warnings:

Indicator for selection screen

Sel. Mask:

Alerts for project review.


Warnings
