Sel. Mask

Button to save data.




Projects that have triggered a warning


Tabular display of the projects that have triggered one of the defined warnings, sorted by warning and project number.

The structure of the list is as follows:
The triggered warning is displayed with a blue background, followed by all projects that have just provoked this warning with the most important key figures for the project.
This structure is repeated for all activated warnings that were triggered by at least one project.



Field Descriptions

Proj. No.:

This is the directory number for a project.

The directory number cannot be changed for parent projects.

The directory number is automatically adjusted when deleting or moving.

By manually changing the directory number, you can move projects within a hierarchy.

Project Name:

In the project name, the name or designation of the task (project, subproject, task) is specified.

Planned Effort:

The target effort corresponds to the planned time effort in hours, man-days or man-years, etc. The estimated effort is entered when defining tasks. For projects/sub-projects, this value corresponds to the sum of all subordinate tasks.

Actual Effort:

The actual effort corresponds to the sum of the work actually done on tasks from time, travel or material recording. For projects/sub-projects, this value corresponds to the sum of all subordinate tasks.

Pln. Start:

The target start date of the project is displayed or specified here, i.e. from when the project is to be started according to planning.

Pln. End:

The target end date of the respective reference object, e.g. project, time data, trip data, etc. is displayed or specified here, i.e. by when the object should be completed according to planning.

Int. Plan. Bud.:

Indicates the internal planned budget. For tasks this value is to be entered as an estimated value, for (sub-)projects this is the sum of the individual values of the tasks below.

For example, if you enter 3500 € in task A, and 2500 € in task B, and both tasks are under subproject T, the amount of the budget in subproject T is set to 6000 €, generally: A + B = T.

Int. Spent Bud.:

This value is calculated for tasks from the number of hours entered in the time recording * hourly rate EK, for (sub-)projects from the sum of the individual used budgets, of the underlying tasks, which are placed under the (sub-)projects in each case.

For example, if you have used €3000 in task A and €500 in task B, and both tasks are under sub-project T, the amount of the budget used in sub-project T is set to €3500.
generally: A + B = T

Deadline:

Specifies the deadline (latest time) by which the project must be completed.

Control > Cost Accounting > Cost Main Data: Definition

Definition of cost object, cost center, cost type and service provider for cost accounting


Manage (create, modify or delete) all cost master data in the following four cost master categories:

  • Cost object
  • Cost center
  • Cost type
  • Activity type

.
Each of these categories must be assigned a unique cost number, the format of which can be freely defined for the entire client. Furthermore, each category can optionally be assigned a "designation", "type" or "description", as well as a possible validity period.




Selection of the cost master data category


Selection for which master data category and in which language cost centers are to be created.



Field Descriptions

Basic Cost Category:

Master data category of the cost centers, for example, cost object, cost element, etc.

Language:

Assignment of a language in table "Language

:

The cost center type is selected here.

Pln. Start Date:

The target start date of the project is displayed or specified here, i.e. from when the project is to be started according to planning.

Pln. End Date:

The target end date of the respective reference object, e.g. project, time data, trip data, etc. is displayed or specified here, i.e. by when the object should be completed according to planning.

Search Text:

This field is used to enter the string to search for.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




Cost master data definition


Create, change or delete master data definitions.

For each cost master data category, any number of master data definitions can be defined here with unique cost numbers, associated arbitrary designations and optional descriptive text.
Also, it can already be defined here to which cost center type the master data definition should belong.

If an activity type is processed, it can also be defined here whether the activity type is [productive] or [non-productive].

Furthermore, the validity period for the individual master data definitions can be defined, so that only the most current pool is used in case of a reassignment.



Field Descriptions

1509:

Cost master category (cost object, cost center, cost element or activity type)

Valid from:

Date from which a record is valid.

Valid to:

Date until when a record is valid.

Cost Number:

Unique identification number of cost master data such as cost objects, cost centers, cost elements or activity types.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Label:

Designation of a unique cost center.

Cost Center Type:

Possible assignment type of the individual cost master definitions, such as project, person, material, etc.

Productive:

Determines whether an activity type is productive (= value-added) or not.

Description:

Explanatory descriptions, details, comments or similar.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.




Cost master data list


List of master data for cost centers including additional information.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

Cost No.:

Unique identification number of cost master data such as cost objects, cost centers, cost elements or activity types.

Project:

If one project is dependent on another, then the dependent project can only be started after the predecessor has been completed.

If there are delays in the predecessor, this means that the successor (dependent project) is also delayed, but this is not automatically managed by the program, but must be explicitly executed by the user!

Each project can be set from each, already created project, in dependence.

Cost Label:

Designation of a unique cost center.

Type:

Possible assignment type of the individual cost master definitions, such as project, person, material, etc.

Prod.:

Determines whether an activity type is productive (= value-added) or not.

AS-ID:

This field is used internally to determine the client for which this data record is to be settled.

Thus, for example, an employee can make a time recording under his normal client, but it will be accounted under another client.

Valid from:

Date from which a record is valid.

Valid to:

Date until when a record is valid.

Edit:

Icon for changing an entry. If you click this button, you will usually enter the change mode.

Delete:

Icon to delete an entry.


Delete

After pressing the button Delete the selected records will be deleted. If the record is still needed, you will receive an error message.

Control > Cost Accounting > Cost Main Data: Relations

Linking of activity types to cost types


Establish 1:n relationships between a cost element and any number of activity types.




Select cost element for relationships with activity types


Select a cost element to which you want to assign individual activity types or change existing assignments.



Field Descriptions

Cost Center:

Here cost type: Possible assignment type of the individual cost master definitions, such as project, person, material, etc.

Search Text:

This field is used to enter the string to search for.

Cost Number:

Unique identification number of cost master data such as cost objects, cost centers, cost elements or activity types.

Cost Label:

Designation of a unique cost center.

Cost Center Type:

Possible assignment type of the individual cost master definitions, such as project, person, material, etc.

Validity from:

Date from which a record is valid.

Validity to:

Date until when a record is valid.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




Assign activity type(s) to a cost element


By simply selecting the checkboxes, a wide variety of activity types can be assigned to a cost element. The displayed activity types are determined on the basis of the selected cost type, i.e. the validity area and cost center type must match.

NOTE:
The assignment of activity types for which time recording data has already been made can no longer be changed.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

Service Types:

The activity type in cost accounting is a reference value that indicates the qualitative technical description of the production activity. Here, it can be classified between productive (=value-adding) and non-productive types.

Prod.:

Determines whether an activity type is productive (= value-added) or not.

T-Chk:

To control the daily time recording, a check program can run in the scheduler which checks whether the time recording has been carried out correctly.

If this value is set, the check is carried out in the scheduler and the employee receives a notification if there is no or an incorrect time recording.

If this value is not set, the check in the scheduler is not performed.

Valid from:

Date from which a record is valid.

Valid to:

Date until when a record is valid.


Multi Function

Clicking this button will make the changes.

The activity type in cost accounting is a reference value that indicates the qualitative technical description of the production activity. Here, it can be classified between productive (=value-adding) and non-productive types.

Control > Cost Accounting > Cost Accounting Analysis

Evaluation of existing data according to cost accounting


Cost and performance accounting (CAC) is an institutionalized information system that contains all economically evaluable projects of information gathering and information processing about incurred or planned business transactions and is primarily directed at company employees.

Cost and performance accounting is used to determine cost and performance information for solving operational management tasks.

The goals and tasks of cost accounting are the profitability control of departments or companies, the calculation and evaluation of cost units, and thus also the procurement of information for product and pricing policy.


NOTE:
The prerequisite is a correct cost recording and an accurate time recording.




Set display criteria


Set the display or filter criteria for the cost accounting report.



Field Descriptions

Time Span from:

This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Text:

Cost center: From:

Chk.:

Activation by ticking the checkbox.

Text:

Cost center: To:

Chk.:

Activation by ticking the checkbox.

Time Span to:

This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Text:

Cost type: From:

Chk.:

Activation by ticking the checkbox.

Text:

Cost element: To:

Chk.:

Activation by ticking the checkbox.

Cost Center Type:

Possible assignment type of the individual cost master definitions, such as project, person, material, etc.

Text:

Activity type: From:

Chk.:

Activation by ticking the checkbox.

Text:

Service type: To:

Chk.:

Activation by ticking the checkbox.

Display Type:

Selection field for selecting in which time display type the report is to be displayed. Monthly, quarterly or yearly.

Show Empty Entries:

By checking or unchecking this field, you can determine whether irrelevant entries (=blank entries) are to be displayed or not.

If, for example, a month is listed for a project, but only two days in this month were worked for this project, you can decide here whether the entire month or only these two days should be displayed.

Inter.-Report:

If set, interim reports are displayed according to the display type set, i.e. weekly reports if displayed by the day, monthly reports if displayed by the week, quarterly reports if displayed by the month and annual reports if displayed by the quarter.

Glob.-Report:

If set, a full report is displayed provided that there is more than one entry in the report.

Use Filter:

Specifies whether the global filter settings should be used or not.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




Report


Report for cost accounting according to set display criteria.



Field Descriptions

Cost Center:

Unique assignment number to a cost center.

Cost Type:

This field indicates whether the selected field is a cost field or not. If the field is not a cost field, it will always be displayed, if the field is a cost field of cost type "Project Manager or "General Manager", the user must have these additional permissions (Employee-Role (spec. Access Rights)) to see this field.

Service Type:

The activity type in cost accounting is a reference value that indicates the qualitative technical description of the production activity. Here, it can be classified between productive (=value-adding) and non-productive types.

Plan.Hrs.:

Indicates how many hours an employee must work in a given period of time

Act.Hrs.:

Indicates how many hours an employee actually worked in a given time period.

Pl.Cost/U:

Planned cost of an instant material per unit, that is, this cost is an estimate of the acquisition cost of the instant material.

(For consumable or time materials, this value is always 0.00)

Act.Cost/U:

Purchase price (EK) per unit, which have an impact on the internal budget (= costs of the company).

Delta:

The delta hours are the difference between actual and target hours. They indicate how many hours the person has worked more or less than contractually agreed in the specified period (= overtime or minus hours).

%:

Actual costs as a percentage (%) of planned costs.

Control > Cost Accounting > Activity Type Hour Report

Day-based hourly overview report of activity types


Daily hourly overview report of the activity types.

Set the display or filter criteria for the cost accounting report.

Show Empty Entries:

By checking or unchecking this field, you can determine whether irrelevant entries (=blank entries) are to be displayed or not.

If, for example, a month is listed for a project, but only two days in this month were worked for this project, you can decide here whether the entire month or only these two days should be displayed.

Inter.-Report:

Access Rights)) to see this field.

Service Type:

The activity type in cost accounting is a reference value that indicates the qualitative technical description of the production activity. Here, it can be classified between productive (=value-adding) and non-productive types.

Plan.Hrs.:

Indicates how many hours an employee must work in a given period of time

Indicates how many hours an employee actually worked in a given time period.

(For consumable or time materials, this value is always 0.00)

%:

Percent (%)

DMS > Management > Search

Search and list certain documents in the Document-Management-System (DMS)


Search for documents in the DMS (Document Management System) based on their maintenance structure. The following search criteria can be entered: "Category", "Text", "Period" or "File size".

Only results are listed to which you have the corresponding rights.




Set search criteria


DMS: Define search criteria



Field Descriptions

To Category:

Specifies the type of parent entity (e.g. project, person, appointment, etc.).

Category ID:

Used to uniquely define the type of a parent object of a document (type of parent object).

Category:

In this field, the category is selected via a selection field.

Text:

Text field for general text input.

Time Span from:

This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Time Span to:

This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Sz. from:

Start size

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Size to:

Final size

ID:

Display E-Mails:

Indicates whether emails should be displayed in the listing or not.


Search

Clicking on this button starts the search.

Accept

Clicking this button saves the entered data and continues the program execution.

Back

Jump back to the previous mask/page.




Existing documents


Existing documents

The results returned by this search are displayed in the form of a list. The text passages that match the search text are highlighted.

Documents for which you do not have access authorization are not displayed. The information about how many documents were found and how many are displayed can be found in the information line. Clicking on one of the icons in the action line executes the desired action:

Display: Display this file in a new browser window.

Download: Download selected file(s).

When the document is created, all rights for this document (only for the creating user, business manager and system administrator) are automatically assigned. To make the entered document accessible to other users, click on this icon.

If icons are grayed out, the logged-in user does not have the necessary access rights for this function.

In addition to the two search masks (structure and text search) for documents, there is another option to display a category with assigned documents:

In the menu bar there is a button (with an empty sheet and a pair of glasses placed in front of it), with the help of which you can display all documents that have been assigned to the called program function.

In other words, when you call certain program functions (employee, customer, project, etc.), the category of the document parent object (an object to which you assign documents) is determined.

The icon is deactivated by default and is only activated when, on the one hand, a suitable program function has been called and, on the other hand, documents have also already been assigned to objects of this category.

NOTE:
Example:
A document has been created for employee XYZ. By calling the program function "int. Employee data" the icon shown above is activated, because (at least) one document has already been assigned to an employee. If you click on it now, a list with the documents assigned to the employee appears (if you have sufficient access rights).
The functionality is essentially the same as the structured document search, except that the category is just determined with the called program function. This is especially useful if the desired program function is already active.



Field Descriptions

Chg.:

This field indicates the time of the last change in TimeDate format (YYYYMMDDHHMMSS).

Each time the record is written to, a new time stamp is stored in conjunction with the user ID.

Through this mechanism, both security and data integrity aspects are well covered.

File Name:

The name of the generated file must be entered in this field.

Auto:

If this field is activated, a new version is automatically created when changes are saved. This has the advantage that even the smallest changes are not lost.

The disadvantage is that the number of available versions quickly becomes confusing when there are many small changes.

Version:

The version number is incremented by 0.001 when a changed document is saved normally, and by 1 when a version change is explicitly requested or when the floating point range overflows (for 999 changes without a version change).

Manually changed versions are saved as a new file and activated, the old version is marked as inactive.

Size:

This field indicates the physical size of the file. With this information you can estimate, for example, how long a download would take with the usual bandwidth (-> Internet access).

Category:

In this field, the category is selected via a selection field.

Description:

Explanatory descriptions, details, comments or similar.

Changes:

The changes made must be entered in this field (in bullet points).

Key Words:

This field contains the keywords that appear in the text of the document.

Filing Place:

Specifies the storage location of the original document.

GIF-Icon:

Specifies which icon is used with this entry.

DMS > Management > Document Manager

Upload, view, download and manage documents


Entering documents into the DMS (Document Management System) of fx-project. A file is uploaded and provided with adjustable criteria such as "category", "type", "storage location" or "description".

With the help of these criteria, documents can be easily found again. An individual assignment of rights to documents is also possible with the program function Accept.




DMS


DMS



Field Descriptions

Chart:

If this checkbox is ticked, the data displayed in the report is also shown in a meaningful diagram.

DMS > Access Rights > Documents

Assignment of access rights of users, user groups and departments to documents




Reference selection


Reference for rights assignment

Here, a reference category (projects, documents or reports) must first be selected and then a subcategory for this reference.

If "Rights assignment" is called up from another program function, these values are already preset and are only displayed.



Field Descriptions

Reference:

Selection of the reference for which the user has been assigned the rights.

Rights:

Primary key in table "Rights_Reference

Number:


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




Manage access rights


Manage access rights

In this screen, access rights can be assigned to specific departments, user groups or individual users.
If the user already has a direct right to selected references (through his assignment to these or superordinate project), this is displayed with a blue background.

The access rights for documents are assigned to actions and mean in detail:


NOTE:
All: All access rights are granted.

retrieve: The user is allowed to download the document.

check in/out: The user may download or upload the document for
Down- or upload the document for editing. (In the meantime, the file may then only be downloaded.

archive: The file will be archived and will not show up in future searches.

delete: The file will be deleted.



Field Descriptions

Only Cust. Data:

Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

Description:

Reference designation.

All:

By pressing Select All all checkboxes are preselected with a check mark. These changes must be confirmed with another button such as OK.

Disp.:

This field specifies whether the related field or program function may be displayed for this profile.

Crea.:

This field specifies whether the relevant field may be created for this profile.

Edit:

Here you specify whether the field for this profile may be changed.

Del.:

This field indicates whether the related field for this profile may be deleted.


Save

Button to save data.

Reporting > Persons > Phone Book

Search and list certain communication data of one or more persons


Persons and telephone numbers are searched and found according to freely defined patterns. These patterns can be composed of a free search text or the desired department.




Phone book search for standard entries


Search phone number

This mask is used to search for standard communication entries such as standard telephone number, standard e-mail or standard Internet pages.



Field Descriptions

Search Txt:

This field is used to enter the string to search for.

Primary key in the "Department" table:

Indicates the department in which the employee works.


Search

Clicking on this button starts the search.




Phone list


Phone list

Overview of telephone numbers



Field Descriptions

Name:

Surname or family name of a person.

Phone Number:

Number under which a person can be reached by telephone.

Reporting > Persons > Int. Employee - Main Sheet

Personnel main sheet of an internal employee


A clear arrangement of all relevant data such as employee data, contract data, bank data, address data or communication data for one person.

The amount of information can be easily increased or decreased by ticking the corresponding checkboxes, and the period of the special data to be displayed, such as time data or absence data, can be freely defined.




Display criteria for the person master data sheet


In the mask Display criteria for the person master data sheet the selection is made which information is to be listed to a person. Prerequisite is the restriction to a certain person, as well as to a certain period. The employee data are always displayed, no matter which selection criteria are set.

The period to be displayed must be specified using the two input fields Time Span from and Time Span to. If no entry is made, the current calendar month is preset.

By selecting the fields Time Data, Holidays, Sickness or Training, the corresponding data for the selected person is determined and displayed in total. Here, [Total] means display of the subtotal per year and [Detailed] per calendar month.

By ticking the checkbox fields Contract Datas, Bank Datas, Addresses, Communication Data, Skills or Personnel Hierarchy the corresponding data for the selected person will be determined and displayed in the same overview block.

The desired data are determined after a click on the button Display and displayed in the mask Personnel master sheet, where they can be processed further via the [File Manager].



Field Descriptions

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

Time Span from:

This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Time Span to:

This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Time Data:

In the selection field Time Data it can be specified whether and how the working hours of the person in the selected period should be displayed. Total] means per calendar year, [Detailed] means per calendar month.

Holidays:

In the selection field Holidays it can be specified whether and how the vacation days taken by the person in the selected period should be displayed. Total] means per calendar year, [Detailed] means per calendar month.

Sickness:

In the selection field Sickness it can be specified whether and how the sick days of the person in which he/she was absent should be displayed in the selected period. Total] means per calendar year, [Detailed] means per calendar month.

Training:

In the selection field Training it can be specified whether and how the days of the person in which he/she was on training should be displayed in the selected period. Total] means per calendar year, [Detailed] means per calendar month.

1509:

Selection of all created project category groups

Contract Datas:

By checking the Contract Datas field, you can determine whether the corresponding data should be listed in the block with the same name or not.

Bank Datas:

By checking the Bank Datas field, you can determine whether the corresponding data should be listed in the block with the same name or not.

Addresses:

By checking the Addresses field, you can determine whether the corresponding data should be listed in the block with the same name or not.

Communication Data:

By checking the Communication Data field, you can determine whether the corresponding data should be listed in the block with the same name or not.

Skills:

By checking the Skills field, you can determine whether the corresponding data should be listed in the block with the same name or not.

Personnel Hierarchy:

By checking the Personnel Hierarchy field, you can determine whether or not the corresponding data should be listed in the block of the same name.
Personnel Hierarchy here means both superior and subordinate.

TR n. invoice.:

Here you can specify whether the time recording should be invoiced or not.


Display




Personnel master sheet


Display detailed information about a selected employee.

In the mask Personnel master sheet all important information about a selected employee is displayed clearly. The information content can vary depending on the set display options (see help for mask Display criteria for the person master data sheet).



Field Descriptions

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Reporting > Persons > Ext. Contractor - Main Sheet

Personnel main sheet of an external contractor


A clear arrangement of all relevant data such as employee data, contract data, bank data, address data or communication data etc. for one person.

The amount of information can be easily increased or decreased by ticking the corresponding checkboxes, and the period of the special data to be displayed, such as time data or absence data, can be freely defined.




Display criteria for the person master data sheet


In the mask Display criteria for the person master data sheet the selection is made which information is to be listed to a person. Prerequisite is the restriction to a certain person, as well as to a certain period. The employee data are always displayed, no matter which selection criteria are set.

The period to be displayed must be specified using the two input fields Time Span from and Time Span to. If no entry is made, the current calendar month is preset.

By selecting the fields Time Data, Holidays, Sickness or Training, the corresponding data for the selected person is determined and displayed in total. Here, [Total] means display of the subtotal per year and [Detailed] per calendar month.

By ticking the checkbox fields Contract Datas, Bank Datas, Addresses, Communication Data, Skills or Personnel Hierarchy the corresponding data for the selected person will be determined and displayed in the same overview block.

The desired data are determined after a click on the button Display and displayed in the mask Personnel master sheet, where they can be processed further via the [File Manager].



Field Descriptions

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

Time Span from:

This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Time Span to:

This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Time Data:

In the selection field Time Data it can be specified whether and how the working hours of the person in the selected period should be displayed. Total] means per calendar year, [Detailed] means per calendar month.

Holidays:

In the selection field Holidays it can be specified whether and how the vacation days taken by the person in the selected period should be displayed. Total] means per calendar year, [Detailed] means per calendar month.

Sickness:

In the selection field Sickness it can be specified whether and how the sick days of the person in which he/she was absent should be displayed in the selected period. Total] means per calendar year, [Detailed] means per calendar month.

Training:

In the selection field Training it can be specified whether and how the days of the person in which he/she was on training should be displayed in the selected period. Total] means per calendar year, [Detailed] means per calendar month.

1509:

Selection possibility of all created project categories

Contract Datas:

By checking the Contract Datas field, you can determine whether the corresponding data should be listed in the block with the same name or not.

Bank Datas:

By checking the Bank Datas field, you can determine whether the corresponding data should be listed in the block with the same name or not.

Addresses:

By checking the Addresses field, you can determine whether the corresponding data should be listed in the block with the same name or not.

Communication Data:

By checking the Communication Data field, you can determine whether the corresponding data should be listed in the block with the same name or not.

Skills:

By checking the Skills field, you can determine whether the corresponding data should be listed in the block with the same name or not.

Personnel Hierarchy:

By checking the Personnel Hierarchy field, you can determine whether or not the corresponding data should be listed in the block of the same name.
Personnel Hierarchy here means both superior and subordinate.

TR n. invoice.:

Here you can specify whether the time recording should be invoiced or not.


Display




Personnel master sheet


Display detailed information about a selected employee.

In the mask Personnel master sheet all important information about a selected employee is displayed clearly. The information content can vary depending on the set display options (see help for mask Display criteria for the person master data sheet).

Reporting > Persons > Communication Report

Evaluation of communication data of persons


The person communication report is a detailed report about the most different communication data of persons. The freely definable communication type can be set as well as a search text, postcode, country code or person type to limit the data found. The integrated assignment of rights ensures that each person is only listed the data intended for them.




Determine selection criteria


Here you can define the selection criteria for the person communication report.



Field Descriptions

Communication Type:

This field is used to select the type of communication connection, such as telephone, fax, e-mail, etc., from a drop-down menu.

Allocated to Object:

This field contains the "parent unit".
For projects, this would be the parent project [(sub)project].

For documents this would be the unit you belong to (e.g. project, appointment, note etc.).

Search Text:

This field is used to enter the string to search for.

Text:

Postal code

Text:

Postcode: From:

Text:

Postcode: To:

Country Code:

This field is used to select a country code from a country table.

The country code corresponds to the currently valid car license plates, e.g. "USA", "F", "NL", "D" etc.

Display Annotation:

Here you can define whether the annotation should be displayed or not. Checking this box means that the annotation column should be displayed in the report, otherwise it will be hidden.

Inactive:

By setting the checkbox, inactive persons (employees, clients, etc.) are also displayed.

Type of Person:

Categorization of persons, e.g. clients, employees, customers etc. are to be distinguished.

Sort Sequence:

Specify the sort order of the displayed fields.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




Report


Report of the selected communication data.



Field Descriptions

Number:

The actual communication connection, such as telephone number, fax number, e-mail address, etc., is entered or displayed in this field. The entries in this field depend on the previously selected communication type.

Annot.:

This field displays general comments about a project.

Name:

In this field the family name of the person or the name of the legal entity (e.g. company name) is displayed or entered.

Address:

This is an internal key for the unique identification of addresses.

Contact:

This field shows the contact person or the customer. By selecting a contact person, in some cases (e.g. project definition) a customer is automatically selected as well, since each contact person is assigned to exactly one customer.

A contact person is created via the input mask in the menu item "Master data".

Number:

Specifies the identification number of the communication entry.

Editor:

Indicates which user last edited a record.

Reporting > Persons > Vacation/Timetable

Graphical overview (depending on access rights) of all employees about their vacation, training, sick days and/or actual hours


Graphical overview of all employees about their vacation/training days or sick days.




Graphical overview of absence days and/or actual hours worked


This graphical report gives you an insight into which employees have planned or taken leave and when, who is currently on a training course, or who has called in sick. You can see how many resources you have to do without in a certain period of time.

In both fields Time Span from and Time Span to you have to enter a date, i.e. for which period the graphical report should be created.

In the field Calendar Displ. Mode you can select how detailed the report should be prepared, i.e. whether you want to see days, weeks, months or years. In the "Automatic" mode, the program determines the display mode in such a way that all information still fits into the browser window.

By checking the Leave, Sick or Training boxes, you can determine which types of missing days should be displayed. Important! At least one entry must be checked.

In the selection field Department you can determine whether you want to see the graphical overview for all employees, or only for one specific department.

By checking the Active Employee field, the listing will only show employees who have days absent during the selected time period. If this field is unchecked, then all employees will be displayed.

NOTE:
$report_2258;



Field Descriptions

From:

A date must be entered in this field from which time the graphical display of the USK plan should begin.
(The date must be entered in the format defined in the user settings.)

Cal. Display:

Used to specify the calendar time intervals per column, i.e. days, weeks, months or years.

If "Automatic" has been set, the calendar time interval is determined programmatically based on the length of the total period to be displayed.

Leave:

By ticking this checkbox the vacation days of the selected employees will be displayed graphically.

Training:

By ticking this checkbox, the training days of the selected employees will be displayed graphically.

Sick:

By ticking this checkbox, the sick days of the selected employees are displayed graphically.

Flextime:

This field indicates whether the worker is entitled to work in floating day.

If the user is authorized to do so, he can book time records to "Floating day" within the time recording.

This allows the user to enter a floating day for e.g. Friday, if he has already fulfilled his target until Thursday.

By making this entry, the user is also prevented from being registered via the time recording check program, even though he has already worked the necessary hours.

Act.Hrs.:

Indicates how many hours an employee actually worked in a given time period.

To:

A date must be entered in this field by which time the USK plan should be graphically displayed.
(The date must be entered in the format defined in the user settings.)

Department:

Here you can select the department and accordingly the employees belonging to the department for which you need the information. If no department is selected, then one receives the information to all coworkers.

Active Em.:

This checkbox can be used to select whether all employees who match the selection criteria should be displayed or only those employees who have a displayable active record in this period.

Checkbox ticked = Only employees who have a displayable active record.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.

Reporting > Persons > Employee Assignment

Listing of the assigned employees of a project, subproject or task with workload


List which employees are assigned to which tasks.




Used to select resources


Dient for the selection of employees

Depending on the information given in the fields Person, Project, Time Span to and Time Span to, a report will be displayed, which employees of the selected project are planned in the requested period. If the fields are not filled in, all employees of all projects will be listed, regardless of the time period.

NOTE:
When first called up, or when clicking on the person icon, the group of persons in the person selection field can be restricted, e.g. only "internal employees".



Field Descriptions

Project:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

Internal key for the Material table:

Internal key for the Material table.

Material Type:

Type of a material, that is, to which material group it belongs. The material types can be defined as lookup values themselves.

Material Kind:

You can use this field to specify whether you want to see only the "one-time materials" or the "resource materials" in this report.

According to your selection the corresponding report will be displayed.

One-time material: Material whose acquisition costs are added to the selected project, but which are not planned as ("working") resources in the project (e.g. materials for the production of certain goods).

Such materials only have to be defined in the program function Creation>Materials>Material Definition.

Resources Material: Materials that "work" as resources in a project (e.g. a crane that is used 8 hours per day on a construction site).

These materials must be defined in the program function Creation>Materials>Material Definition. They must also be defined as a resource in the program function Execution>Materials>Stock and assigned to a project in Execution>Materials>Consumption.

Time Span from:

This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Time Span to:

This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.


Request Data

Button for data selection.




Resource assignments


Overview of the resources assigned to a project, subproject and/or task.



Field Descriptions

Name:

In this field the family name of the person or the name of the legal entity (e.g. company name) is displayed or entered.

Material Name:

Name or description of a material.

Material Type:

Type of a material, that is, to which material group it belongs. The material types can be defined as lookup values themselves.

Group:

This field displays the individual employee skill groups, that is, the employee areas that they cover.

Skill Name:

This field contains the names of the skills of the individual persons, e.g. "English", "Russian" or similar as skills for the group "foreign languages".

Start:

This field specifies the plan start date. When created, it is identical to the project start date when the employee was assigned, but it can be changed later.

End:

This field specifies the plan end date. When created, it is identical to the project end date on which the employee was assigned, but it can be changed later.

PP:

Monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial expenditure for the company per hour of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to VK=sales price). Here the EK (purchase price) is to be entered, which the resource receives for the current project.

Example: An employee has a purchase price of 25 €. If he works on a "normal" project, his purchase price is also 25 €. But if he works on a project that needs all his experience, the price can be adjusted to this project (e.g. price 40 €). The adjustment is also possible for the sales price.

SP:

Monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial return for the company per day of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to EK=purchase price). The sales price that the resource generates for the current project must be entered here.

Example: An employee has a sales price of 40 €. If he works on a "normal" project, his sales price is also 40 €, but if he works on a project that requires all his experience, the sales price can be adjusted to this project (e.g. sales price 60 €). The adjustment is also possible for the EK.

Effort:

Specifies how many hours an employee should spend on a task.

%:

Percent (%)

Utilizat.:

Indicates the percentage to which a resource is already utilized (by other projects).

Materials always have 100% capacity utilization when allocated.

For employees, the utilization is calculated from the values of the target workday and the target effort for the task.
For example, an employee with a standard eight-hour day is assigned to a task with a target effort of 24 hours. The duration of the task is three days.
=>Within these three days, the employee can work three times eight hours according to the target workday
=>24 hours / (3 * 8 hours) => 1 => Utilization of the employee is exactly 100% for this task.
Now let's assume the same task is now to be completed in four days
=>24 hours / (4 * 8 hours) => 0.75 => Utilization of the employee is exactly 75% for this task.
If more than one employee is assigned to a task, the workload can be split so that, for example, one employee does 16 hours and the other does 8 hours. With a standard eight-hour day and a task runtime of four days, the workloads of the two employees in the case just mentioned would be 50% (=> 32 / 16) and 25% (=> 32 / 8) respectively.

The total workload of an employee for an appointment is calculated from the individual workloads within the tasks for this appointment, i.e. if an employee has three tasks assigned on one day, with individual workloads of 40%, 30% and 20%, then the total workload for this employee for this day would be 90%.

Missing days and holidays are taken into account in the workload calculation
.

Reporting > Persons > Personnel Project Deployment Plan

Graphical display of all assigned tasks of an employee with planned target efforts


This diagram shows the deployment of an employee (taking into account the contractual working time) in his various projects.
This illustrates that an employee can be involved in several projects at the same time.




Criteria selection


Criteria selection for the representation in the personnel project deployment plan

In the selection mask, the employee is selected for whom the workload is to be displayed in the corresponding time period (time period from - time period to).

The display type can be set to "automatic", "days", "weeks", "months" or "years". If "automatic" is selected, the most suitable display type for the chart size is set. This selection value is responsible for the division of the X-axis.

If "Add up hours" is checked, all hours of the employee per time unit will be displayed added up, otherwise one entry per task will be displayed next to each other.

If "none" level is entered, all tasks of this person in this period will be displayed, otherwise all subordinate tasks up to the specified level will be added up.



Field Descriptions

Time Span from:

This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Person:

This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

Project:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

Time Span to:

This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Cal. Display:

Used to specify the calendar time intervals per column, i.e. days, weeks, months or years.

If "Automatic" has been set, the calendar time interval is determined programmatically based on the length of the total period to be displayed.

Level:

The number you enter in this field controls how many project levels are displayed in the report.

Sublevel "0" corresponds to the highest level.

Time from Project:

If this checkbox is checked, the entered time span is automatically overwritten with the time data from the selected project.

Add Hours:

If this checkbox is ticked, all hours of the employee per time unit will be displayed added up, otherwise one entry per project will be displayed diagonally one behind the other.

Show Unknown:

If this checkbox is checked, "unknown" tasks will also be displayed.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




Diagram


Diagram Explanation of the Personnel Project Deployment Plan
A vertical red line is drawn in front of today's date in the diagram. Everything to the left of the line corresponds to the actual data, everything to the right of the line corresponds to the planned target data.

A green horizontal line shows the employee's planned hours per time unit of the x-axis (hours, weeks, months, years).

On the y-axis (high value) the working time (= potential) is displayed in hours (h), on the x-axis (right value) the calendar time.

Approx. 10 colours are given for the display. If more than 10 colors are needed then the colors are repeated with a slight change in brightness.

NOTE:
Caution: In many projects, the color can very quickly become indistinguishable. Please limit in such a case the displayed data by means of filter, period etc.



Field Descriptions

1509:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Reporting > Projects > Dashboard

Project overview of all information on a project, subproject or task


Detailed graphical overview of a selected project including further links. The structure is divided into the following three main areas:

  • Project:
    General information, project progress, documents, target-performance comparison and degrees of completion.
  • Persons:
    Main project managers, additional project managers as well as executing persons (= resources).
  • Costs:
    Budget type, internal and external target budget, margin as well as invoice data.




Project overview-selection


Please select a project or task for which you want to see a short overview with navigation links. Then click on the [Display] button.



Field Descriptions

Project:

The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.


Display

By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.

Reporting > Projects > Gantt

View of a project or subproject as Gantt chart


Displays all selected projects in a graphical format, where each project found that matches the filter criteria is displayed in a separate line. The temporal relationship of the projects to each other can be seen through the division of the columns, as each column represents its own time unit. This unit can be freely set between "days", "weeks", "months" or "years".

Through the use of graphic symbols, the project type as well as the project status can be seen at a glance. If available, the corresponding milestones are also displayed graphically in an extra line, including their dependencies on the start or end nodes of the assigned activity.

Problem projects (with time deviation or budget overrun) are also represented by a separate graphic symbol.




Display project overview graphically


Display project overview graphically

The Gantt view is a graphical representation of one or more freely selectable projects.

Furthermore, you can define which period should be displayed and how it should be formatted (days, weeks, months or years), or whether only planned or also actual data should be displayed.

The display can also be limited to the project type, i.e. whether only projects, only tasks or everything should be displayed.



Field Descriptions

Project:

Selection of a project or of "All projects". The graphical Gantt chart will be created for the selected and all subordinate projects and tasks.

Project Type:

Selection which project type should be displayed in the Gantt plan, i.e. "All", "Projects only" or "Tasks only". If subordinate projects, tasks or milestones exist, the corresponding levels can be shown or hidden.

period of time:

Specify the time period (start and end date) in which found entries are to be displayed. Normally this period is preset with the last month.

CAUTION! If the period is long, this can lead to considerable waiting times.

Text:

Text field

Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

Time Span to:

This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

Autom. Time Span:

Serves to automatically preset the time period based on the selected project. The project target and actual periods as well as the milestone period are taken into account.

Status:

Used to limit the projects to be displayed based on the status, i.e. to display only "planned", "inactive", "active" or "completed" projects.

To SubLevel:

Number of maximum project levels to display, where means:

  • "0" or "empty" no restriction,
  • "1" parent projects only,
  • "2" parent projects and first sublevel,
  • "3" parent projects and two sublevels,
  • usw.

Only Planned:

Used to display only planned-target data, i.e. actual data from time recording, appointments, etc. are not taken into account.

Cal.Displa:

Used to specify the calendar time intervals per column, i.e. days, weeks, months or years.

If "Automatic" has been set, the calendar time interval is determined programmatically based on the length of the total period to be displayed.


Display Project

Graphically display all projects that match the above selection criteria.

Disp. Probl. Project

Graphically display all problem projects that meet the above selection criteria and contain problems such as time or budget overruns.

Reporting > Projects > Multi-Report

Project multi-report for the individual structure of project evaluations


A very detailed report for any project hierarchy with freely selectable columns of all relevant areas such as "Basic Information", "Dates", "Efforts", "Internal and External Costs" and "Settlements".

The differences between target and actual data are immediately visible through "traffic light functions".

The selected columns can be summarized, named and saved in a report, so that an own report collection can be built up.




Project selection for report


Project selection for report

Through various fields it is possible for you to limit the number of projects in a report, for example by only wanting to see all active projects, or only projects of a project manager or similar.

NOTE:
For additional information, please see the help of the respective report in the input mask.



Field Descriptions

Active:

Selecting this option displays all currently active projects.

Projects From:

By setting a date at this point, only projects that were started or planned AFTER this date will be displayed.

Main Project:

Top level of a project structure, under which all subprojects and tasks are subordinated.

Project:

In Project the project or task is selected for which the key data should be displayed.

Inactive:

Selecting this option displays all currently inactive projects.

Projects to:

By setting a date at this point, only projects whose planned or actual end date is before this date will be displayed.

Customer:

Here you can select the client of the activity (project, subproject or task).

Planned:

Selecting this option displays all currently scheduled projects.

Displ. Tasks:

Here you can define whether tasks (and possibly to-dos) should also be displayed in the project selection list or not. If this checkbox is not set, only projects and subprojects are displayed.

To SubLevel:

The number you enter in this field controls how many project levels are displayed in the report.

Sublevel "0" corresponds to the highest level.

Project Manag.:

Specifies which person should be the project manager of this project.

This field only serves as a further decision criterion in various reports, the Project Manager does not enjoy any additional rights or similar, these lie exclusively with the 1st Project Leader.

The Project Manager is only set in projects and is then also selected in the respective tasks of the project.

Green displayed persons in the selection field are project managers, which are already assigned to at least one project in this role.

Project managers are created using the role mask with role "Project Manager".

Completed:

Selecting this option displays all currently completed projects.

Max. Prj.:

Definition of the maximum number of text characters to be displayed for the project designation, i.e. if a text is too long (in particular for print formatting), the text is wrapped or truncated from the number of characters entered, depending on the "Line break" field set. If a value is entered, the project is also displayed without the project numbering.

An entry of '0' means: No text wrapping and project numbering (= default).

Project History:

If this checkbox is activated, any existing historical data records for each project are also displayed. These old data records are displayed with a blue project number and project name.

1st Project L.:

In this field the manager of a project is displayed or must be selected from a selection list. The project manager is defined once in the master project, and is then preselected as a PROPOSAL in all underlying projects.

Green displayed persons in the selection field are project leaders, which are already assigned to at least one project in this role.

Project managers are created using the role mask with role "Project Manager".

Critical:

If this checkbox is selected, only critical projects are displayed.

No Number:

If unchecked, the transaction numbers are not displayed.

Rec. Tasks:

If this field is checked, only displayed tasks are included and costed in the higher-level projects.

If this field is unchecked, all displayable tasks are included in the parent projects and costed, even if they are not displayed.
Displayable tasks are tasks that match the global project filter criteria.

Max. Chars:

Defines the maximum number of text characters to be displayed, i.e. if a text is too long (especially for print formatting), the text will be wrapped or truncated after the entered number of characters, depending on the "Line break" field set.

An entry of '0' means: no text wrapping. For print formatting, e.g., for the "Proof of service", the preset value of 50 (= default) is recommended.

Detailed:

By ticking this checkbox, the normal report is extended by additional, more detailed information.

Pro Rata:

If checked, the planned and target values are adjusted proportionally to the period to be displayed.

Example: For a plan budget of 1,000.00 Euro in a 2-year period, this value is displayed as 500.00 Euro if the period to be displayed is exactly half of the plan period.

Skill Group:

In this field, the individual employee skill groups can be selected, i.e. the employee areas they cover. The selected group ID is stored internally.

Costs:

If this field is checked, the cost fields are shown in the project report.

Effort:

If this field is checked, the effort fields are shown in the project report.

Department:

Indicates the department in which the employee works.

Text Lines:

Text line


Accept

Clicking this button saves the entered data and continues the program execution.




Project status report


Project status report

This report shows how many buffers are still available within projects, this is also highlighted graphically.

Optionally (by checking off Detailed Information) the original planning data can also be viewed, as well as further cost fields and project information.

If you also activate the checkbox Critical, only those projects will be displayed in which there are already overruns in time, effort or budget.

If you want an evaluation of all projects (select "All" in the above selection mask in the selection field Project), then you get a sum of all values of the individual mother projects in the last line.
If no project is selected, you will get a list of all projects. At the bottom of the mask you will also see a total sum of various fields. This is the sum of the projectsof the respective fields that are in the display. The totals may therefore vary depending on the view options.

NOTE:
The graphical elements contain further information in the tooltip if you position the mouse pointer over the respective graph..

Data on the external budget is only displayed if a project is selected and the "detailed" checkbox is ticked.



Field Descriptions

Project:

In the project name, the name or designation of the task (project, subproject, task) is specified.

Proc Type:

In this field the project type is displayed or can be chosen from a selection list, i.e. this field indicates which project it is, whether "mother project", "sub-project" or "task".

Status:

This field shows how far a project has already progressed. In input mode, you can assign an attribute from a selection list to a project here, which reflects whether or how far a project is already advanced.

The status can also be used to decide whether project data should be included in a report or not.

Priority:

Indicates the urgency of the (sub)project.
The higher the priority of a project, the higher it is displayed in the control panel of an employee.

PCA Code:

PCA is short for Pproject Codification Algorithm, which is a unique identifier to each project.

Reference Num.:

A reference number may be entered in this field.

It is used for a possible reference creation to other programs.

Contact Person Cust.:

This field shows the contact person or the customer. By selecting a contact person, in some cases (e.g. project definition) a customer is automatically selected as well, since each contact person is assigned to exactly one customer.

A contact person is created via the input mask in the menu item "Master data".

Project Manager:

Specifies which person should be the project manager of this project.

This field only serves as a further decision criterion in various reports, the Project Manager does not enjoy any additional rights or similar, these lie exclusively with the 1st Project Leader.

The Project Manager is only set in projects and is then also selected in the respective tasks of the project.

Green displayed persons in the selection field are project managers, which are already assigned to at least one project in this role.

Project managers are created using the role mask with role "Project Manager".

1st Project Leader:

In this field the manager of a project is displayed or must be selected from a selection list. The project manager is defined once in the master project, and is then preselected as a PROPOSAL in all underlying projects.

Green displayed persons in the selection field are project leaders, which are already assigned to at least one project in this role.

Project managers are created using the role mask with role "Project Manager".

2nd Project Leader:

Here you can specify a deputy project manager for a project, who will stand in for the project manager if the latter is absent.

Green displayed persons in the selection field are deputy project managers who are already assigned to at least one project in this role.

Deputy project managers are created using the role mask with role "project manager".

Budget Approval:

Indicates who is allowed to approve planned budgets. As a rule, these are the management as well as persons assigned to the project who have the employee role [budget approval].
If it is specified in the administrator settings for the client that budgets are approved automatically, this is where: [automatic]

Resources:

If this field is checked, the resources that are assigned to a task are also copied.

PP:

This is the monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial expenditure for the company per hour of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to VK=sales price).

SP:

This is the monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial return for the company per day of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to EK=purchase price).

Project Categories:

Define filter categories for projects or select them in a selection field.

Skill:

Primary key in table "Faehigkeiten".

Documents:

Unique number that is assigned to each entered document in order to be able to uniquely identify it again.

Pln. Start Date:

The target start date of the project is displayed or specified here, i.e. from when the project is to be started according to planning.

Pln. End Date:

The target end date of the respective reference object, e.g. project, time data, trip data, etc. is displayed or specified here, i.e. by when the object should be completed according to planning.

Remaining Days:

Shows in how many days the planned end date will be reached.

Deadline:

Specifies the deadline (latest time) by which the project must be completed.

Act. Start Date:

Indicates the start date of the respective reference object, e.g. projects, time data, travel data, etc.

Act. End Date:

The actual end date of the respective reference object, e.g. project, time data, travel data, etc. is displayed or specified here.

Planned Effort:

The target effort corresponds to the planned time effort in hours, man-days or man-years, etc. The estimated effort is entered when defining tasks. For projects/sub-projects, this value corresponds to the sum of all subordinate tasks.

Extra Effort:

Displays the amount of additional work required to complete tasks after the fact.

Actual Effort:

The actual effort corresponds to the sum of the work actually done on tasks from time, travel or material recording. For projects/sub-projects, this value corresponds to the sum of all subordinate tasks.

Act. Effort (inv.):

The allocable actual effort corresponds to the sum of the actually performed work on tasks from the time, travel or material recording, which can be allocated. For projects/sub-projects, this value corresponds to the sum of all subordinate tasks.

An expense is allocable if:
- the "not allocable" indicator has NOT been set in the time recording.
- the time recording was carried out on a task of the accounting type "fixed price" or "hourly basis".
- Time recording was NOT performed on "Unknown
- The VK of the employee in the assigned task is greater than 0.

Act. Effort (n.inv.):

The non-allocable actual effort corresponds to the sum of the actually performed work on tasks from the time, travel or material recording, which cannot be allocated. For projects/sub-projects this value corresponds to the sum of all subordinate tasks.

An expense is not allocable if:
- the "not allocable" indicator has been set in time recording
- Time recording was performed on a task with the payroll type "not allocable
- Time recording was performed for "Unknown
- The employee's IV in the assigned task is 0.

Plan-Act Remain Eff.:

Shows how many hours of planned effort are still available.

Rel. Remain. Effort:

Indicates the estimated number of hours left to work on a task.

Maximum Effort:

This field indicates the maximum time effort. This field must not be exceeded by the effort target.

If a value has been entered here, the employees can book a maximum of as many hours on this project as you have specified.

The maximum time effort can only be specified for tasks.

Determinat. Method:

Determination of the method how the project progress (= percentage of completion) is to be determined.

Report Date:

Determination of the reporting date when the project progress (= percentage of completion) is to be determined.

Rel. Perc. of Compl.:

Relative percentage of completion
For an effective determination of the percentage of completion, all methods must be considered and evaluated together!

Planned-Actual-Comp.:

Calculation formula:

Target/Actual comparison= ACT (= sum of all efforts made so far)
Target (= sum of planned efforts)


The target/actual comparison is the simplest method to determine the degree of progress of a project. A prerequisite for this is good effort planning.

The percentage of completion can be adjusted at any time by changing the effort planning.
For an effective determination of the POC, all methods must be considered and evaluated together!

Cost-to-Cost Method:

Degree of prefabrication

Calculation formula:
(sum of all internal costs incurred to date) divided by (sum of all planned internal costs).

The percentage of completion is a simple method to determine the degree of progress of a project. A prerequisite for this is good cost or budget planning.

The percentage of completion can be adjusted at any time by changing the budget.
For an effective determination of the POC, all methods must be considered and evaluated together!

Abs. Perc. of Compl.:

Absolute percentage of completion

The absolute POC is calculated by dividing the sum of the tasks already completed (= work packages) by the sum of all tasks.

In practice, this percentage of completion often only corresponds to the actual progress of the project if the individual planned tasks each have approximately the same duration.
For an effective determination of the degree of completion, all methods must be considered and evaluated together!

Budget Type:

Nature of the planned budget

The type of planned budget can be freely defined per client in the lookup values.

Int. PFrm.:

This value specifies the internally planned net budget framework (target) for the persons who will execute the assigned tasks. This value is defined for projects (parent project or sub-project) and thus specifies the limit for all subordinate sub-projects or tasks. If the limit is exceeded, a warning is issued. Depending on the client setting, this frame can be increased or not by task planning.

Int. MFrm.:

This value specifies the internally planned (should be) net budget framework for the material that will be required for the execution of the tasks. This value is defined for projects (parent or sub-project) and thus specifies the limit for all subordinate sub-projects or tasks. If the limit is exceeded, a warning is issued. Depending on the client setting, this limit can be increased or not by task planning.

Int. TFrm.:

This value specifies the internally planned net budget framework (target) for both the people and the material; it is therefore the sum of the int. people budget framework + int. material budget framework. This value is defined for projects (parent project or subproject) and therefore specifies the limit for all subordinate subprojects or tasks. If the limit is exceeded, a warning is issued. Depending on the client setting, this frame can be increased or not by task planning.

Int. Plan HRB:

This value indicates the internally planned net budget (target) for the persons who will carry out the assigned tasks.

Int. App. PBud.:

This value indicates the internally already approved net budget (target) for the persons who will carry out the assigned tasks.

Int. Act. PBud.:

This value indicates the net internally capitalized budget (debit) for the persons performing the assigned tasks. The capitalized budget corresponds to the approved budget for capitalized projects.

Int. Plan PBud.:

This value indicates the internally planned net budget (debit) for the persons performing the assigned tasks. The planned budget is always 0.00 - because persons consume budget directly through time recording.

Int. Used HRB:

This value indicates the internally consumed net budget (actual) for the persons who have already executed assigned tasks. The consumed budget is determined by the time recording of the employees.

Int. Rem. PBud.:

This value specifies the internally still available residual net budget (target) for persons, that is, this is the difference between approved person budget - planned person budget - consumed person budget.

Hr.-Costs:

Monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial expenditure for the company per hour of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to VK=sales price). Here the EK (purchase price) is to be entered, which the resource receives for the current project.

Example: An employee has a purchase price of 25 €. If he works on a "normal" project, his purchase price is also 25 €. But if he works on a project that needs all his experience, the price can be adjusted to this project (e.g. price 40 €). The adjustment is also possible for the sales price.

Int. Plan. MRB:

This value specifies the internally planned net budget (target) for material that will be consumed for the execution of the tasks.

Int. App. MBud.:

This value indicates the internally already approved net budget (target) for material that will be consumed for the execution of the tasks.

Int. Act. MBud.:

This value indicates the net internally capitalized budget (target) for material that will be consumed for the execution of the tasks. The capitalized budget corresponds to the approved budget for capitalized projects.

Int. Plan MBud.:

This value indicates the internally planned net budget (target) for material that will be consumed for the execution of the tasks. The planned budget indicates costs for orders that have not yet been delivered and therefore not yet consumed.

Int. Used MRB:

This value indicates the net (actual) budget consumed internally for materials that have already been used for assigned tasks. The consumed budget is determined by assigning materials to tasks or by resource planning.

Int. Rem. MBud.:

This value indicates the residual net budget (target) still available internally for material, i.e. this is the difference from:
Int. approved material budget - Int. planned material budget - Int. consumed material budget.

Int. Inten. TB:

This value specifies the total internally planned net budget (target), that is, this is the sum of the internally planned person budget + the internally planned material budget.

Int. App. TBud.:

This value indicates the total internally approved net budget (target), that is, this is the sum of the internally approved person budget + the internally approved material budget.

Int. Act. TBud.:

This value specifies the total internally capitalized net budget (debit), that is, this is the sum of internally capitalized person budget + internally capitalized material budget.

Int. Plan TBud.:

This value specifies the total internally planned net budget (target), that is, this is the sum of the internally planned person budget + the internally planned material budget.

Int. Used TBud.:

This value specifies the total internally consumed net budget (actual), that is, this is the sum of internally consumed person budget + internally consumed material budget.

Int. Rem. TBud.:

This value indicates the total internally available residual net budget (target), i.e. this is the sum of the internally available personnel budget + the internally available material budget.

Ext. PFrm.:

This value specifies the externally planned net budget framework (target) for the persons who will execute the assigned tasks. This value is defined for projects (parent or sub-project) and thus specifies the limit for all subordinate sub-projects or tasks. If the limit is exceeded, a warning is issued. Depending on the client setting, this frame can be increased or not by task planning.

Ext. MFrm.:

This value specifies the externally planned (to be) net budget framework for the material that will be required for the execution of the tasks. This value is defined for projects (parent or sub-project) and thus specifies the limit for all subordinate sub-projects or tasks. If the limit is exceeded, a warning is issued. Depending on the client setting, this limit can be increased or not by task planning.

Ext. TFrm.:

This value specifies the externally planned net budget framework (target) for both the people and the material; it is therefore the sum of the ext. people budget framework + ext. material budget framework. This value is defined for projects (parent project or subproject) and therefore specifies the limit for all subordinate subprojects or tasks. If the limit is exceeded, a warning is issued. Depending on the client setting, this frame can be increased or not by task planning.

Ext. Plan. HRB:

This value indicates the externally planned net budget (target) for the persons who will carry out the assigned tasks.

Ext. App. PBud.:

This value indicates the net budget (target) already approved externally for the persons who will carry out the assigned tasks.

Ext. Act. PBud.:

This value indicates the external capitalized net budget (debit) for the persons performing the assigned tasks. The capitalized budget corresponds to the approved budget for capitalized projects.

Ext. Plan PBud.:

This value indicates the externally planned net budget (debit) for the persons performing the assigned tasks. The planned budget is always 0.00 - since persons consume budget directly through time recording.

Ext. Used HRB:

This value indicates the externally consumed net budget (actual) for the persons who have already performed assigned tasks. The consumed budget is determined by the time or travel expense recording of the employees.

Ext. Inv. HRB:

This value specifies the externally settled net budget (actual) for persons. The settled budget is determined by the settled time or travel expense recording of the employees.

Ext. Rem. PBud.:

This value specifies the externally still available residual net budget (target) for persons, that is, this is the difference between approved person budget - planned person budget - consumed person budget.

Hr.-Yield:
