    Send a progress estimation request to assigned project members of a task


    The project manager or project leader can use simple masks here to request his assigned resources by e-mail to provide a current progress estimate for certain tasks. This request is then also visible in the control center of the corresponding persons.




    Selecting an active task


    Selection of an active task for which a request for a progress estimate is to be sent.

    The field Project/Task lists all active tasks to which you are assigned as project manager, project leader or deputy project leader and whose relative degree of completion is not determined with the standard method "Comparison of target/actual effort".

    After selecting a task and entering an optional additional email text in the Additional Text field, clicking the Display button displays the send list in another screen.

    NOTE:
    Tasks for which requests must be sent according to the definition are displayed with a darker background color and an exclamation mark {!} at the end.



    Field Descriptions

    Tasks:

    Here you can define whether tasks (and possibly to-dos) should also be displayed in the project selection list or not. If this checkbox is not set, only projects and subprojects are displayed.

    Add. Text:

    Input field for any text.


    Display

    By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




    Send list with resource listing


    Send list with resource listing

    All assigned resources are listed here for the previously selected task, including a display of when a progress estimate was last specified by the person.

    After a click on the button Send Question all ticked persons are requested by e-mail to submit a progress estimate. In addition, this request also appears in the control center of the corresponding persons.



    Field Descriptions

    Only Cust. Data:

    Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

    Name:

    In this field the family name of the person or the name of the legal entity (e.g. company name) is displayed or entered.

    Statu:

    Indicates the (completion) status of a ToDo item.

    Day:

    Full day of the week name.

    Date:

    Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.


    Send

    By clicking on this button the entered question will be sent, i.e. saved in the internal file "Question" for later processing.

    Reporting > Progress > Project Progress Estimation

    Enterability of a progress estimation for assigned tasks depending on the progress method


    Possibility to enter a progress estimate for assigned tasks. This ensures that the degree of completion is available as accurately as possible at all times.




    Selection of tasks


    Selection of tasks

    Select the task for which you want to estimate the cumulative quantity.

    If you select a parent project or subproject, all subordinate tasks of this project are listed.

    If you select [All], all tasks are listed.



    Field Descriptions

    Tasks:

    Here you can define whether tasks (and possibly to-dos) should also be displayed in the project selection list or not. If this checkbox is not set, only projects and subprojects are displayed.

    Checkbox:

    Activation of the checkbox hides tasks for which no estimation can be made

    Checkbox:

    By activating the checkbox not own tasks of resources are shown, to which one is assigned as project manager

    Checkbox:

    By activating the checkbox only tasks of still "open" requests will be displayed.

    Checkbox:

    By activating the checkbox, only tasks are displayed, for which a temporal delivery of an estimate is required


    Display

    By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




    Enter progress estimate


    Enter progress estimate

    Depending on the selection made, the corresponding active tasks are listed here. At the top, those to which you are assigned as a resource. In the next position, those to which no resources are assigned and to which you are the project manager.

    For each task, you can now enter an estimated value and an optional comment, depending on the defined method.



    Field Descriptions

    Project Name:

    In the project name, the name or designation of the task (project, subproject, task) is specified.

    Method:

    Determination of the method how the project progress (= percentage of completion) is to be determined.

    No.:

    The percentage of the estimate is selected here.

    Text:

    Display of the unit (percent)

    Annotation:

    This field displays general comments about a project.

    Statu:

    Indicates the (completion) status of a ToDo item.

    Changed:

    This field indicates the time of the last change in TimeDate format (YYYYMMDDHHMMSS).

    Each time the record is written to, a new time stamp is stored in conjunction with the user ID.

    Through this mechanism, both security and data integrity aspects are well covered.

    Time Per.:

    Displays the runtime of the project in a combined field.

    Priority:

    Indicates the urgency of the (sub)project.
    The higher the priority of a project, the higher it is displayed in the control panel of an employee.

    Link:

    This field is optional. If a link is entered, the automatic user rights query is bypassed and the Trans_ID field is cleared.


    Project Name

    Button to save data.

    Reporting > Progress > Project Progress Report

    Display the latest progress figures for any project level. Optionally detailed with included history and diagram


    Display of the latest cumulative quantities for any project level. If desired, also in detail with included history and diagram.




    Selection of the desired projects


    Selection of the desired projects

    Please select the projects for which you want to see the latest cumulative quantities (relative degree of completion).

    By ticking the checkbox Detailed Information the last estimates of the employees will be displayed in detail.

    If you also tick the checkbox Display History, all estimates made will be displayed exactly in time.

    By ticking the checkbox Display Chart the displayed data will be shown visually in a diagram.



    Field Descriptions

    Project:

    The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

    Level:

    Dummy:

    Dummy

    Detailed Inf.:

    By ticking this checkbox, the normal report is extended by additional, more detailed information.

    Resources:

    If this field is checked, the resources that are assigned to a task are also copied.

    Show History:

    If this checkbox is ticked, an additional history is displayed in addition to the normal data.

    Dummy:

    Dummy

    Show Chart:

    If this checkbox is ticked, the data displayed in the report is also shown in a meaningful diagram.


    Display

    By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




    Progress overview


    Progress overview

    In this list, the most recent stages of completion are displayed for each project. If desired, depending on the selection criteria, also with history and diagrams.



    Field Descriptions

    Name of Project:

    In the project name, the name or designation of the task (project, subproject, task) is specified.

    Stat.:

    This field shows how far a project has already progressed. In input mode, you can assign an attribute from a selection list to a project here, which reflects whether or how far a project is already advanced.

    The status can also be used to decide whether project data should be included in a report or not.

    Plan. Eff.:

    The target effort corresponds to the planned time effort in hours, man-days or man-years, etc. The estimated effort is entered when defining tasks. For projects/sub-projects, this value corresponds to the sum of all subordinate tasks.

    Act. Eff.:

    The actual effort corresponds to the sum of the work actually done on tasks from time, travel or material recording. For projects/sub-projects, this value corresponds to the sum of all subordinate tasks.

    Int. P.HRB:

    This value indicates the internally planned net budget (target) for the persons who will carry out the assigned tasks.

    Int.App.PB:

    This value indicates the internally already approved net budget (target) for the persons who will carry out the assigned tasks.

    Int.Pln.PB:

    This value indicates the internally planned net budget (debit) for the persons performing the assigned tasks. The planned budget is always 0.00 - because persons consume budget directly through time recording.

    Int.U. HRB:

    This value indicates the internally consumed net budget (actual) for the persons who have already executed assigned tasks. The consumed budget is determined by the time recording of the employees.

    Int. P.MRB:

    This value specifies the internally planned net budget (target) for material that will be consumed for the execution of the tasks.

    Int.App.MB:

    This value indicates the internally already approved net budget (target) for material that will be consumed for the execution of the tasks.

    Int.Pln.MB:

    This value indicates the internally planned net budget (target) for material that will be consumed for the execution of the tasks. The planned budget indicates costs for orders that have not yet been delivered and therefore not yet consumed.

    Int.U.MRB:

    This value indicates the net (actual) budget consumed internally for materials that have already been used for assigned tasks. The consumed budget is determined by assigning materials to tasks or by resource planning.

    Int.Int.TB:

    This value specifies the total internally planned net budget (target), that is, this is the sum of the internally planned person budget + the internally planned material budget.

    Int.App.TB:

    This value indicates the total internally approved net budget (target), that is, this is the sum of the internally approved person budget + the internally approved material budget.

    Int.Pln.TB:

    This value specifies the total internally planned net budget (target), that is, this is the sum of the internally planned person budget + the internally planned material budget.

    Int.Usd.TB:

    This value specifies the total internally consumed net budget (actual), that is, this is the sum of internally consumed person budget + internally consumed material budget.

    Rel. DOC:

    Relative percentage of completion
    For an effective determination of the percentage of completion, all methods must be considered and evaluated together!

    No.:

    Rel. completion in percent (%)

    Plan-Act:

    Calculation formula:

    Target/Actual comparison= ACT (= sum of all efforts made so far)
    Target (= sum of planned efforts)


    The target/actual comparison is the simplest method to determine the degree of progress of a project. A prerequisite for this is good effort planning.

    The percentage of completion can be adjusted at any time by changing the effort planning.
    For an effective determination of the POC, all methods must be considered and evaluated together!

    No.:

    Target-actual comparison in percent (%)

    Cost-Cost:

    Degree of prefabrication

    Calculation formula:
    (sum of all internal costs incurred to date) divided by (sum of all planned internal costs).

    The percentage of completion is a simple method to determine the degree of progress of a project. A prerequisite for this is good cost or budget planning.

    The percentage of completion can be adjusted at any time by changing the budget.
    For an effective determination of the POC, all methods must be considered and evaluated together!

    No.:

    Degree of processing in percent (%)

    Abs. DOC:

    Absolute percentage of completion

    The absolute POC is calculated by dividing the sum of the tasks already completed (= work packages) by the sum of all tasks.

    In practice, this percentage of completion often only corresponds to the actual progress of the project if the individual planned tasks each have approximately the same duration.
    For an effective determination of the degree of completion, all methods must be considered and evaluated together!

    No.:

    Abs. completion in percent (%)

    Determinat. Method:

    Determination of the method how the project progress (= percentage of completion) is to be determined.

    Report Date:

    Determination of the reporting date when the project progress (= percentage of completion) is to be determined.

    Statu:

    Indicates the (completion) status of a ToDo item.

    Reporting > Progress > Milestones

    Listing of all active milestones and all planned but not yet active milestones until the end of the next month


    Listing of all active milestones and all planned but not yet active milestones until the end of the next month.




    Milestones


    Listing of all active milestones and all planned but not yet active milestones until the end of the next month.



    Field Descriptions

    Status:

    Status of the milestone in traffic light graphics incl. warning level from 0-10.

    Date:

    Target date of the milestone.

    Milestone:

    Name of the milestone.

    Type:

    Milestone type, i.e.:
    S = Dynamic milestone depending on the start date of the assigned project.
    E = Dynamic milestone depending on the end date of the assigned project.
    F = Fixed milestone independent of dates of the assigned project.
    (T) = Number of days difference from assigned project date.

    Allocated to Object:

    Project to which this milestone is assigned. For dynamic milestones, the milestone date automatically moves with the assigned project.

    period:

    Scheduled start and end date of the milestone's assigned project.

    Reporting > Materials > Material Report

    Listing of all defined materials including their assignment to tasks and detailed consumption


    Listing of all defined materials including their assignment to tasks and detailed consumption. The materials to be listed can be conveniently restricted via a selection mask.




    Material selection


    Search criteria can be used to limit the number of material lists to be displayed. As search criteria, for example, article numbers, material names, assigned projects, material types, usage types, storage locations and/or start or end date can be specified.



    Field Descriptions

    Int. Artikelnummer:

    If a number is entered here, only materials are listed which contain this number completely or partially.

    Materialname:

    If a name is entered here, only materials are listed which contain this name completely or partially.

    Project:

    If a project is selected here on the one hand only immediate materials are indicated, which are assigned directly, or on the other hand only consumption or time materials, which are assigned indirectly by an already occurred consumption posting to this project or a subordinate task.

    Materialtyp:

    If a type is selected here, only materials of that type are listed (material types are self-defined lookup values).

    Lagerort:

    If a location is selected here, only materials are listed which are stored at this location.

    Verwendungsart:

    Specify what type of material to list: Immediate, Consumable, and/or Time material.

    Search from:

    If a date is entered here, only materials are listed whose validity start date is either blank or on or before this date.

    Search up to:

    If a date is entered here, only materials are listed whose validity end date is either blank or on or after this date.


    Search

    Clicking on this button starts the search.




    Material list


    List of all materials in the company sorted by article number, which meet the filter criteria previously set in the selection mask.



    Field Descriptions

    Del.:

    This field indicates whether the related field for this profile may be deleted.

    Stat.:

    Status of a stock item, i.e. it is warned in traffic light colors if there are too few or too many materials in the stock.

    Int. Item Number:

    Unique internal article number of a material.

    Ext. Item Number:

    Unique external number of an article, material, etc.

    Material Name:

    Name or description of a material.

    Usage Category:

    Usage type of a material, that is, for which purposes this material is used.

    Instant materials are materials that are assigned to tasks once, whereby the corresponding costs and/or revenues are transferred directly to the project budget, e.g. computers, printers, etc.

    Consumable materials are materials that can be consumed by a person on a unit basis (pieces, meters, etc.) on a daily basis, e.g. cables, sockets, etc.

    Time materials are materials that can be consumed by a person on an hourly basis and to the day, analogous to time recording, e.g. company cars, rented rooms, etc.

    Material Type:

    Type of a material, that is, to which material group it belongs. The material types can be defined as lookup values themselves.

    Task:

    Task for which an immediate material was purchased or for which a consumption was entered for consumable or time materials.

    Amount:

    How much of a material was purchased or consumed.

    Unit:

    Unit of the material, e.g. piece, kg, m, etc. The units can be defined as lookup values themselves. For time materials, the unit is always "hrs".

    Start Date:

    The purchase date of an immediate material, or the validity start date of a consumption or time material. For material consumptions, this date is the same as the posting date.

    End Date:

    The purchase date of an immediate material, or the validity end date of a consumption or time material. For time material consumptions, the time span is displayed here.

    Stock:

    Indicates whether the consumable is a stock item (= ) or not (= ) .

    Stock Loc.:

    Location where a stock consumable is stored.

    Text:

    Text field

    Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

    Stock Min.:

    Number of minimum available consumables in the warehouse, i.e. this is how many materials should always be in stock in the warehouse.
    This value is mainly used to check the stock in order to see immediately what should be reordered.

    Stock Max.:

    Maximum number of consumables available in the warehouse, i.e. the maximum number of materials that can or should be in stock in the warehouse.
    This value is mainly used as a control upper limit for reordering materials.

    Text:

    Text field

    Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

    Stock Ent.:

    Total number of receipts of consumables into the warehouse, that is, the total number of materials by which the warehouse stock was increased.

    Text:

    Text field

    Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

    Stock Rem.:

    The total number of issues of consumables from the warehouse, that is, the total number of materials by which the warehouse stock was reduced.

    Text:

    Text field

    Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

    Stock Act.:

    Number of total consumables currently available in the warehouse. This value corresponds to the difference between the total inflow (= material increase) minus the total outflow (= material reduction).

    Text:

    Text field

    Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

    Stock Used:

    Total number of consumables already consumed from the warehouse, i.e. materials withdrawn from the warehouse. This value is determined from the total number of day-specific entries recorded for material consumption.

    Planned-Actual-Comp.:

    Calculation formula:

    Target-actual comparison= Best. Ver. (= number of total stock materials already consumed)
    Best. Act. (= number of total currently available stock materials)

    Plnd.Cost/Unit:

    Planned costs of an immediate material per unit, that is, these costs are acquisition costs of an ordered but not yet paid immediate material.

    (For consumables or time materials, this value is always 0.00)

    Act. Cost/Unit:

    Purchase price (EK) per unit, which have an impact on the internal budget (= costs of the company).

    Sale Price/Unit:

    Sales price (VK) per unit, which has an impact on the external budget (= revenue of the company, which can be settled with a client).

    Plnd. Cost/Tot.:

    Planned total costs of an immediate material of all units, that is, these costs are acquisition costs of all ordered but not yet paid immediate materials.

    Formula:
    Planned total cost = Planned cost per unit * Quantity

    (For consumable or time materials, this value is always 0.00)

    Purch Cost/Tot.:

    Total purchase prices (EKs) of all units, which have an impact on the internal budget (= costs of the company).

    Formula:
    Total purchase price = purchase price per unit * quantity

    Sale Price/Tot.:

    Total sales prices (VKs) of all units, which have an impact on the external budget (= revenue of the company, which can be settled with a client).

    Formula:
    Total sales price = sales price per unit * quantity

    U-Margin:

    Profit (= ) or loss value (= ) as the difference between the total sales price and the total purchase price.

    Formula:
    Consumption margin = total sales price - total purchase price.

    Invoice No:

    Display each related invoice with status, invoice number and invoice date.

    The following statuses are displayed:
    Task is [Not billable], or capture is marked as [Not billable].
    Task is [Fixed price task].
    Billable, but not yet billed.
    Already billed or Already (indirectly) billed by billed fixed price task.

    For consumables, a progress bar is also displayed to represent whether and how much has already been billed.

    MT (Open):

    Externally still open, that is, not yet settled (actual) net costs of billable materials.

    MT (Invo.):

    Externally already billed (actual) net cost of billable materials.

    I-Margin:

    Profit (= ) or loss value (= ) as difference between the externally already settled net costs and the total purchase price of the materials.

    Formula:
    Invoice margin = Billed net costs - total purchase price.

    Act.:

    Action number: 1 - display, 2 - edit, 3 - create, 4 - delete

    Reporting > Times > Performance Proof

    Listing of time recording for a specific timespan with various selection criteria (project, customer, employee, etc.)


    The performance record is primarily used to present the services rendered to the client within a certain period of time. A printable report with all data is created ready for sign-off via the file manager.




    Set display criteria for the service confirmation.


    Set display criteria for the service confirmation.

    Define selection criteria according to which the performance record of the individual projects is to be prepared for the corresponding employee. In particular, the time span to be displayed can be set, as well as the underlying project.

    If the display type is "Automatic", the program automatically selects the time span to be displayed.



    Field Descriptions

    Time Span from:

    This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

    In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

    Project:

    The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

    Time Span to:

    This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

    In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

    Customer:

    Here you can select the client of the activity (project, subproject or task).

    Max. Characters:

    Defines the maximum number of text characters to be displayed, i.e. if a text is too long (especially for print formatting), the text will be wrapped or truncated after the entered number of characters, depending on the "Line break" field set.

    An entry of '0' means: no text wrapping. For print formatting, e.g., for the "Proof of service", the preset value of 50 (= default) is recommended.

    Person:

    This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

    Max Prj. Chars:

    Definition of the maximum number of text characters to be displayed for the project designation, i.e. if a text is too long (in particular for print formatting), the text is wrapped or truncated from the number of characters entered, depending on the "Line break" field set. If a value is entered, the project is also displayed without the project numbering.

    An entry of '0' means: No text wrapping and project numbering (= default).

    Display Type:

    Specifies how certain data should be formatted within a report.

    Line Break:

    Specifies whether texts are to be wrapped or truncated after a certain number of characters. When text is wrapped, the text remaining after a certain number of characters is continued in the next line and possibly wrapped again, and so on.

    Subtotals:

    By ticking this checkbox you can define whether subtotals should be displayed or not.

    Note: In day mode, subtotals are formed after each week if the checkbox is ticked.

    Empty Entries:

    By checking or unchecking this field, you can determine whether irrelevant entries (=blank entries) are to be displayed or not.

    If, for example, a month is listed for a project, but only two days in this month were worked for this project, you can decide here whether the entire month or only these two days should be displayed.

    Project No.:

    This is the directory number for a project.

    The directory number cannot be changed for parent projects.

    The directory number is automatically adjusted when deleting or moving.

    By manually changing the directory number, you can move projects within a hierarchy.

    Travel Costs:

    Display function only: Literal for the travel expense block in time recording.

    Unknown:

    If this checkbox is checked, "unknown" tasks will also be displayed.

    Release:

    The release indicates whether the record has been released for settlement.


    Display

    By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




    Performance record


    Performance record

    The performance record for the individual employees is displayed here, depending on the time span set. The project or subproject set in the selection field serves as the base project.

    All subprojects or tasks assigned to this project are listed in the report, provided that a timesheet exists for them.



    Field Descriptions

    Day:

    Full day of the week name.

    Date:

    Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

    Time:

    Used to enter or display a time.

    Break:

    In Break the user enters the sum of his breaks taken during the activity performed.

    Project:

    This field displays employees who are involved in the current project.

    Serv.-Type:

    The activity type in cost accounting is a reference value that indicates the qualitative technical description of the production activity. Here, it can be classified between productive (=value-adding) and non-productive types.

    Activity:

    In this field you have the possibility to describe your work in detail. The more exact the descriptions, the more exactly the work progress can be reconstructed at a later time.

    Annotation:

    This field displays general comments about a project.

    Editor:

    Indicates which user last edited a record.

    TotalHours:

    This field contains the total hours for an entered activity, regardless of whether the work performed is billable or not.

    Inv.Hrs.:

    This field contains the billable hours for an entered activity.

    Reporting > Times > Time Data Report

    Listing of the time recording of individual employees with display of the target/actual times and absence days


    Authorized persons can view the hourly reports of individual/all employees of any period for statistical purposes. The level of detail can be varied using the display type.




    Hourly report selection


    Hourly report selection

    Specify selection criteria according to which the hour report for individual employees is to be formatted.

    In particular, the time span to be displayed can be set.
    If the display type is "Automatic", the program selects the time span to be displayed automatically.



    Field Descriptions

    Person:

    This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

    Display:

    Specifies how certain data should be formatted within a report.

    Time Span from:

    This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

    In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

    Text:

    Text field

    Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

    Time Span to:

    This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

    In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

    Empty Entries:

    By checking or unchecking this field, you can determine whether irrelevant entries (=blank entries) are to be displayed or not.

    If, for example, a month is listed for a project, but only two days in this month were worked for this project, you can decide here whether the entire month or only these two days should be displayed.

    Hours:

    Number of hours according to context, e.g. number of overtime hours to be paid, etc.

    Estimat.:

    Determine whether or not plan estimates, that is, days with assigned plan tasks, should be displayed in the future.

    Workday:

    Indicates how many days the employee is required to work per week.

    Leave:

    Field to display an employee's vacation days.

    Spec. Leave:

    Field to display an employee's special leave days.

    Training:

    Field to display the training days of an employee.

    Sick:

    Field for the display of the sick days of an employee.

    Absent:

    Field to display the days of absence of an employee.

    Flextime:

    This field indicates whether the worker is entitled to work in floating day.

    If the user is authorized to do so, he can book time records to "Floating day" within the time recording.

    This allows the user to enter a floating day for e.g. Friday, if he has already fulfilled his target until Thursday.

    By making this entry, the user is also prevented from being registered via the time recording check program, even though he has already worked the necessary hours.


    Display

    By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




    Hourly Report


    Hourly Report

    The hour report for the individual employees is displayed here, depending on the time period set.



    Field Descriptions

    Days:

    Full day of the week name.

    Time:

    Used to enter or display a time.

    Date:

    Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

    Workday:

    Indicates how many days the employee is required to work per week.

    Leave:

    Field to display an employee's vacation days.

    Sp. Leave:

    Field to display an employee's special leave days.

    Training:

    Field to show how many days of training an employee has.

    Sick:

    Here is the sum of the days in which the employee was sick.

    Absent:

    Field to display the days of absence of an employee.

    Flextime:

    Number of floating days in this month.

    Plan.Hrs.:

    Indicates how many hours an employee must work in a given period of time

    Act.Hrs.:

    Indicates how many hours an employee actually worked in a given time period.

    Delta:

    The delta hours are the difference between actual and target hours. They indicate how many hours the person has worked more or less than contractually agreed in the specified period (= overtime or minus hours).

    Reporting > Times > Time Cost Report

    Listing of the billable time recording of employees in a certain timespan


    Detailed listing of all time recording hour costs in a freely definable period per employee and task.

    As a filter criterion, in addition to the "person" and the "task", it is also possible to restrict by means of the "period" or the "client". The calendar display type is also freely adjustable between "daily", "monthly" or "annual overview".




    Set display criteria for the cost report.


    Set display criteria for the cost report.

    Define the selection criteria according to which a cost report of the individual projects is to be prepared for the corresponding customer. In particular, the date to be displayed ("Time period from", "Time period to") can be set, as well as the underlying project.

    If you have the appropriate rights, then a selection list will appear in the "Person" field, in which you can specify an employee for whom you want to see the cost report.

    For client 1 the whole thing even cross-client.

    SELECTION OPTIONS:
    Display type
  • Automatic
    		• The program independently selects the most appropriate display format for the entered time period.
  • Day(s), Month(s), Year(s)
    		• The entered time span will be split into the selected time unit.

    Note: This will not work if "All employees" is selected, as here the employee names are the sort order.
    Project/Task
  • All projects
    		• All projects and subprojects are listed, to which the employee is assigned, and are included in the calculation.
  • Without projects
    		• Like "All projects", but all projects/tasks are not displayed, but only flow into the calculation.
  • Project (selected)
    		• Only the selected project with all subprojects will be listed, and will be included in the calculation.
    Person
  • All employees
    		• All employees of a firm, no matter if within or across clients, are listed. However, only those are displayed, which also really have entries for the selected criteria.
  • Intra-client employees
    		• Like "All employees" , but only intra-client.
  • Cross-client employees
    		• Like "All employees" , but only cross-client.
  • No employees
    		• Like "All employees" , but these are not listed individually, but their costs are added up to the corresponding projects.
  • Employee (selected)
    		• Only the cost report for the selected employee will be generated.
    Travel expenses
  • Travel expenses. Show in own line
    		• All travel expenses written down for a project will only be shown in the following line.
  • Add travel cost. Add to hourly costs
    		• All travel costs written down for a project will be added to the normal EK/VK.
  • Show travel costs alone
    		• Only the incurred travel costs for a project will be listed.
  • Do not include travel costs
    		• Only the normal costs for a project are listed, all travel costs are not calculated.


    NOTE:
    Note about travel expenses: Even if a record was marked as "not allocable" during time recording and entries were made for travel expenses at the same time, then such records are basically always included in the calculation of travel expenses.



    Field Descriptions

    Time Span from:

    This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

    In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

    Customer:

    Here you can select the client of the activity (project, subproject or task).

    Time Span to:

    This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

    In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

    Person:

    This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

    Display Type:

    Specifies how certain data should be formatted within a report.

    Project:

    The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

    Show Empty Entries:

    By checking or unchecking this field, you can determine whether irrelevant entries (=blank entries) are to be displayed or not.

    If, for example, a month is listed for a project, but only two days in this month were worked for this project, you can decide here whether the entire month or only these two days should be displayed.

    Disp. Absent.:

    Determination of whether absences, i.e. days with missing time recording, should be displayed in the past or not.

    Release:

    The release indicates whether the record has been released for settlement.

    Show Unknown:

    If this checkbox is checked, "unknown" tasks will also be displayed.

    Disp. Unassign.:

    Determine whether empty assignments, that is, days without assigned plan tasks, should be displayed in the future or not.

    Clearable:

    Specifies whether or not to display offsetting entries.

    Serv.-Type:

    The activity type in cost accounting is a reference value that indicates the qualitative technical description of the production activity. Here, it can be classified between productive (=value-adding) and non-productive types.

    Disp. Estimat.:

    Determine whether or not plan estimates, that is, days with assigned plan tasks, should be displayed in the future.

    Invoiced:

    Specifies whether or not to display billed entries.

    Max. Hours/Day:

    If this field is activated, the estimated billable hours are determined from the maximum of TARGET and ACTUAL hours, i.e. in the normal case, a complete working day is used for the calculation of earnings.

    Sort by Travel:

    If this checkbox is ticked, the trips are sorted and grouped by trip type incl. trip start and end, and not by current date.

    Travel Costs:

    Here you can select how the travel expenses entered in the time recording are to be included in the listed calculation.

    Possible settings:


    Display travel expenses in separate row:
    - Travel expenses are included and displayed on the next line of the project to which they are assigned.

    Add travel expenses to employee costs:
    - Travel expenses are included and added to employee costs in the same row of the project to which they are assigned.

    Show Travel Expenses Alone:
    - Only all travel expenses incurred alone will be displayed in the listing, meaning that all other employee hourly costs will not be included in the calculation.

    Do not add travel expenses:
    - Travel costs are not included in the calculation, only employee hourly costs are listed.

    Day Specifications:

    Specify whether day specifications are displayed or not, that is, whether day specifications are to be added to the travel expenses or not.

    Payment Type:

    The payment type for travel expense receipts specifies who paid the receipt.

    There are two possibilities:

    • Company
      The receipt was paid by the company, e.g. usually for airline tickets, hotel accommodation etc.
    • Private
      The receipt was paid privately by the employee, e.g. usually for food, parking, taxi etc.


    Display

    By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




    Cost Report


    Cost Report

    Here, depending on settings in the control mask, the cost report for the selected employees is displayed.

    NOTE:
    (see control mask "Set display criteria for the cost report")



    Field Descriptions

    Day:

    Full day of the week name.

    Date:

    Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

    Time:

    Used to enter or display a time.

    Project:

    This field displays the assigned project.

    Serv.-Type:

    The activity type in cost accounting is a reference value that indicates the qualitative technical description of the production activity. Here, it can be classified between productive (=value-adding) and non-productive types.

    Plan.Hrs.:

    Indicates how many hours an employee must work in a given period of time

    Act.Hrs.:

    Indicates how many hours an employee actually worked in a given time period.

    Delta:

    The delta hours are the difference between actual and target hours. They indicate how many hours the person has worked more or less than contractually agreed in the specified period (= overtime or minus hours).

    PP:

    This is the monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial expenditure for the company per hour of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to VK=sales price).

    Costs:

    Specifies whether the material always incurs costs (fixed) or only when used (variable).

    VAT:

    VAT on the total price of certain items.

    Gross:

    Invoice costs including statutory value added tax

    Inv.Hrs.:

    This field contains the billable hours for an entered activity.

    SP:

    This is the monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial return for the company per day of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to EK=purchase price).

    Income:

    Yield = Number of hours to be billed x VK

    U-Margin:

    Consumption margin for a project, i.e. the difference between ext. consumed budget and int. consumed budget.

    Rel.:

    The release indicates whether the record has been released for settlement.

    Clear:

    Specifies whether or not to display offsetting entries.

    Inv.:

    Specifies whether or not to display billed entries.

    Link:

    This field is optional. If a link is entered, the automatic user rights query is bypassed and the Trans_ID field is cleared.

    Reporting > Times > Skill Statistics

    Graphical processing of time data grouped by skills


    Statistical evaluation of the skill distribution to each individual task or project. Here, the selection criteria can be conveniently adjusted to obtain either a global project listing or an individual listing for a specific employee in a specific time period.




    Display criteria for project statistics


    In the mask Display criteria for project statistics the selection is made which statistical evaluation of the capability distribution is to be listed.

    At least in one of the fields Project, Person, 1st Project Leader or Skill a specified entry must be selected, which serves as a basis for the determination of the statistical data. A selection of more than one entry limits the amount of data determined accordingly.

    The period to be displayed can be specified via the two input fields Time Span from and Time Span to. If no entry is made, the entire relevant period is included in the calculation.

    By ticking the checkbox Complete the determined skills for each relevant task are displayed in detail.

    The desired data are determined after a click on the button Display and displayed in the mask Project statistics prepared. There it can be processed further via the [File Manager].



    Field Descriptions

    Project:

    The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

    Person:

    This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

    Time Span from:

    This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

    In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

    1st Project Leader:

    In this field the manager of a project is displayed or must be selected from a selection list. The project manager is defined once in the master project, and is then preselected as a PROPOSAL in all underlying projects.

    Green displayed persons in the selection field are project leaders, which are already assigned to at least one project in this role.

    Project managers are created using the role mask with role "Project Manager".

    Time Span to:

    This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

    In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

    Skill:

    Selecting a specific skill or skill group to group employees.

    Complete:

    Ticking this checkbox will display the identified skills in detail for each relevant task.


    Display




    Project statistics


    Display detailed information of the skill distribution for a selected project/employee.

    In the mask Project statistics all important information concerning the skill distribution for a selected project or employee is displayed clearly. The information content can vary depending on the display options set (see help for mask Display criteria for project statistics).



    Field Descriptions

    Text:

    Text field

    Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

    Text:

    Text field

    Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

    Text:

    Text field

    Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

    Text:

    Text field

    Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

    Text:

    Text field

    Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

    Reporting > Travels > Travel Expense: Daily Allowances

    Daily allowances (= daily flat rates and non-monetary compensation) for one person's tarvels


    Detailed daily travel expenses report

    All possible information on the per diems (= per diems and per diems in kind) of a person's trips is listed here.




    Selection criteria


    Define selection criteria for the travel expenses per diem report.

    A person for whom the report is to be created must always be selected.

    Possible other optional criteria are the travel period, the project or the client.

    NOTE:
    The project filter works only here for the project selection. If no project is selected, all trips will be listed regardless of the set project filter.



    Field Descriptions

    Start Date:

    If a date is written into this field, then all determined dates are limited to dates whose start date is after the date entered here.

    Person:

    This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

    End Date:

    If a date is written into this field, then all determined dates are limited to dates whose end date is before the date entered here.

    Project:

    The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

    Customer:

    Here you can select the client of the activity (project, subproject or task).


    Display

    By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




    Travel Expenses Daily Detail Report


    Travel Expenses Daily Detail Report

    All existing information on the daily data is listed clearly.

    The report is divided into the individual trips sorted by start date.

    The report is divided into three main areas:

    • The left day section contains for each day the indication of the weekday, the date, the period as well as the number of hours.
      • .
    • The middle per diem section contains, for each day, the information for meals and lodging, as well as the resulting total per day.

    • The right remuneration in kind section contains for each day the information for meals arranged by the employer, which are to be deducted from the per diems. The meals are divided into breakfast, lunch and dinner. The resulting total amount to be deducted per day is also listed.



    Field Descriptions

    Day:

    Full day of the week name.

    Date:

    Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

    Time Per.:

    Displays the runtime of the project in a combined field.

    Hours:

    Number of hours according to context, e.g. number of overtime hours to be paid, etc.

    Board:

    Daily allowance for meals. This is dependent on the duration of travel for that day.

    Accom.:

    Here you can enter the flat rate for accommodation costs per night.

    Overnight stay allowances can only be granted if the traveller is an employee. The employer can reimburse his employee for overnight expenses tax-free: In the amount of the expenses proven by receipt or, without proof, in the amount of the flat-rate amount, which varies from country to country, insofar as the employee did not receive the accommodation free of charge or at a reduced price from the employer or from a third party due to his employment relationship.

    The tax-free payment of the lump sum is also not permitted in the case of overnight accommodation in a vehicle. In the case of use of a sleeping car or a ship's cabin, the lump sums may only be paid tax-free if the overnight stay has begun or ended in another accommodation.

    For such days, the overnight allowances shall be deactivated.

    Since 2008, entrepreneurs can no longer claim any lump sums for overnight stays at all. Costs for overnight stays can now only be claimed by entrepreneurs as business expenses in the amount actually incurred, which must be proven by receipt.
    Always make sure to deposit the currently valid statutory flat rates, otherwise trips can no longer be correctly accounted for tax purposes!

    Sum:

    Here you specify whether the employee's hours per day are to be totalled or listed individually.

    Breakf.:

    Less meal arranged by the employer, in this case breakfast.

    Lunch:

    Less meal arranged by the employer, in this case lunch.

    Supper:

    Less meal arranged by the employer, in this case dinner.

    Sum:

    The actual total is displayed here.

    Reporting > Travels > Travel Expense: Report

    Evaluation of all billable travel expenses to project, customer and employees


    Detailed listing of all travel expenses in a freely definable period per employee and task.

    As a filter criterion, in addition to the "person" and the "task", it is also possible to limit the list using the "period" or the "customer". The calendar display type is also freely adjustable between "daily", "monthly" or "annual overview".




    Set display criteria for the cost report.


    Set display criteria for the cost report.

    Define the selection criteria according to which a cost report of the individual projects is to be prepared for the corresponding customer. In particular, the date to be displayed ("Time period from", "Time period to") can be set, as well as the underlying project.

    If you have the appropriate rights, then a selection list will appear in the "Person" field, in which you can specify an employee for whom you want to see the cost report.

    For client 1 the whole thing even cross-client.

    SELECTION OPTIONS:
    Display type
  • Automatic
    		• The program independently selects the most appropriate display format for the entered time period.
  • Day(s), Month(s), Year(s)
    		• The entered time span will be split into the selected time unit.

    Note: This will not work if "All employees" is selected, as here the employee names are the sort order.
    Project/Task
  • All projects
    		• All projects and subprojects are listed, to which the employee is assigned, and are included in the calculation.
  • Without projects
    		• Like "All projects", but all projects/tasks are not displayed, but only flow into the calculation.
  • Project (selected)
    		• Only the selected project with all subprojects will be listed, and will be included in the calculation.
    Person
  • All employees
    		• All employees of a firm, no matter if within or across clients, are listed. However, only those are displayed, which also really have entries for the selected criteria.
  • Intra-client employees
    		• Like "All employees" , but only intra-client.
  • Cross-client employees
    		• Like "All employees" , but only cross-client.
  • No employees
    		• Like "All employees" , but these are not listed individually, but their costs are added up to the corresponding projects.
  • Employee (selected)
    		• Only the cost report for the selected employee will be generated.
    Travel expenses
  • Travel expenses. Show in own line
    		• All travel expenses written down for a project will only be shown in the following line.
  • Add travel cost. Add to hourly costs
    		• All travel costs written down for a project will be added to the normal EK/VK.
  • Show travel costs alone
    		• Only the incurred travel costs for a project will be listed.
  • Do not include travel costs
    		• Only the normal costs for a project are listed, all travel costs are not calculated.


    NOTE:
    Note about travel expenses: Even if a record was marked as "not allocable" during time recording and entries were made for travel expenses at the same time, then such records are basically always included in the calculation of travel expenses.



    Field Descriptions

    Time Span from:

    This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

    In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

    Customer:

    Here you can select the client of the activity (project, subproject or task).

    Time Span to:

    This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

    In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

    Person:

    This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

    Display Type:

    Specifies how certain data should be formatted within a report.

    Project:

    The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

    Show Empty Entries:

    By checking or unchecking this field, you can determine whether irrelevant entries (=blank entries) are to be displayed or not.

    If, for example, a month is listed for a project, but only two days in this month were worked for this project, you can decide here whether the entire month or only these two days should be displayed.

    Disp. Absent.:

    Determination of whether absences, i.e. days with missing time recording, should be displayed in the past or not.

    Release:

    The release indicates whether the record has been released for settlement.

    Show Unknown:

    If this checkbox is checked, "unknown" tasks will also be displayed.

    Disp. Unassign.:

    Determine whether empty assignments, that is, days without assigned plan tasks, should be displayed in the future or not.

    Clearable:

    Specifies whether or not to display offsetting entries.

    Serv.-Type:

    The activity type in cost accounting is a reference value that indicates the qualitative technical description of the production activity. Here, it can be classified between productive (=value-adding) and non-productive types.

    Disp. Estimat.:

    Determine whether or not plan estimates, that is, days with assigned plan tasks, should be displayed in the future.

    Invoiced:

    Specifies whether or not to display billed entries.

    Max. Hours/Day:

    Indicates the maximum number of hours the employee would or may volunteer to work in a given day.

    Sort by Travel:

    If this checkbox is ticked, the trips are sorted and grouped by trip type incl. trip start and end, and not by current date.

    Travel Costs:

    Here you can select how the travel expenses entered in the time recording are to be included in the listed calculation.

    Possible settings:


    Display travel expenses in separate row:
    - Travel expenses are included and displayed on the next line of the project to which they are assigned.

    Add travel expenses to employee costs:
    - Travel expenses are included and added to employee costs in the same row of the project to which they are assigned.

    Show Travel Expenses Alone:
    - Only all travel expenses incurred alone will be displayed in the listing, meaning that all other employee hourly costs will not be included in the calculation.

    Do not add travel expenses:
    - Travel costs are not included in the calculation, only employee hourly costs are listed.

    Day Specifications:

    Specify whether day specifications are displayed or not, that is, whether day specifications are to be added to the travel expenses or not.

    Payment Type:

    The payment type for travel expense receipts specifies who paid the receipt.

    There are two possibilities:

    • Company
      The receipt was paid by the company, e.g. usually for airline tickets, hotel accommodation etc.
    • Private
      The receipt was paid privately by the employee, e.g. usually for food, parking, taxi etc.


    Display

    By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




    Cost Report


    Cost Report

    Here, depending on settings in the control mask, the cost report for the selected employees is displayed.

    NOTE:
    (see control mask "Set display criteria for the cost report")



    Field Descriptions

    Day:

    Full day of the week name.

    Date:

    Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

    Time:

    Used to enter or display a time.

    Project:

    This field displays employees who are involved in the current project.

    Serv.-Type:

    The activity type in cost accounting is a reference value that indicates the qualitative technical description of the production activity. Here, it can be classified between productive (=value-adding) and non-productive types.

    Plan.Hrs.:

    Indicates how many hours an employee must work in a given period of time

    Act.Hrs.:

    Indicates how many hours an employee actually worked in a given time period.

    Delta:

    The delta hours are the difference between actual and target hours. They indicate how many hours the person has worked more or less than contractually agreed in the specified period (= overtime or minus hours).

    PP:

    This is the monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial expenditure for the company per hour of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to VK=sales price).

    Costs:

    Specifies whether the material always incurs costs (fixed) or only when used (variable).

    VAT:

    VAT on the total price of certain items.

    Gross:

    Invoice costs including statutory value added tax

    Inv.Hrs.:

    This field contains the billable hours for an entered activity.

    SP:

    This is the monetary value, the amount of which shows the financial return for the company per day of use of a worker or a material (counterpart to EK=purchase price).

    Income:

    Yield = Number of hours to be billed x VK

    U-Margin:

    Consumption margin for a project, i.e. the difference between ext. consumed budget and int. consumed budget.

    Rel.:

    The release indicates whether the record has been released for settlement.

    Clear:

    Specifies whether or not to display offsetting entries.

    Inv.:

    Specifies whether or not to display billed entries.

    Link:

    This field is optional. If a link is entered, the automatic user rights query is bypassed and the Trans_ID field is cleared.

    Completion > Invoicing > Create/Edit Outgoing AR Invoice

    Create or edit outgoing AR invoices from projects and tasks by fixed price, hourly basis, travel or material


    Manage (display, create, modify or delete) invoices selected by "client", "project" or "period".
    The following four categories can be billed:

    • Project (fixed price)
    • Project (hourly basis)
    • Travel expenses
    • Material

    .
    Each invoice can be provided with its own additional text. A newly created invoice is stored as a PDF file when viewed for the first time (also in the DMS) and managed.


    NOTE:
    An invoice which has not yet been created as a PDF can be deleted at any time. But if a PDF has already been created, then the invoice can only be cancelled. In both cases, the respective invoice items are released again and can be billed again.




    Search criteria


    Entering search criteria for invoices

    Here you can enter search criteria for invoices. According to these criteria lists of existing invoices are displayed.

    Button "Invoices"- displays the existing invoices for selection.

    Button "Outgoing list"- Outgoing information about selected invoices.

    At action "Create record [2]- you can enter criteria for invoice items, e.g. for which customer and for which project an invoice is created, as well as the time span in which the trips or time entries can be searched.
    With action "Change record [3]-these values are taken over from the changed invoice.

    Checkbox "with travel costs", "with material", "project with fixed price", "project with hourly basis: corresponding costs are displayed.

    Checkbox "Unknown": also entries of unknown projects will be displayed.



    Field Descriptions

    Customer:

    Here you can select the client of the activity (project, subproject or task).

    Time Span from:

    This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

    In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

    Search from:

    In this search field you can define the validity start of the time frame of the search.

    Text:

    Period

    Time Span to:

    This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

    In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

    Search up to:

    In this search field you can set the validity end of the time frame of the search.

    Project:

    The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

    Column:

    Specifies in which column the field should appear in the mask.

    Invoice Type:

    Type of invoice, which is the heading above the PDF-generated invoice.

    The invoice types can be stored in the [communication data] of the persons, e.g. in the client basic data, so that these invoice types apply to the entire client.

    The default invoice type is [Invoice] as the heading for an invoice.

    Calculat. Type:

    The calculation type determines whether deduction items from previous (partial) invoices should be displayed (type = complete) or not (type = normal).

    Invoice Form:

    Select which of the existing invoice forms of the client folders should be used for the PDF preparation of the invoice.

    Grouping Pos.:

    Maximum number of bundle items to be created per invoice category.

    A bundle item can consist of any number of invoice items.
    The individual invoice items to be bundled must have the same VAT rate!
    The quantity for the bundled item is always 1.00 and the unit is [Div.] (for miscellaneous), otherwise it will cause problems if different units like [Std.] and [kg] etc. are to be bundled.
    The net price of the bundled item is equal to the sum of the net prices times the quantity of the individual assigned invoice items.

    Invoice created:

    Indicates whether an invoice has already been created or not.

    Invoice paid:

    Indicates whether an invoice has already been paid or not.

    Cancel Invoice:

    "Yes" - invoice is marked as "cancelled" (instead of deleted), invoice positions in "Time data" are released (new invoice can be taken over again).

    Invoiced Positions:

    If this checkbox is set, all positions that have already been invoiced will also be displayed.

    Empty Entries:

    By checking or unchecking this field, you can determine whether irrelevant entries (=blank entries) are to be displayed or not.

    If, for example, a month is listed for a project, but only two days in this month were worked for this project, you can decide here whether the entire month or only these two days should be displayed.

    Ignore Release:

    Ignore release

    Person (Fix Price):

    If this checkbox is set, tasks with person accounting type = fixed price are displayed.

    Pers. Hour. B.:

    If this checkbox is set, tasks with person accounting type = hourly basis are displayed.

    Person (Travels):

    If this checkbox is set, tasks with travel expenses are displayed.

    incl. Day Specific.:

    If this checkbox is set, tasks with day specifications (=day flat rates + remuneration in kind) are displayed.

    Material (Fix Price):

    If this checkbox is set, tasks with material settlement type = fixed price are displayed.

    Material (Instant):

    If this checkbox is set, tasks with assigned instant materials are displayed, regardless of the material settlement type.

    Material (Usage):

    If this checkbox is set, tasks with material settlement type = unit basis are displayed.

    Material (Time):

    If this checkbox is set, tasks with material settlement type = hourly basis are displayed.


    Invoice

    Here you can create an invoice or display the invoice list for invoice selection.

    Invoice List

    The invoice list is output here.




    Invoice data


    Display of invoice data

    The selection of customer addresses, the entry of texts for the respective invoice, date change are enabled.



    Field Descriptions

    Invoice Number:

    The placeholder for the invoice number is an admin setting value.

    From:

    blank

    Text:

    Period

    To:

    blank

    Created on:

    This field contains the date when the document was entered into the system.

    Sent on:

    Indicates when the invoice went out.

    Gross Amount:

    Invoice costs including statutory value added tax

    Due Date:

    The payment date indicates by when an invoice must be paid.

    Paid on:

    Indicates when the invoice was paid.

    Amount Paid:

    How much of the bill has been paid?

    Customer Number:

    The customer number of a person can or must be entered in this field (maximum 15 characters).

    Salutation:

    Contains the salutation of a person in plain text, e.g. Mr., Mrs., Company etc..

    Name:

    In this field the family name of the person or the name of the legal entity (e.g. company name) is displayed or entered.

    Address:

    In Customer Address the address of the customer is selected for which the invoice is to be created.

    Contact Prs. C.:

    This field shows the contact person or the customer. By selecting a contact person, in some cases (e.g. project definition) a customer is automatically selected as well, since each contact person is assigned to exactly one customer.

    A contact person is created via the input mask in the menu item "Master data".

    Project Name:

    In the project name, the name or designation of the task (project, subproject, task) is specified.

    Text Add. (Head):

    The additional text entered here appears in the header of the PDF invoice to be printed, i.e. at the top before the actual invoice items.

    Text Add. (Foot):

    The additional text entered here appears in the footer area of the PDF invoice to be printed, i.e. at the bottom after the actual invoice items.

    Invoice Info Top:

    Communication text, which is additionally displayed in the upper info block of the invoice, in addition to the customer number, invoice number, etc.

    Invoice Text Bottom:

    Communication text, which is additionally displayed in the lower section of the invoice, after the final amount line.




    Edit invoice items


    Add items to the invoice

    Invoice items are displayed here for selection. After pressing the "OK"- button the checked positions will be added to the invoice.

    "Type" field :
    FP - projects with fixed price- billing type,
    SB - projects with hourly billing type,
    RK - travel expenses,
    MT - Material

    Release field:
    shows who released this entry for the invoice,
    MA- Employee,
    PL- Project Manager,
    GF/VW- Managing Director/ Administration



    Field Descriptions

    Only Cust. Data:

    Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

    Project:

    In the project name, the name or designation of the task (project, subproject, task) is specified.

    Description:

    The additional text entered here appears in the header of the PDF invoice to be printed, i.e. at the top before the actual invoice items.

    Annot.:

    This field displays general comments about a project.

    Rel.:

    The release indicates whether the record has been released for settlement.

    Invoiced:

    Total of all amounts already invoiced in previous invoices.

    UP Net:

    Net unit price (EP) per sales unit, e.g. project fixed price, sales hourly rate, etc.

    Amount:

    Specifies the number of sales units.

    Unit:

    In which unit is the quantity of items sold, e.g. kg, pieces, meters etc.?

    TP Net:

    Net total price = Net unit price times unit number

    VAT-Rate:

    Statutory value-added tax rate at which the invoice is issued. The gross amount to be billed is calculated from this tax rate.

    TP VAT:

    Total price Value added tax (VAT) net

    TP Gross:

    Gross total price = Net total price + VAT


    Multi Function

    Clicking this button will make the changes.




    Invoice items


    Here, all items belonging to a certain invoice ID are listed in a report and added up.

    By clicking on the "Export" icon, the data is prepared for the "Arthur" invoicing program and saved for further processing.
    By clicking on the "Print" icon, the data is prepared for printing and displayed in a new window.



    Field Descriptions

    Pos.:

    This field contains the unique identification number of the corresponding item in the invoice.

    If this checkbox is ticked, all matching invoice positions will be listed in the report.

    Project:

    In the project name, the name or designation of the task (project, subproject, task) is specified.

    Description:

    Description for the invoice item (e.g. name of task, employee, etc.)

    Amount:

    Specifies the number of sales units.

    Unit:

    In which unit is the quantity of article defined, e.g.: kg, m , pcs, or similar.

    VAT:

    Statutory value-added tax rate at which the invoice is issued. The gross amount to be billed is calculated from this tax rate.

    UP Net:

    Net unit price (EP) per sales unit, e.g. project fixed price, sales hourly rate, etc.

    TP Net:

    Net total price = Net unit price times unit number

    TP VAT:

    Total price Value added tax (VAT) net

    TP Gross:

    Gross total price = Net total price + VAT




    Invoice listing


    Invoice listing

    The invoices found with the above search criteria are listed here.
    By clicking on the corresponding icon on the right, the selected invoice can be viewed, modified or cancelled (=deleted).



    Field Descriptions

    Status:

    Displays the status of a record.

    Invoice Number:

    The placeholder for the invoice number is an admin setting value.

    Date:

    Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

    Time Per.:

    Displays the runtime of the project in a combined field.

    Sent on:

    Indicates when the invoice went out.

    Due Date:

    The key date is the day of the expected receipt of payment, that is, the day by which an outgoing invoice should be paid at the latest.

    If no cut-off date is defined, the day 14 days after the invoice issue date is used by default.

    Name:

    In this field the family name of the person or the name of the legal entity (e.g. company name) is displayed or entered.

    Project Name:

    In the project name, the name or designation of the task (project, subproject, task) is specified.

    Net Amount:

    Invoice costs without VAT.

    Value-Add. Tax:

    VAT for invoice costs.

    Gross Amount:

    Invoice costs including statutory value added tax

    Display:

    Clicking this button usually takes you to the display mode.

    Edit:

    Icon for changing an entry. If you click this button, you will usually enter the change mode.

    Delete:

    Icon to delete an entry.

    Completion > Invoicing > Outgoing AR Invoices

    Listing of all ougoing AR invoices with the option of entering incoming payments


    Manage (view or modify) invoice lists selected by "Client", "Project" or "Period".




    Search criteria


    Entering search criteria for invoices

    Here you can enter search criteria for invoices. According to these criteria lists of existing invoices are displayed.

    Button "Invoices"- displays the existing invoices for selection.

    Button "Outgoing list"- Outgoing information about selected invoices.

    At action "Create record [2]- you can enter criteria for invoice items, e.g. for which customer and for which project an invoice is created, as well as the time span in which the trips or time entries can be searched.
    With action "Change record [3]-these values are taken over from the changed invoice.

    Checkbox "with travel costs", "with material", "project with fixed price", "project with hourly basis: corresponding costs are displayed.

    Checkbox "Unknown": also entries of unknown projects will be displayed.



    Field Descriptions

    Customer:

    Here you can select the sold-to party of the task (project, subproject or task).

    Time Span from:

    This field displays the point in time from which data for a project should be listed.

    In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

    Search from:

    In this search field you can define the validity start of the time frame of the search.

    Text:

    Indicator in the form of a traffic light function whether invoice was already paid.

    Time Span to:

    This field displays the date up to which the data for a project should be listed.

    In input mode, a date can be entered here according to the user settings.

    Search up to:

    In this search field you can set the validity end of the time frame of the search.

    Project:

    The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

    Column:

    Specifies in which column the field should appear in the mask.

    Invoice Type:

    Type of invoice, which is the heading above the PDF-generated invoice.

    The invoice types can be stored in the [communication data] of the persons, e.g. in the client basic data, so that these invoice types apply to the entire client.

    The default invoice type is [Invoice] as the heading for an invoice.

    Calculat. Type:

    The calculation type determines whether deduction items from previous (partial) invoices should be displayed (type = complete) or not (type = normal).

    Invoice Form:

    Select which of the existing invoice forms of the client folders should be used for the PDF preparation of the invoice.

    Grouping Pos.:

    Maximum number of bundle items to be created per invoice category.

    A bundle item can consist of any number of invoice items.
    The individual invoice items to be bundled must have the same VAT rate!
    The quantity for the bundled item is always 1.00 and the unit is [Div.] (for miscellaneous), otherwise it will cause problems if different units like [Std.] and [kg] etc. are to be bundled.
    The net price of the bundled item is equal to the sum of the net prices times the quantity of the individual assigned invoice items.

    Invoice created:

    Indicates whether an invoice has already been created or not.

    Invoice paid:

    Indicates whether an invoice has already been paid or not.

    Cancel Invoice:

    "Yes" - invoice is marked as "cancelled" (instead of deleted), invoice positions in "Time data" are released (new invoice can be taken over again).

    Invoiced Positions:

    If this checkbox is set, all positions that have already been invoiced will also be displayed.

    Empty Entries:

    By checking or unchecking this field, you can determine whether irrelevant entries (=blank entries) are to be displayed or not.

    If, for example, a month is listed for a project, but only two days in this month were worked for this project, you can decide here whether the entire month or only these two days should be displayed.

    Ignore Release:

    Ignore release

    Person (Fix Price):

    If this checkbox is set, tasks with person accounting type = fixed price are displayed.

    Pers. Hour. B.:

    If this checkbox is set, tasks with person accounting type = hourly basis are displayed.

    Person (Travels):

    If this checkbox is set, tasks with travel expenses are displayed.

    incl. Day Specific.:

    If this checkbox is set, tasks with day specifications (=day flat rates + remuneration in kind) are displayed.

    Material (Fix Price):

    If this checkbox is set, tasks with material settlement type = fixed price are displayed.

    Material (Instant):

    If this checkbox is set, tasks with assigned instant materials are displayed, regardless of the material settlement type.

    Material (Usage):

    If this checkbox is set, tasks with material settlement type = unit basis are displayed.

    Material (Time):

    If this checkbox is set, tasks with material settlement type = hourly basis are displayed.


    Invoice

    Here you can create an invoice or display the invoice list for invoice selection.

    Invoice List

    The invoice list is output here.




    Invoice list


    Invoice list

    Display invoices according to search criteria.



    Field Descriptions

    Status:

    Displays the status of a record.

    Invoice Number:
