    The placeholder for the invoice number is an admin setting value.

    Date:

    Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

    Invoice Type:

    Type of invoice, which is the heading above the PDF-generated invoice.

    The invoice types can be stored in the [communication data] of the persons, e.g. in the client basic data, so that these invoice types apply to the entire client.

    The default invoice type is [Invoice] as the heading for an invoice.

    Calc. Type:

    The calculation type determines whether deduction items from previous (partial) invoices should be displayed (type = complete) or not (type = normal).

    Person:

    This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

    Contact:

    This field shows the contact person or the customer. By selecting a contact person, in some cases (e.g. project definition) a customer is automatically selected as well, since each contact person is assigned to exactly one customer.

    A contact person is created via the input mask in the menu item "Master data".

    City/Town:

    The person's place of residence is entered in this field.

    Project:

    The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

    Net Amount:

    Invoice costs without VAT.

    Value-Add. Tax:

    VAT for invoice costs.

    VAT-Rate:

    Statutory value-added tax rate at which the invoice is issued. The gross amount to be billed is calculated from this tax rate.

    Gross Amount:

    Invoice costs including statutory value added tax

    Sent on:

    Indicates when the invoice went out.

    Due Date:

    The key date is the day of the expected receipt of payment, that is, the day by which an outgoing invoice should be paid at the latest.

    If no cut-off date is defined, the day 14 days after the invoice issue date is used by default.

    Paid on:

    Indicates when the invoice was paid.

    Amount Paid:

    How much of the bill has been paid?




    Invoice overview


    Invoice overview

    In action "change" you can enter the data for "Outgoing_on", "Paid_on", "Paid".



    Field Descriptions

    Status:

    Displays the status of a record.

    Invoice Number:

    The placeholder for the invoice number is an admin setting value.

    Date:

    Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

    Person:

    This selection field is used to select the person whose data is to be edited or displayed depending on the action.

    Project:

    The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

    Net Amount:

    Invoice costs without VAT.

    Value-Add. Tax:

    VAT for invoice costs.

    Gross Amount:

    Invoice costs including statutory value added tax

    Sent on:

    Indicates when the invoice went out.

    Due Date:

    The key date is the day of the expected receipt of payment, that is, the day by which an outgoing invoice should be paid at the latest.

    If no cut-off date is defined, the day 14 days after the invoice issue date is used by default.

    Paid on:

    Indicates when the invoice was paid.

    Text:

    Indicator in the form of a traffic light function whether invoice was already paid.

    Amount Paid:

    How much of the bill has been paid?


    Change

    Clicking this button saves the changes made to the record in the database.

    Completion > Invoicing > Incoming AP Invoices

    Administration and listing of all incoming AP invoices with the possibility to enter outgoing payments


    Manage (display, create, modify or delete) incoming invoices selected by "Person type" or "Period".

    Each incoming invoice can be provided with its own description. It is possible to create automatic repeat incoming invoices. Likewise, the underlying invoice document can simply be added to the DMS as a file.




    Define selection criteria for incoming invoices


    Here you can define the criteria for incoming invoices, e.g. invoice period, invoice type, invoice status or similar, which are to be listed.



    Field Descriptions

    Time Span from:

    If a date is entered here, only incoming invoices are listed whose payment dates are after or on this date.

    Text:

    Text field

    Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

    Time Span to:

    If a date is entered here, only incoming invoices are listed whose payment dates are before or on this date.

    Invoice type:

    If a type is selected here, only incoming invoices of this invoice type are listed.

    Company/Person:

    If a name is selected here, only incoming invoices that have been assigned to this company or this person will be listed.
    (The company or person name that can be selected depends on the invoice type)

    Column:

    Specifies in which column the field should appear in the mask.

    Status:

    If a status is selected here only incoming invoices with this payment status are listed.

    Project:

    If a project is selected here only incoming invoices are listed which were assigned to this project.


    Select

    After a click on this button the incoming invoices are listed with the corresponding criteria.




    Data sheet of an incoming invoice


    Contains all information about an incoming invoice, i.e. invoice type, invoice number, invoice description, invoice amounts, invoice period, etc.

    Furthermore, repetition cycles for invoices can be defined and individual invoice documents can be uploaded and added to the DMS.



    Field Descriptions

    Invoice Type:

    Type of incoming invoice, e.g. partner invoice, customer invoice, contact invoice or similar
    (Additional types can be stored at any time itself as lookup values)

    Company/Person:

    Name of the company or person to which the incoming invoice is assigned.
    (The selectable company or person name depends on the invoice type)

    Invoice Number:

    Invoice number, which is on the underlying purchase invoice.
    (This invoice number is not checked for uniqueness, since different purchase invoices from different companies could have the same number)

    Task:

    Task to which the incoming invoice is assigned.
    (Whether this invoice consumes budget or not is defined in the corresponding budget type field)

    Description:

    Explanatory descriptions, details, remarks or similar for incoming invoice.

    Budget Type:

    Specifies whether, and if so, which internal budget (person or material budget) is consumed in the assigned task.

    Net Amount:

    Amount of the incoming invoice without legal VAT.

    Purch. Date:

    The purchase date corresponds to the invoice date of the incoming invoice.

    Person Created:

    Name of the person who entered this purchase invoice into fx-project.

    Legal VAT rate:

    Statutory value-added tax rate at which the invoice is issued. The gross amount to be billed is calculated from this tax rate.

    Value-Added Tax:

    Statutory VAT rate and amount of the incoming invoice.

    Due Date:

    The payment date specifies until when an incoming invoice must be paid.

    Created on:

    Date and time when this incoming invoice was entered into fx-project.

    Gross Amount:

    Amount of the incoming invoice including legal value added tax.

    Paid on:

    Date when this A/P invoice was paid.

    Repetition:

    Here the repetition cycle of an incoming invoice can be defined. As cycle can be selected between "daily", "weekly", "monthly", "quarterly" or "yearly".

    Specifies the cycle in which a project repeats.:

    Indicates the cycle in which a project repeats (daily, weekly, etc.). If something is entered in this field, the "In advance" field must also be filled in.

    End of Repet.:

    Specifies the date up to which a recurring invoice should be created automatically, depending on the cycle set.

    Buffer:

    Specifies the lead time for automatically creating a repeat receipt invoice, that is, up to how many days in the future a repeat receipt invoice should be created.

    Day of Week:

    Full day of the week name.

    Document:

    Document file


    Multi Function

    Clicking this button will make the changes.

    Back

    Button to take a step back.




    Listing of all incoming invoices


    Provides a line-by-line listing of key information for each A/P invoice, i.e., invoice type, invoice number, invoice description, invoice amounts, invoice period, etc.



    Field Descriptions

    Del.:

    Checkbox for comfortable marking of several incoming invoices, which should be deleted.

    Status:

    Payment status of the incoming invoice, i.e. "open" or "paid". The urgency of the payment of the incoming invoice is signaled by traffic light colors.

    Invoice Number:

    Invoice number of the underlying A/P invoice.

    Invoice Type:

    Type of A/P invoice, e.g. partner invoice, sold-to party invoice, contact invoice or similar.

    Company/Person:

    Name of the company or person to which the incoming invoice is assigned.

    Task:

    Task to which the incoming invoice is assigned.

    Description:

    Explanatory descriptions, details, remarks or similar for incoming invoice.

    Person Created:

    Name of the person who entered this purchase invoice into fx-project.

    Created on:

    Date and time when this incoming invoice was entered into fx-project.

    Purch. Date:

    The purchase date corresponds to the invoice date of the incoming invoice.

    Due Date:

    The payment date specifies until when an incoming invoice must be paid.

    Paid on:

    Date when this A/P invoice was paid.

    Budget Type:

    Specifies whether, and if so, which internal budget (person or material budget) is consumed in the assigned task.

    Net Amount:

    Amount of the incoming invoice without legal VAT.

    Value-Add. Tax:

    Legal VAT amount of the incoming invoice.

    VAT-Rate:

    Statutory VAT rate of the incoming invoice.

    Gross Amount:

    Amount of the incoming invoice including legal value added tax.

    Rep.:

    Shows graphically if a repetition cycle has been defined for this A/P Invoice or if it is already a repetition of an A/P Invoice. The repetition cycle is displayed as a tooltip as soon as the mouse is over the corresponding graphic symbol.

    Action:

    Action icons to edit or delete this incoming invoice. If an action cannot be executed, you will get more information in the tooltip of the corresponding icon.

    Completion > Projects > Archive Projects

    Completed projects can be archived (and thus possibly filtered out)


    With the archiving of completed parent projects, the filter can be used to reduce the display list of projects.




    Project list


    Listing of all authorized mother projects with the possibility to archive or de-archive completed projects.

    Listed are parent projects to which one has the right. The list can also be restricted by the filter.

    Setting the archiving indicator only serves to reduce the project list in selection fields or in the project menu. It has no effect on existing data.

    NOTE:
    Only projects that have already been completed can be archived.



    Field Descriptions

    Name of Project:

    The name of the project or the description of the activity (project, subproject, task) is displayed here.

    Status:

    This field shows how far a project has already progressed. In input mode, you can assign an attribute from a selection list to a project here, which reflects whether or how far a project is already advanced.

    The status can also be used to decide whether project data should be included in a report or not.

    Pln. Start:

    The target start date of the project is displayed or specified here, i.e. from when the project is to be started according to planning.

    Pln. End:

    The target end date of the respective reference object, e.g. project, time data, trip data, etc. is displayed or specified here, i.e. by when the object should be completed according to planning.

    Act. Start:

    The actual start date of the respective reference object, e.g. projects, time data, trip data etc. is displayed or specified here.

    Act. End:

    The actual end date of the respective reference object, e.g. project, time data, travel data, etc. is displayed or specified here.

    Archived:

    By setting this "archiving indicator", complete mother projects can be archived, i.e. the data is retained, but these projects are no longer displayed in the selection fields or in the project menu. This makes it possible to reduce the list of projects.
    A mother project can only be "archived" if it has already been completed, i.e. the status of the mother project and consequently of all subordinate projects must be set to "completed"
    .


    Name of Project

    By clicking on the button the entered data will be saved and the program execution will be continued.

    Completion > Projects > Destroy Projects

    Completely delete projects including all assigned information from the database


    Complete and final deletion of a selected project including all dependencies from the database. Before the actual deletion process, an overview is displayed showing the effects of the deletion.


    NOTE:
    Before shredding a project, the database should always be backed up.
    The shredding of a project also deletes all associated history tables, so that a recovery of accidentally deleted data is only possible by a complete restore of a previously backed up database (see also: Database backup).




    Select project


    Selection of the project to be processed. Shredding completely deletes all assigned entries of the respective project, including all history data!



    Field Descriptions

    Project:

    The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.


    Select

    Clicking on this button will forward the selected data.




    Project statistics


    Listing of the statistics data for the selected project with the option to completely remove the project including all dependencies.

    NOTE:
    This action cannot be undone! Please make sure to back up your database.



    Field Descriptions

    Only Cust. Data:

    Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

    Table:

    If the checkbox is activated, all data required for graphical processing will also be listed in a report, which can be displayed and downloaded as a PDF including graphics.

    Text Line:

    The tables with the corresponding information about the project are displayed here.

    No.:

    Sequential unique numbering.


    Destroy All

    By clicking on this button, the above mother project including all dependencies will be completely removed from the database.

    This action is irrevocable! Please create a backup of your data beforehand for safety's sake.

    Interfaces > Persons > Export (XML)

    Export person data as XML


    Each person type created in fx-project (client, contract partner of external employees, employee + contact) can be exported comfortably with this interface. All selected persons (optionally also with address or communication data) are converted via a simple element interface into an XML file, which can be downloaded immediately and integrated in the corresponding target program.




    Database -> XML


    Interface: Data export

    Export individually restricted data from different areas into an XML file.



    Field Descriptions

    Headline:

    Headline

    Text View:

    Specifies which text should be displayed for this link....


    Back

    Button to take a step back.

    Start

    Button to jump back to the beginning.

    Create XML

    button to create an XML file.

    Next

    Button to take a step forward.

    Interfaces > Persons > Import (XML)

    Import person data as XML


    Each person type created in fx-project (client, contract partner of external employees, employee + contact) can be imported comfortably with this interface. The persons to be imported (optionally also with address or communication data) must be available in a fx-project-compliant XML file. This makes it very easy, for example, to transfer persons from one client in fx-project to another.




    XML -> Database


    Interface: Data import

    Import data from an XML file into the database.



    Field Descriptions

    Headline:

    Headline

    Text View:

    Specifies which text should be displayed for this link....


    Back

    Button to take a step back.

    Start

    Button to jump back to the beginning.

    Import Data

    After clicking this button, the selected records will be imported, i.e. written into the database.

    Next

    Button to take a step forward.

    Interfaces > Projects > Export (CSV/MS-Project®)

    Export projects from fx-project® as a MS-Project® CSV file


    Generates a CSV file from the selected project or sub-project, which can be read into MS-Project®. This makes it very easy to exchange data between fx-project and MS-Project®.


    NOTE:
    The fields used in the CSV file can be freely defined and adapted. However, the default values are designed in such a way that a manual adjustment to MS-Project® is not necessary.




    Export projects to MS-Project


    Export projects to MS-Project

    Here you can export projects from fx-project to MS-Project® (as a text file separated by tabs).

  • Select a project and specify in which format the date and in which unit the effort in MS-Project® is desired. Then click on the download button to download the file.
    The following values will be transferred to MS-Project®:
    • Number
    • Project name
    • Target start
    • Target-.End
    • Type of project
    • Successor
    • Target effort
    • Description
    • Priority
    • Performance
    • Item
    • Level
    • Date of creation

    .

    After exporting, open the file with MS-Project® and select an appropriate MS-Project® import mapping (or create a new file, see MS-Project® Help).



    Field Descriptions

    GIF-Picture:

    Specifies which icon is used with this entry.

    Selection of the activity (project, subproject, task) for which you are authoriz:

    The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

    Dest. (File):

    Select destination (file, project, etc.)

    Sub Projects:

    If the checkbox is activated, all subordinate subprojects and tasks are included in addition to the main project.

    Attention!
    This can lead to longer waiting times for large projects.

    Separator:

    Separator for the export fields for project export in MS_Project.

    Date Format:

    Defines the format in which all dates are displayed and read in. The date must be defined with the following variables. Separator any:

    dd: Day 2 digits
    mm: Month 2 digits
    yy: Year 2 digits
    yyy: Year 4 digits

    Truncate Prefix:

    Prefix (German: Präfix or also Vorsilbe genannt) refers to a string of characters preceding the root of a word, here to create a group of words that belong together.

    It is used, for example, in the project name to achieve a uniform project affiliation already in the name. The placeholder structure to be used here can be defined in the administrator settings.

    Copy Resources:

    If this field is checked, the resources that are assigned to a task are also copied.


    Create

    Create text file

    Config.

    Change configuration




    MS-Project Export/Import Configuration


    MS-Project Export/Import Configuration



    Field Descriptions

    Only Cust. Data:

    Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

    Field:

    Contains the ID number of a field.

    MS-Project:

    Microsoft Project

    Alias:

    Text line


    Accept

    By clicking on the button the entered data will be saved and the program execution will be continued.

    Field

    The button Reset Values resets the values of the form to their initial values.

    MS-Project

    Clicking this button cancels the current action and jumps back to the last action.




    Listing of projects


    Listing of projects



    Field Descriptions

    Status:

    This field shows how far a project has already progressed. In input mode, you can assign an attribute from a selection list to a project here, which reflects whether or how far a project is already advanced.

    The status can also be used to decide whether project data should be included in a report or not.

    Project:

    This field displays the project name of the currently selected project.

    Time Period:

    Displays the runtime of the project in a combined field.

    Plan. Eff.:

    The target effort corresponds to the planned time effort in hours, man-days or man-years, etc. The estimated effort is entered when defining tasks. For projects/sub-projects, this value corresponds to the sum of all subordinate tasks.

    Prio.:

    Indicates the urgency of the (sub)project.
    The higher the priority of a project, the higher it is displayed in the control panel of an employee.

    Interfaces > Projects > Import (CSV/MS-Project®)

    Import projects from a MS-Project® CSV file into fx-project®


    Reads in a CSV file created with MS-Project® and creates a new project structure in fx-project from it. This makes it very easy to exchange data between fx-project and MS-Project®.


    NOTE:
    The fields used in the CSV file can be freely defined and adapted.




    Import projects from MS-Project


    Here you can import existing projects from MS-Project® to fx-project.

    The project in MS-Project® must be saved as a text file (separated by tabs).

    The following fields are necessary (on the left name in MS-Project®, in brackets the name under which the field must be exported in order to be recognised by fx-project):
    - Outline number (position)
    - Name (name/project description)
    - Start (start/target_start)
    - End (End/Target_End)
    - Work (Work/Target_Effort)
    - Predecessor (Predecessor/Dependent_of)

    Optional fields:
    - Created (Created/Date Created)
    - Notes (Notes/Description)
    - Priority (Priority)
    - %Completed (Percent_Completed/Percentage_of_Completion => then sets project status to Planned or Active)

    Select a valid (text) file and fill in the following selection fields with the respective people you want.

    Furthermore, specify in which unit the work was exported from MS-Project® (minutes, hours or similar) and in which format the date is.

    NOTE:
    None of the dates to be imported may contain text characters.



    Field Descriptions

    GIF-Picture:

    Specifies which icon is used with this entry.

    Document:

    Document file

    Selection of the activity (project, subproject, task) for which you are authoriz:

    The Project field lists the tasks (projects or tasks) for which you have the appropriate rights and the corresponding filter criteria apply.

    Contact Prs. C.:

    This field shows the contact person or the customer. By selecting a contact person, in some cases (e.g. project definition) a customer is automatically selected as well, since each contact person is assigned to exactly one customer.

    A contact person is created via the input mask in the menu item "Master data".

    1st Project L.:

    In this field the manager of a project is displayed or must be selected from a selection list. The project manager is defined once in the master project, and is then preselected as a PROPOSAL in all underlying projects.

    Green displayed persons in the selection field are project leaders, which are already assigned to at least one project in this role.

    Project managers are created using the role mask with role "Project Manager".

    Project Manag.:

    Specifies which person should be the project manager of this project.

    This field only serves as a further decision criterion in various reports, the Project Manager does not enjoy any additional rights or similar, these lie exclusively with the 1st Project Leader.

    The Project Manager is only set in projects and is then also selected in the respective tasks of the project.

    Green displayed persons in the selection field are project managers, which are already assigned to at least one project in this role.

    Project managers are created using the role mask with role "Project Manager".

    2nd Project L.:

    Here you can specify a deputy project manager for a project, who will stand in for the project manager if the latter is absent.

    Green displayed persons in the selection field are deputy project managers who are already assigned to at least one project in this role.

    Deputy project managers are created using the role mask with role "project manager".

    Date:

    Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

    Separator:

    Separator for the export fields for project export in MS_Project.

    Date Format:

    Defines the format in which all dates are displayed and read in. The date must be defined with the following variables. Separator any:

    dd: Day 2 digits
    mm: Month 2 digits
    yy: Year 2 digits
    yyy: Year 4 digits

    Date Bottom-Up:

    Adjust date using the bottom-up method

    Adjust the date according to the bottom-up method, i.e. all levels further up are stretched to the following date if there is a time overlap.

    1509:

    Text field

    Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

    Insert Prefix:

    Prefix (German: Präfix or also Vorsilbe genannt) refers to a string of characters preceding the root of a word, here to create a group of words that belong together.

    It is used, for example, in the project name to achieve a uniform project affiliation already in the name. The placeholder structure to be used here can be defined in the administrator settings.


    Create

    Create text file

    Config.

    Change configuration




    MS-Project Export/Import Configuration


    MS-Project Export/Import Configuration



    Field Descriptions

    Only Cust. Data:

    Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

    Field:

    Contains the ID number of a field.

    MS-Project:

    Microsoft Project

    Alias:

    Text line


    Accept

    By clicking on the button the entered data will be saved and the program execution will be continued.

    Field

    The button Reset Values resets the values of the form to their initial values.

    MS-Project

    Clicking this button cancels the current action and jumps back to the last action.




    Listing of projects


    Listing of projects



    Field Descriptions

    Row:

    Specifies in which line of the mask this field should appear.

    Project No.:

    Sequential unique numbering.

    Project:

    This field displays the project name of the currently selected project.

    Pln. Start:

    The target start date of the project is displayed or specified here, i.e. from when the project is to be started according to planning.

    Pln. End:

    The target end date of the respective reference object, e.g. project, time data, trip data, etc. is displayed or specified here, i.e. by when the object should be completed according to planning.

    Priority:

    Indicates the urgency of the (sub)project.
    The higher the priority of a project, the higher it is displayed in the control panel of an employee.

    Plan. Eff.:

    The target effort corresponds to the planned time effort in hours, man-days or man-years, etc. The estimated effort is entered when defining tasks. For projects/sub-projects, this value corresponds to the sum of all subordinate tasks.

    Time Format:

    With this user setting a user can define in which format he wants to have times displayed. The format is also the input format for this user.
    hh:mm (hours, minutes each with two digits)
    hh:mm:ss (hours, minutes, seconds each with two digits)
    hh:mm

    Description:

    Explanatory descriptions, details, comments or similar.


    Save

    Button to save data.

    Interfaces > Times > Time Recording App

    Time recording via APP - Note for calling and operating


    Special time recording as an app optimized for smartphones.

    NOTE:
    Can only be used in conjunction with the program function Execution>Times>TR (Day).

    Administration > Client > Client Settings

    General settings and options for the entire client


    Administrator settings that are valid for the individual client.




    Settings


    Here, various settings can be changed according to personal preferences, e.g. the "Date format", the "Decimal separator", the "Number of decimal places", the "Number of list entries", the "Sort order of projects", etc.

    Grayed settings have not yet been adjusted, i.e. these contain the specified original default values of your client.

    User settings that have already been adjusted can be reset to the original default value by checking the "Delete" checkbox in front of the corresponding setting value.

    A click on the "question mark" at the end of the line opens a separate help window for the corresponding setting value with an exact description of the change options.



    Field Descriptions

    Del.:

    This field indicates whether the related field for this profile may be deleted.

    Text:

    Text field

    Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

    Setting:

    Short description of the setting. Extracted settings have not been changed yet, i.e. these still have the original default value.

    Setting Value:

    Set value of the setting. This value can be changed according to personal preferences.

    Icon:

    Specifies which icon is used with this entry.


    Multi Function

    Clicking this button saves the entered data and continues the program execution.

    Administration > Client > Reference Values

    Individually extensible values for specific selection fields


    Look-up values are user entries in the "Values table". These must be created at the beginning of the use of fx-project. The information stored is accessed by the individual programs depending on the type of look-up value. Example of form of address: the various forms of address Mr./Mrs. etc. can be stored for this.




    Selection of lookup categories


    Selection of lookup categories

    Used to select the lookup categories in all available languages.



    Field Descriptions

    Assignment to a field in table "Fields:

    "Categorization" of the valuesTab. All tab values of the same type have the same ID_field (e.g. Mr, Mrs, Dr, Prof etc. for the field Salutation or German, English for the language).

    Language:

    The language set.

    Short description of a reference:

    This field displays the description of the reference name in short form.


    Display

    By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




    Lookup values


    All lookup values from the selected category are listed here and can either be changed, deleted or otherwise edited depending on the action set.

    With the action "Create record" an empty line is inserted for the new lookup values.

    With the action "Display", the values inserted by the user are displayed in bold.

    With the action "Change" only the system values are displayed. These may not be changed or deleted.



    Field Descriptions

    Only Cust. Data:

    Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

    Position:

    Position of this value in the listing, i.e. where the entry should be placed.

    Value:

    This field represents a specific lookup value selected from a selection box (e.g. all country codes, currencies, etc.).

    VAT:

    VAT on the total price of certain items.


    Save

    Button to save data.

    Administration > Client > Holidays

    Manage client-wide holidays


    The corresponding holidays can be activated separately for each client. Holidays can be a full or half working day, which have an effect on the planned working time of the employees for time recording etc.. Additional, not recorded holidays can be defined.




    Holidays for the year / and for the country


    Here all holidays can be changed, deleted or created completely new.

    If you create (half) bridge days, (half) holidays are created for the entire staff.

    However, the prerequisite for this is that

    1. the employee has not yet entered a leave or sick day on this day
    2. the employee has entered a workday on this day
    3. the employee has already entered a defined start and duration of work on this day
    4. the bridge day is in the future.

    For each (half) bridge day created, each employee is credited with one (half) day of leave.



    Field Descriptions

    Chk.:

    Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

    Day:

    Full day of the week name.

    Date:

    Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

    Holiday:

    Specifies the holiday name.

    Half:

    Indicates whether this holiday is full-day, half-day, or display-only.


    Chk.

    Clicking this button will make the changes.

    Administration > Client > Project Categories

    Defining individual project categories for better evaluation options


    Create and manage project categories.

    Create project categories and parent groups or group existing categories.




    Manage project categories


    Manage project category groups and project categories.

    With a click on the "Create new project category group" icon in the lower left corner of the "Prj. category group" column, a new group is dynamically integrated into the mask using JavaScript. Each group consists of a changeable sort number, as well as a changeable name and any number (or even none) of subordinate project categories.

    By clicking on the "Add" icon in the "Project categories" column, any number of categories can be dynamically created for a group. A category also consists of a changeable sort number, as well as a changeable name. These categories can be assigned to the projects in the individual project program functions.

    By clicking on the "Delete" icon to the right of each group or category field, they can be deleted. If a category is already assigned to at least one project or if the group or category is a default group or category of fx-project, then this icon is inactive and the category cannot be deleted. If a group is deleted which contains one or more non-deletable categories, then these categories are moved to the group "Unassigned" before the selected group is deleted.

    By clicking on the "Move" icon on the left in front of each category line, the assignment to the individual groups can be changed. If only one other group exists, then the category is moved immediately, otherwise the target group must be selected in a popup window.

    Any new entries, changes or deletions made are not applied in fx-project until the [Save] button is clicked.



    Field Descriptions

    Text:

    Manage project categories


    Save

    Button to save data.

    Administration > Client > Form Designer

    Adjustment of form templates (e.g. invoice) to the individual CI


    Customize configuration files




    Select configuration file


    Select configuration file



    Field Descriptions

    Client Folder:

    Folder of the client

    The client folder is the subfolder on the file system in the fx-project directory with the number of the current client.

    The client folder contains special settings files of the client, such as configuration files, person graphs, chat logs or statistics data, etc.

    Configuration Type:

    Type of configuration file

    The configuration type indicates the type of configuration file, i.e. is it a configuration file for emails, invoices etc.?

    Configuration File:

    Name of the configuration file

    Configuration file name defined by fx-project, i.e. [cfg_email.cfg] for emails, [cfg_plnw.cfg] for statement of work reports, [cfg_ppst.cfg] for graph reports, [cfg_prng.cfg] for invoices, and [cfg_pstd.cfg] for all other PDF reports.


    Edit

    Button for editing the data record.




    Edit configuration file


    Manage configuration files, i.e. create, edit or delete them.

    The configuration file shows the path and name of the current configuration file, which is currently being edited. If possible and allowed, an icon is offered on the right, with which the configuration file can be deleted if desired.

    The toolbar consists of various support tools to upload graphics, convert units of measurement or display command templates:


    • Upload image
      Dient to upload (= upload) graphics to be able to include them in the configuration file. Depending on the configuration file type, only a certain number of graphics can be uploaded at a time. For the e-mail configuration file, the limit is max. 4 pieces, for the PDF configuration files at max. 8 pieces at the same time.
      Only [.gif], [.jpg] or [.png] graphics are allowed as graphic format.


    • Include image
      Dient to include the uploaded graphics in the configuration files. A list of all existing graphics is displayed. With a click on a graphic, the corresponding command is written in the status bar, which can then be copied into the configuration file at the desired location using [cut & paste].
      The displayed command is aligned for a right-justified alignment of the graphic in the PDF document, so this is excellent for logos, etc.


    • Calculator
      Dient for converting PDF length units. This makes it very easy to convert millimeter (mm) specifications to the point (pt) units used with PDF documents. All you have to do is enter the new mm value in the corresponding field. If the field is left, the value is converted automatically into the point unit.
      One mm corresponds thereby to 2.83501683501 PDF points. Or vice versa: One PDF point corresponds to 0.35273159145 mm.


    • image
      Writes the command-.template [^Ppic|x|y|sf|align|width|height] in the status bar to embed a graphic into the PDF-document. This command can then be copied into the configuration file at desired location using [cut & paste] and customized.
      Parameter description: (The pipe symbol (= |, vertical line) acts as a separator of the individual parameters)
      • ^P stands as a shortcut for the instruction to include an image (P for Picture).
      • pic stands as a placeholder for the file name of the graphic to be displayed. The graphic must be located in the corresponding client folder - which is automatically the case if the graphic was uploaded with the corresponding icon.
      • x X-coordinate (= value on the right value axis, i.e. value from left to right on the screen) of the upper left corner of the graphic, if left-aligned; center, if centered; upper right corner, if right-aligned.
      • y Y-coordinate (= value on the superscript axis, i.e. value from top to bottom on the screen) of the upper left corner of the graphic, if left-aligned; midpoint, if centered; upper right corner, if right-aligned.
      • sf Scale factor from 0.00 (= 0%) to 2.00 (= 200%) of the original size. Default value = 1.00, i.e. do not display graphic reduced or enlarged. (This parameter is optional)
      • align Alignment of the graphic, i.e. left (= left-aligned), center (= centered) or right (= right-aligned). Default value = left, i.e. left-justified. (This parameter is optional)
      • width Width of the graphic in pixels. If this value is specified, the width of the graphic will be stretched or compressed according to the ratio of the specified width to the original width. (This parameter is optional)
      • height Height of the graphic in pixels. If this value is specified, the graphic height will be stretched or compressed according to the ratio of the specified height to the original height. (This parameter is optional)



    • text
      Writes the command template [^Ttext|x|y|sf|align|mode|lw] in the status bar to write a text into the PDF-document. This command can then be copied into the configuration file at desired location using [cut & paste] and customized.
      Parameter description: (The pipe symbol (= |, vertical line) acts as a separator of the individual parameters)
      • ^T stands as a shorthand for the instruction to write a text.
      • text stands as a placeholder for the text string to be displayed. The pipe must not be used, as this acts as a separator of the individual parameters.
      • x X-coordinate (= value on the right-value axis, i.e. value from left to right on the screen) of the left start point of the text baseline, if left-aligned; midpoint, if centered; right end point, if right-aligned.
      • y Y coordinate (= value on the superscript axis, i.e. value from top to bottom on the screen) of the left start point of the text baseline, if left-aligned; midpoint, if centered; right end point, if right-aligned.
      • sf Font size in PDF points. Default value = 8.00 points. (This parameter is optional)
      • align Alignment of the text, i.e. left (= left-aligned), center (= centered), or right (= right-aligned). Default value = left, i.e. left-justified. (This parameter is optional)
      • mode font mode, ie. normal (= without effects), bold (= boldface), outline (= outlined), shadow (= shaded), or stamp (= reverse shaded). Default value = normal, i.e. without effects. (This parameter is optional)
      • lw Stroke width in PDF points e.g. for border effect. Default value = 0.25 points. (This parameter is optional)



    • Box
      Writes the command-.Template [^Bx1|y1|x2|y2|rgb|fb|wd|bd|lw] in the status bar to draw a box (= filled rectangle) in the PDF-document. This command can then be copied into the configuration file at desired location using [cut & paste] and adjusted.
      Parameter description: (The pipe (= |, vertical line) acts as a separator of the individual parameters)
      • ^B stands as a shorthand for the instruction to draw a box.
      • x1 X coordinate (= value on the right value axis, i.e. value from left to right on the screen) of the upper left corner of the rectangle to be filled.
      • y1 Y coordinate (= value on the high value axis, i.e.i.e. value from top to bottom on the screen) of the upper left corner of the rectangle to be filled.
      • x2 X coordinate (= value on the right value axis, i.e. value from left to right on the screen) of the lower right corner of the rectangle to be filled.
      • y2 Y coordinate (= value on the high value axis, i.e. value from top to bottom on the screen) of the lower right corner of the rectangle to be filled.
      • rgb Rectangle color in hexadecimal format for Rred - Ggreen - Bblue color components. Default value = FFFF (= white). (This parameter is optional)
      • fb Frame pattern consisting of 4 numbers (0 or 1) with 1 = draw frame or 0 = do not draw frame. The 4 numbers are to be entered in the following order: Frame Left, Top, Right, Bottom. Default value = 1111, i.e. draw complete frame. (This parameter is optional)
      • wd White portion of the background pattern, i.e. a number between 0.00 (= none) and 1.00 (= full). Default value = 0.00, i.e. without white component. (This parameter is optional)
      • bd Black portion of the background pattern, i.e. a number between 0.00 (= without) and 1.00 (= full). Default value = 0.00, i.e. without black component. (This parameter is optional)
      • lw Line width in PDF points of the rectangular frame. Default value = 0.35 points. (This parameter is optional)



    • Rectangle
      Writes the command template [^Rx1|y1|x2|y2|wd|bd|lw] in the status bar to draw a rectangle in the PDF-document. This command can then be copied into the configuration file at desired location using [cut & paste] and customized.
      Parameter description: (The pipe (= |, vertical line) acts as a separator of the individual parameters)
      • ^R stands as a shorthand for the instruction to draw a rectangle.
      • x1 X-coordinate (= value on the right value axis, i.e. value from left to right on the screen) of the upper left corner of the rectangle.
      • y1 Y-coordinate (= value on the high value axis, i.e.i.e. value from top to bottom on the screen) of the upper left corner of the rectangle.
      • x2 X coordinate (= value on the right value axis, i.e. value from left to right on the screen) of the lower right corner of the rectangle.
      • y2 Y-coordinate (= value on the high value axis, i.e. value from top to bottom on the screen) of the lower right corner of the rectangle.
      • wd White portion of the frame pattern, i.e. a number between 0.00 (= none) and 1.00 (= full). Default value = 0.00, i.e. without white portion. (This parameter is optional)
      • bd Black portion of the frame pattern, i.e. a number between 0.00 (= without) and 1.00 (= full). Default value = 0.00, i.e. without black portion. (This parameter is optional)
      • lw Line width in PDF points of the rectangular frame. Default value = 0.35 points. (This parameter is optional)



    • line
      Writes the command template [^Lx1|y1|x2|y2|wd|bd|lw|rgb] in the status bar to draw a line in the PDF-document. This command can then be copied into the configuration file at desired location using [cut & paste] and customized.
      Parameter description: (The pipe (= |, vertical line) acts as a separator of the individual parameters)
      • ^L stands as a shorthand for the instruction to draw a line.
      • x1 X-coordinate (= value on the right value axis, i.e. value from left to right on the screen) of the upper left corner of the line.
      • y1 Y-coordinate (= value on the high value axis, i.e. value from top to bottom on the screen) of the upper left corner of the line.
      • x2 X coordinate (= value on the right value axis, i.e. value from left to right on the screen) of the lower right corner of the line.
      • y2 Y coordinate (= value on the high value axis, i.e. value from top to bottom on the screen) of the bottom right corner of the line.
      • wd White portion of the line pattern, i.e. a number between 0.00 (= none) and 1.00 (= full). Default value = 0.00, i.e. without white portion. (This parameter is optional)
      • bd Black portion of the line pattern, i.e. a number between 0.00 (= without) and 1.00 (= full). Default value = 0.00, i.e. without black component. (This parameter is optional)
      • lw Line width in PDF points of the line. Default value = 0.35 points. (This parameter is optional)
      • rgb Line color in hexadecimal format for Rred - Ggreen - Bblue color components. Default value = 000000 (= black). (This parameter is optional)




    The status bar displays the messages of the respective actions, or the command templates.

    In the actual input window, the configuration file can be edited and customized according to your own requirements.

    The Preview button opens a preview of the current configuration file in a new window. Pure sample data is used for display to simulate how the final result would look like.

    The Save button saves the changes to the configuration file.


    NOTE:
    If a button is mistakenly clicked which would overwrite the changes already made to the current configuration file, this is indicated by a JavaScript hint. If confirmed positively, the changes will still be saved.
    For a more detailed description incl. examples of the command templates please read the PDF document [_DOK/fx-project 05.2 Workflow - Example for PDF configuration file.pdf] available in the fx-project documentation folder.



    Field Descriptions

    Configuration File:

    Name of the configuration file

    Configuration file name defined by fx-project, i.e. [cfg_email.cfg] for emails, [cfg_plnw.cfg] for statement of work reports, [cfg_ppst.cfg] for graph reports, [cfg_prng.cfg] for invoices, and [cfg_pstd.cfg] for all other PDF reports.

    Toolbar:

    Toolbar to support the creation of a configuration file.

    Text Lines:

    Text line

    Description of a reference:

    This field displays the description of the reference name in long form.


    Preview

    Show preview

    Save

    Button to save data.

    Administration > Client > Automatic Emails

    E-mail settings which are valid for the whole client.

    Chk.:

    PL = Project manager -> Activation by ticking the checkbox.

    Chk.:

    PM = Project manager -> Activation by ticking the checkbox.

    AD = System administrator -> Activation by checking the checkbox.

    Chk.:

    Activation by ticking the checkbox.

    Chk.:

    Activation by ticking the checkbox.

    Chk.:

    Activation by ticking the checkbox.

    Chk.:

    Activation by ticking the checkbox.

    Activation by ticking the checkbox.

    Activation by ticking the checkbox.
