    Activation by ticking the checkbox.


    Settings

    Clicking this button will make the changes.

    Administration > Client > Scheduler

    Definition of times for certain special programs executed in the background


    Settings for the scheduler, i.e. for time-controlled fx-project programs such as:

    • ODBC synchronization
    • Time entry check
    • Email scheduling
    • Warnings
    • Project check

    .
    This allows you to specify which days of the week each program should run, as well as what times.




    Adjusting scheduler settings


    In this mask, the scheduling behavior can be adjusted for various available programs.

    In the field Interval repetition intervals can be specified in the unit "minutes". If the field is filled with "0", the program is executed only once. The specification of an interval basically only makes sense for the e-mail program.

    Depending on your ideas, you can have each of these programs not run at all, once or several times a week, daily or even several times a day.

    A more sensible execution schedule would be, for example, the following:

    Time tracking check: every workday, between 2:00 a.m. and 3:00 a.m., with no interval.

    Email scheduling: every weekday, between 0:00 and 24:00, with an interval between two and ten minutes.

    ODBC synchronization: every weekday, between 22:00 and 23:00, with no interval.

    Alerts: every weekday, between 3:00 and 4:00 am, with no interval.

    Projects check: every weekday, between 4:00 and 5:00 am, without interval.

    NOTE:
    Note: All programs listed here must be activated beforehand under "Administration -> License Points -> Special Programs" in order to be able to schedule them.



    Field Descriptions

    Only Cust. Data:

    Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

    Program Name:

    Names the scheduler program.

    Mo:

    This field can be used to check whether the resource is available on Monday or not.

    Tu:

    In this field you can check if the resource is available on Tuesday or not.

    We:

    In this field you can check if the resource is available on Wednesday or not.

    Th:

    In this field you can check if the resource is available on Thursday or not.

    Fr:

    In this field you can check whether the resource is available on Friday or not.

    Sa:

    In this field you can check if the resource is available on Saturday (weekend) or not.

    Su:

    In this field you can check if the resource is available on Sunday (weekend) or not.

    Pland From:

    Specifies the target start time.

    Pland To:

    Specifies the target end time.

    Int:

    Specifies the interval at which the scheduler program is to be restarted.

    Text:

    Time unit min. = minutes


    Multi Function

    Clicking this button will make the changes.

    Administration > Users > User Settings

    Miscellaneous settings that can be made by any user


    Individual settings, which only apply to the own user.




    Settings


    Here, various settings can be changed according to personal preferences, e.g. the "Date format", the "Decimal separator", the "Number of decimal places", the "Number of list entries", the "Sort order of projects", etc.

    Grayed settings have not yet been adjusted, i.e. these contain the specified original default values of your client.

    User settings that have already been adjusted can be reset to the original default value by checking the "Delete" checkbox in front of the corresponding setting value.

    A click on the "question mark" at the end of the line opens a separate help window for the corresponding setting value with an exact description of the change options.



    Field Descriptions

    Delete checkbox:

    Checkbox to mark the already customized user setting which should be reset to the original default value.

    Text:

    Text field

    Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

    Setting:

    Short description of the setting. Extracted settings have not been changed yet, i.e. these still have the original default value.

    Setting Value:

    Set value of the setting. This value can be changed according to personal preferences.

    questionmark:

    A click on this icon opens a separate help window for the corresponding setting value with an exact description of the change possibilities.


    Save

    Clicking this button saves the settings.

    Administration > Users > Password

    Change the individual password to log in to fx-project®


    The password should be changed regularly for security reasons. Passwords should not be names, birthdays, or other known information about a user, but should be random numbers and letters.




    Change password and activate user


    Here you can change your password.

    For security reasons, the old password must be entered in the top line and the new password in the bottom two lines.

    NOTE:
    By a password change, the user is automatically activated if this was locked or inactive!



    Field Descriptions

    Old Password:

    The "old" password must be entered in this field for security reasons.

    New Password:

    A personal password must be entered in this field. For your own security, the password should be at least six characters long, should not contain any "$" special characters, etc., and should not consist of any easily guessable sequences of letters or numbers such as "123456", "654321", "qwertz" etc.

    The password is stored internally in encrypted form, so that a new password must be requested if it is "forgotten".

    Repeat New Password:

    Please enter the new password again to avoid typos.


    Change

    A click on this button changes the password permanently.

    Administration > Users > Design

    Customize the appearance of the graphical user interface (GUI) of fx-project®


    Customize the appearance of the graphical user interface (GUI) of fx-project.




    List of all available designs


    Listing of all available designs with the possibility to select a design, create a new design based on an existing design, modify or delete an existing design.



    Field Descriptions

    GIF-Picture:

    Assigned image in PNG, JPG, GIF or BMP format.

    Design:

    Design Name.

    Action:

    Action number: 1 - display, 2 - edit, 3 - create, 4 - delete




    Design Editor


    Naming of the entire design, as well as the possibility of color matching of certain main design elements.



    Field Descriptions

    Design Name:

    Design Name.

    Text:

    Text field

    Variable text field that can be customized programmatically.

    Field:

    Contains the ID number of a field.

    Description:

    Explanatory descriptions, details, comments or similar.

    Setting:

    Assignment to the "Settings" table


    Save

    Button to save data.

    Back

    Jump back to the previous mask/page.

    Administration > Users > Data Filter Popup

    Filter settings in fx-project® can be named and help to reduce the amount of data and simplify e.g. extensive evaluations


    With the help of the data filter, the amount of data used can be reduced with regard to persons, time and projects. This restriction reduces the display and increases the clarity. For example, the number of projects can be reduced to two, so that the corresponding reports are only applied to these two projects.

    The filter can be switched on or off at the top right (red or green rectangle to the right of the filter symbol). In the masks in which the filter can be used, a filter symbol is visible in the selection mask of the program function in the upper right corner.




    Set filter criteria


    Data filter



    Field Descriptions

    Text Add. (Head):

    Text field for general text input.

    Title:

    In this field the official title of a person can be selected, e.g. "Professor", "Doctor" etc.

    Person:

    The field Person_Completed is identical with exactly one field "Name". It stands for a person who has completed a task/problem.

    This field normally has the same value as the field Person_responsible, unless the person who solved the problem would be different from the one who was initially responsible for the problem.

    Name:

    In this field the family name of the person or the name of the legal entity (e.g. company name) is displayed or entered.

    Project Team:

    Project Team:

    Group of people assembled as a team for a specific project.

    Superior:

    Field containing the Person_ID of the superior of a person.

    Department:

    Indicates the department in which the employee works.

    Person:

    blank

    Skill:

    Selecting a specific skill or skill group to group employees.

    Person Type:

    Indicates what type of person it is.

    Inactive:

    By setting the checkbox, inactive persons (employees, clients, etc.) will also be displayed.

    Date:

    Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

    Date Entry:

    With the help of the field "Date specification" you can directly display a desired day.

    This option is preferable if you want to "jump" over a longer period of time, because here only one date has to be entered instead of a tedious scrolling forward or backward.

    Act. Start:

    Indicates the start date of the respective reference object, e.g. projects, time data, travel data, etc.

    Act. End:

    The actual end date of the respective reference object, e.g. project, time data, travel data, etc. is displayed or specified here.

    Show Project:

    With the help of this field it can be selected how the projects of the employees should be displayed. If the field is selected, then each individual project of an employee is displayed in a separate line, otherwise all projects are displayed in one line, whereby in the case of a project overlap the name of the project with the higher start date is displayed. The employee workload is added up in both cases of project overlaps.

    Project:

    ALIAS field for project ID

    Name of Project:

    This field displays the project name of the currently selected project.

    Projects From:

    If this checkbox is activated, all projects from this start date will be displayed.

    Projects Until:

    If this checkbox is activated, all projects up to this date are displayed.

    Main Project:

    Top level of a project structure, under which all subprojects and tasks are subordinated.

    Customer:

    Here you can select the client of the activity (project, subproject or task).

    Project Manag.:

    Specifies which person should be the project manager of this project.

    This field only serves as a further decision criterion in various reports, the Project Manager does not enjoy any additional rights or similar, these lie exclusively with the 1st Project Leader.

    The Project Manager is only set in projects and is then also selected in the respective tasks of the project.

    Green displayed persons in the selection field are project managers, which are already assigned to at least one project in this role.

    Project managers are created using the role mask with role "Project Manager".

    1st Project L.:

    In this field the manager of a project is displayed or must be selected from a selection list. The project manager is defined once in the master project, and is then preselected as a PROPOSAL in all underlying projects.

    Green displayed persons in the selection field are project leaders, which are already assigned to at least one project in this role.

    Project managers are created using the role mask with role "Project Manager".

    Prj.-Category:

    Define filter categories for projects or select them in a selection field.

    Status:

    This field shows how far a project has already progressed. In input mode, you can assign an attribute from a selection list to a project here, which reflects whether or how far a project is already advanced.

    The status can also be used to decide whether project data should be included in a report or not.

    Priority:

    Indicates the urgency of the (sub)project.
    The higher the priority of a project, the higher it is displayed in the control panel of an employee.

    Displ. Tasks:

    Here you can define whether tasks (and possibly to-dos) should also be displayed in the project selection list or not. If this checkbox is not set, only projects and subprojects are displayed.

    Hide Archive:

    By setting this "archiving indicator", complete mother projects can be archived, i.e. the data is retained, but these projects are no longer displayed in the selection fields or in the project menu. This makes it possible to reduce the list of projects.
    A mother project can only be "archived" if it has already been completed, i.e. the status of the mother project and consequently of all subordinate projects must be set to "completed"
    .

    Only Order Pr.:

    If this field is activated in the filter settings, only projects generated from orders are displayed.

    Administration > Profile/User > Profile Names

    Manage profile names to which program functions with access rights can be assigned


    Several program functions (program parts) can be grouped together in the form of profiles and then assigned to the user. The profile names required for this can be assigned in this program function.




    User profile groups


    Create, activate and deactivate user profile groups.

    In User profile groups all activated (tick) and deactivated (no tick) user groups are displayed.

    In addition, an empty field is available to create a new user group.

    NOTE:
    $message_2257,groupname,2266;
    $message_2258;



    Field Descriptions

    Only Cust. Data:

    In Checkbox is indicated, which user group is active (hook) or inactive (no hook).

    Group Name:

    Group Name contains the names of the user groups.

    No.:

    Number of entries


    Multi Function

    Clicking this button will make the changes.

    Administration > Profile/User > Profile Program Assignment

    Assign individual program functions to a profile with definition of rights (display, create, change and delete)


    Program functions (individual programs) can be assigned to user profiles here. If, for example, an employee profile is created, the individual program functions are assigned by mouse click. It is possible not only to assign the program function, but also to assign the individual processing modes for each program function (if available), e.g. display, create, change or delete.




    Select profiles


    Select one or more profiles to which program functions are to be assigned.



    Field Descriptions

    User Profile Groups:

    In this field you can select the desired user profile group via a drop-down menu.


    Select

    Clicking on this button will forward the selected data.




    Set program permissions


    All program functions are displayed here.
    Permissions for individual program functions can be assigned to the selected profiles.
    Program functions displayed with blue text are program functions created by a user of the system using the TR 201 program.



    Field Descriptions

    Program Name:

    Name of the program function


    Program Name

    Button to save data.

    Administration > Profile/User > Profile Overview

    Listing of all profiles with the assigned program functions


    The created profiles of the client are listed here, including all assigned program functions.




    Program function assignment of the profiles




    Field Descriptions

    Program:

    Name of the program function

    Administration > Profile/User > User Definition

    Create users and assign them to an already created person


    The fx-project software is accessed via a user account which is protected by a password. A valid e-mail address must be assigned to the user so that he can be reached for generated mails. When defining the user, a user profile can also be assigned immediately. Furthermore, it is possible to define the data display regarding the costs. If the user is to receive administrative access rights, the corresponding check mark must be set in the assigned field. A user will always be assigned to a defined person (employee (internal / external) / client etc.).




    User selection


    Selection of the user to be edited.

    In the User selection one selects the desired user for further processing of the data.

    These can be displayed, created, changed or deleted in the User block depending on the action.

    The main administrator cannot be deleted and is therefore not displayed in this mode.

    NOTE:
    $message_2257,name_user,2262;
    $message_2258;



    Field Descriptions

    User:

    Users can be selected in User.


    Select

    Clicking on this button will forward the selected data.




    User block


    Change the data of the selected user.

    In User block you edit the data of the selected user.

    To change the data of another user, select the user in User selection.

    The main administrator cannot be deleted and is therefore not displayed in this mode.

    Use Administrator-Prg. to give the user administrator rights.

    New Password and Repeat New Password must match. If a password is entered it will be changed and the user will be activated if the user was inactive or locked. If no password is entered the user status will not be changed.

    The user's E-Mail-Address is the address to which all outgoing emails from the program are sent. Therefore, it should be correct and up to date.

    NOTE:
    $message_2257,userpersid,2263;
    $message_2258;



    Field Descriptions

    User Name:

    In User Name the account of a person is stored. This name, the password and the client ID are used to log into the system. The naming convention is freely chosen or determined by the company.

    User-ID:

    This User-ID is used to uniquely identify a user within a client.

    E-Mail-Address:

    The E-Mail-Address entered here is where all messages from the system for the user are sent. Therefore it should always be correct and up to date.

    Valid from:

    Date from which a record is valid.

    Login:

    The New Password contains the personal login password of a user. For your own security, simple passwords should not be used.
    If the password is forgotten, the owner can request a new one from the administrator and change it later.

    Administr.-Prg.:

    Administrator-Prg. specifies whether or not the user has administrator privileges and is allowed to use its programs as well.

    Valid to:

    Date until when a record is valid.

    Repeat Password:

    To prevent typing errors, the new password must be entered once again in the field Repeat New Password.

    Corresp. Person:

    Select in Corresponding Person the associated person of the user to access the data (projects, ...) of the person.

    Language:

    The language set.

    Costs:

    In Costs, permissions on cost fields are given or revoked to the user. This is useful if they give the customer view permissions on project data, but the customer is not allowed to see costs.

    User Prof. Grp.:

    In this field you can select the desired user profile group via a drop-down menu.


    Multi Function

    Clicking this button will make the changes.

    Administration > Profile/User > User Profile Assignment

    Assign defined profiles with program functions to a user or vice versa


    Any number of user profiles can be assigned to a user. Alternatively, it is possible to assign the corresponding users to a user profile. To assign a profile, the necessary license points of the profile must be activated on the points account. If a profile is withdrawn from a user, the assigned number of license points of the profile will be credited to the points account again. If the same program functions are available in different profiles (set of assigned program functions), the associated license points are only activated once as long as the program is available in one of the activated profiles.




    Selection mask


    Select users or user groups.

    In Selection mask you select the desired user or user group, to which user groups or users are assigned in Assignment mask.

    Users can only be assigned to active groups.

    NOTE:
    $message_2257,usergr_ID,2262;
    $message_2257,usergr_ID,2267;
    $message_2258;



    Field Descriptions

    User Profile Groups:

    In User Profile Groups you can select the user or group to which groups or users are to be assigned.


    Display

    By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.

    User Mode

    Clicking on the User Mode button switches to user mode.

    Group Mode

    Clicking on the button Group Mode switches to group mode.




    Assignment mask


    Assign users to groups or groups to users.

    In Assignment mask the desired user groups or users are assigned to the user or user group selected in Selection mask.

    Users can only be assigned to active groups.

    NOTE:
    $message_2257,usergr_ID,2262;
    $message_2257,usergr_ID,2267;
    $message_2258;



    Field Descriptions

    Only Cust. Data:

    A checkmark in Checkbox assigns users to groups or groups to users.

    User:

    User Name contains the names of the users or groups that are assigned to the selected group or user.


    Multi Function

    Clicking this button will make the changes.

    Administration > Profile/User > User Overview

    Overview of all existing users in the system


    The user overview lists all defined users with the assigned profiles and used license points. Activated special programs are also listed.




    User overview


    Listing of all existing users including the following information:

    • User info
      = User icon and username. Clicking on the name will take you to the detailed view of the user.
    • Person Name
      = Each user has exactly one person assigned to it. This person name is shown here in "blue". However, several users can be assigned to one person, e.g. for vacation replacements, for logging in with different profiles, etc.
    • E-mail address
      = the main e-mail address stored directly with the user. The assigned person of the user may contain other email addresses (in communication data).
    • User IS the main administrator
      = Per client, there is exactly one main administrator - this is deposited as the contact person of the client and has special rights, as well as specially assigned administrator program functions.
    • User IS an administrator
      = The user has been assigned administrator rights. There can be several administrators per client - these have special rights, as well as specially assigned administrator program functions.
    • PersonType
      = indicates the person type of the assigned person, e.g. employee internal or external, client etc.. According to the person type, the user has different rights, e.g. a client can not enter a vacation - this is reserved for the employee (internal) or similar.
    • Logins
      = Number of total logins in fx-project, as well as the date of the last login.
    • Default language
      = the language specified in the user settings. The language can be changed by the user himself at any time - prerequisite is: The language special program has been activated and the user has been assigned to the corresponding language profile group.
    • Default group
      = Each user is assigned to a default profile group with various default program functions, e.g. "Change password" or "Set user settings". If the user is an administrator, he is also assigned to the profile group "Admin program" with further standard program functions, e.g. "Create user", etc. These standard program functions are directly linked to the standard profile groups and can not be deleted.
    • User profile groups
      = Each profile group is assigned to different program functions.
    • Employee role
      = The employee roles are responsible for assigning permissions, e.g..For example, the general manager has by default right to all people and projects, whereas a project manager has rights only to projects that have been assigned to him, as well as to people who are assigned to his projects.
    >



    Field Descriptions

    Overview:

    Administration > Profile/User > User Accounts

    Activate, deactivate or generate a new password for users


    User accounts (user accesses) can be deactivated if required, i.e. the associated user profiles with the assigned license points are credited to the points account again. The same applies to activation, but in the opposite way. In addition, locked users whose access was locked after multiple incorrect password entries can be reactivated. In addition, a new password can be generated at the request of a user, which will be sent to the respective user by e-mail.




    Status control


    Action selection

    From Status control, Generate Password, Lift Lock, Activate User, and Deactivate User get to User status.



    Field Descriptions


    Display

    Generate Passw.

    In Generate Password a new password is generated and sent to the user via email.

    Lift Lock

    In Lift Lock, users who have repeatedly entered their password incorrectly are unlocked.

    Activate User

    Enable user

    In Activate User inactive users are reactivated.

    Deactivate User

    In Deactivate User active users are set to inactive.




    User status




    Field Descriptions

    Chk.:

    Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

    User Name:

    Date:

    Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

    Status:

    The current status of a user is stored in this field:
    0 - active (without SYS password) = without password automatically generated by the system after lock etc.
    1 - active (with SYS password) = with system-generated password via [Password gen.].
    2 - inactive
    3 - locked


    Chk.

    Clicking this button will make the changes.

    Administration > Access Rights > Overview of Rights

    Overview of assigned access rights


    All access rights of projects, documents and reports of a single person can be displayed.




    Select user and reference


    Select user and reference

    Select reference and user for which the existing rights are displayed.

    For projects, the project tree is displayed with authorized projects and paths that lead to authorized projects.

    In any case, only projects from the project menu are displayed (only the projects that the logged-in user is allowed to see and the same criteria that are selected in the project menu apply).

    The projects to which the selected user has rights are highlighted with darker background.



    Field Descriptions

    User:

    This field contains an internal key for each user entry (user ID).

    Reference:

    Selection of the reference for which the user has been assigned the rights.


    Accept

    Clicking this button saves the entered data and continues the program execution.




    User has explicitly assigned rights for the following references


    A list of projects, reports, documents, etc. for which the user has authorization is displayed.

    List is displayed for all selected users with authorization.

    This list includes: Projects, Reports, Documents, etc. (depending on the selected reference).

    The access rights for documents are assigned to individual actions.



    Field Descriptions

    Description:

    Designation of the data type.

    Disp.:

    This field specifies whether the related field or program function may be displayed for this profile.

    Crea.:

    This field specifies whether the relevant field may be created for this profile.

    Edit:

    Here you specify whether the field for this profile may be changed.

    Del.:

    This field indicates whether the related field for this profile may be deleted.

    Administration > Access Rights > General

    Assignment of access rights of users, user groups and departments to projects, persons, documents and reports


    In fx-project, extended rights to projects, documents and reports can be assigned in addition to the automatically generated access rights. Access rights can be granted to individual persons, groups of user profiles and their assigned users as well as departments. The type of access action (display, new creation, change, delete) can also be defined.




    Reference selection


    Reference for rights assignment

    Here, a reference category (projects, documents or reports) must first be selected and then a subcategory for this reference.

    If "Rights assignment" is called up from another program function, these values are already preset and are only displayed.



    Field Descriptions

    Reference:

    Selection of the reference for which the user has been assigned the rights.

    Rights:

    Primary key in table "Rights_Reference

    Number:


    Display

    By clicking on this button, the list is generated and displayed. Depending on the defined selection criteria, the list is filtered accordingly.




    Manage access rights


    Manage access rights

    In this screen, access rights can be assigned to specific departments, user groups or individual users.
    If the user already has a direct right to selected references (through his assignment to these or superordinate project), this is displayed with a blue background.

    The access rights for documents are assigned to actions and mean in detail:


    NOTE:
    All: All access rights are granted.

    retrieve: The user is allowed to download the document.

    check in/out: The user may download or upload the document for
    Down- or upload the document for editing. (In the meantime, the file may then only be downloaded.

    archive: The file will be archived and will not show up in future searches.

    delete: The file will be deleted.



    Field Descriptions

    Only Cust. Data:

    Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

    Description:

    Reference designation.

    All:

    By pressing Select All all checkboxes are preselected with a check mark. These changes must be confirmed with another button such as OK.

    Disp.:

    This field specifies whether the related field or program function may be displayed for this profile.

    Crea.:

    This field specifies whether the relevant field may be created for this profile.

    Edit:

    Here you specify whether the field for this profile may be changed.

    Del.:

    This field indicates whether the related field for this profile may be deleted.


    Save

    Button to save data.

    Administration > Access Rights > Projects

    Assignment of access rights of users, user groups and departments to projects




    Reference selection


    Reference for rights assignment

    Here, a reference category (projects, documents or reports) must first be selected and then a subcategory for this reference.

    If "Rights assignment" is called up from another program function, these values are already preset and are only displayed.

    Number:

    If the user already has a direct right to selected references (through his assignment to these or superordinate project), this is displayed with a blue background.

    NOTE:

    retrieve: The user is allowed to download the document.

    check in/out: The user may download or upload the document for
    Down- or upload the document for editing. (In the meantime, the file may then only be downloaded.

    archive: The file will be archived and will not show up in future searches.

    delete: The file will be deleted.

    Administration > Skills > Skill Groups

    Collective term for grouping specially acquired skills


    Manage (create, modify or delete) freely definable capability groups, i.e. higher-level categories of individual capabilities.




    Administration


    Viewing selected groups

    Selected groups are displayed, changed or deleted.



    Field Descriptions

    Only Cust. Data:

    Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

    Group:

    This field displays the individual employee skill groups, that is, the employee areas that they cover.


    Multi Function

    Clicking this button will make the changes.

    Administration > Skills > Skills

    Freely definable skills, i.e. learned or acquired knowledge


    Management (creation, modification or deletion) of freely definable skills. These skills can then be assigned to individual employees and evaluated in the corresponding program function (= skill management).




    Select group


    Select group

    Here the user can select a group and display the capabilities for it.



    Field Descriptions

    The individual ability groups of the employees can be selected.:

    In this field, the individual employee skill groups can be selected, i.e. the employee areas they cover. The selected group ID is stored internally.


    Accept

    Clicking this button saves the entered data and continues the program execution.




    Administration


    Skills

    The selected skills are displayed, changed or deleted here.



    Field Descriptions

    Only Cust. Data:

    Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

    Skill Name:

    This field contains the names of the skills of the individual persons, e.g. "English", "Russian" or similar as skills for the group "foreign languages".


    Multi Function

    Clicking this button will make the changes.

    Administration > Departments > Department Administration

    Administration of the department structure


    In fx-project, departments and department hierarchies with responsible department managers can be defined. Departments restrict the access rights of the administrator role for personal data when used, so that only assigned departments and the departments below them can be accessed.




    Manage departments


    Manage departments

    Departments can be defined here. Nesting in depth is possible. Departments are advantageous when selecting groups of people, etc.



    Field Descriptions

    Only Cust. Data:

    Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

    Department:

    Shows the department level with higher levels. e.g.: '0' - level 0 => company, '2-3' - subdepartment number 3, department number 2 etc.

    Name of Department:

    The department name is displayed in the mask with department level.

    Head of Department:

    Displays the head of a department.

    Superior Department:

    Specifies the parent department.

    Cost Center:

    Unique assignment number to a cost center.


    Multi Function

    Clicking this button will make the changes.

    Administration > Departments > Department Report

    Listing the department structure with department managers and assigned employees


    The department report lists all departments, their department heads and the persons assigned to them.




    Determine selection criteria


    Selection of the report and the highlighting criteria

    In Determine selection criteria the button Person in Department is used to request the desired data.



    Field Descriptions

    Department:

    In Department all departments are displayed.

    Person:

    In Person all Int. and Ext. employees are displayed.


    Accept

    Clicking this button saves the entered data and continues the program execution.




    Department list


    Persons and their departments

    In Department list persons and their departments are contrasted.

    In Determine selection criteria persons can be selected and thus highlighted.



    Field Descriptions

    Person in Department:

    People in departments

    Administration > Projects > Unblock Projects

    Send request to unblock blocked projects that are currently being edited by another person


    Listing of all currently blocked projects with the option to send a request to the person currently working on the project to unblock it.




    List of all currently blocked projects


    List of all currently blocked projects incl. all required information, who blocked which project and when. Additionally, the current status is displayed for each project, i.e. blocked, request sent, etc.

    Furthermore, a request for unblocking can be sent for the corresponding project, if not already done.



    Field Descriptions

    Main Project:

    Number and name of the project, which is currently edited by another person.

    Project Manager:

    Project manager of the project, which is currently processed by another person.

    1st Project Leader:

    Project manager of the project which is currently processed by another person.

    In Use by:

    Person who is currently editing this project.

    Time:

    Time since when this project is edited by another person today.

    Status:

    Time and status of the last executed action for this project.

    Action Code:

    Action button to send an "override request" or wait animation if a request has already been sent.

    Administration > Database > Database Backup

    Save or restore your own complete client data


    The database backup is used to save (= backup) and restore (= restore) the client's own data. A restore can only be made to the same version that was active at the time of the backup. Licensing information is excluded from this. Furthermore, obsolete database backups can be deleted, and current ones can be displayed or downloaded in the browser.




    Database backups


    Listing of all database backups of the current client.

    Depending on the action selected, the database can be backed up, restored or a backup file deleted.



    Field Descriptions

    Only Cust. Data:

    Activate or deactivate an entry by placing a tick in the "checkbox".

    Date:

    Used to enter or display a date of the day. If a date entry is required, the default value (today's date) is usually already preset.

    Version:

    The version number is incremented by 0.001 when a changed document is saved normally, and by 1 when a version change is explicitly requested or when the floating point range overflows (for 999 changes without a version change).

    Manually changed versions are saved as a new file and activated, the old version is marked as inactive.

    File Name:

    The name of the generated file must be entered in this field.

    Size:

    This field indicates the physical size of the file. With this information you can estimate, for example, how long a download would take with the usual bandwidth (-> Internet access).

    Link:

    This field is optional. If a link is entered, the automatic user rights query is bypassed and the Trans_ID field is cleared.


    Delete

    After pressing the button Delete the selected records will be deleted. If the record is still needed, you will receive an error message.

    Administration > Database > Database Tables

    Listing of individual database tables in fx-project®


    The structure of individual database tables in fx-project can be listed here at field level with attributes and description.




    Select table


    Select table
    Select a table.



    Field Descriptions

    Table:

    In mask this field is a selection field to select a certain individual table.

    If no individual table is selected, text file will be created for all individual tables. Alias to ID_Tables.

    Table Type:

    Type of table.
    1 - SystemTable,
    2 - Data,
    3 - Test,
    4 - Individual.

    Complete:

    Clicking this button will list the complete content.


    Display




    Definition of the table fields


    Definition of the fields of a table.

    All fields of a table are displayed.
    You can also see in which tables the respective field is still used.
    If there are alias names for a field, these are shown in brackets in the respective table. The table name is stored with a link and can be displayed in a new window.



    Field Descriptions

    PKey:

    Primary key in corresponding table.

    Pos.:

    Position of this value in the listing, i.e. where the entry should be placed.

    Field Name:

    Specifies the name of the field.

    When creating a field, make sure that the name is unique.

    FieldType:

    In the case of "DATE" and "TIME", this field determines how the mask generator formats the corresponding field. An alias field must be defined for the field to be formatted using SQL.

    Length:

    Length of the field. For most fields, certain restrictions apply here (e.g. text maximum 256 characters long).

    If one of these restrictions is violated, the program automatically takes over the correction.

    NNull:

    This field must be output,

    Index:

    blank

    Clst.:

    Indicates whether the field may contain duplicate values.

    Description:

    Explanatory descriptions, details, comments or similar.

    Administration > Database > Login Logs

    Log of the logins of a client, sorted by date or user


    In the program function, the access logs of the users can be listed sorted by time or user. The DB logs button can be used to display registered database errors, which are automatically sent to the manufacturer by e-mail in the event of an error.

    Administration > Help > Info

    Information regarding this fx-project® version


    Display of the current version of fx-project as well as the manufacturer information.

    Administration > Help > Manual

    Manual with help texts of all program functions for fx-project®


    Detailed description of all program functions and masks.

    Administration > Help > Check for Updates

    Perform online check to determine whether new updates or patches are available.


    When executed, an online check is performed to see if new updates and/or patches for the currently installed fx-project version are available on the fx-project homepage.
